story:
We are a design collective named 'Embassy for the Displaced'. Operating between London, Athens and Lesvos island, we design within -and for- the refugee crisis that unfolds all the way from Afghanistan, through the Middle East and Greece, into western Europe. We approach design as a social necessity and a tool not only towards survival, but also towards dignity. 

NoBorders Backpack is our main project. Using nothing but materials sourced along the coasts of Lesvos island, NE Greece, a 50-60lt waterproof backpack was designed and built to be handed out to refugees for their long journey through Europe.

The rubber comes from the dinghies that make the perilous crossing from Turkey to Greece, while the straps, clips and shoulder cushions are scavenged from discarded life vests. The backpack is large enough to fit a few pairs of winter clothes, blankets and a sleeping bag, while it is easily sewn together out of a few rubber pieces. One dinghy can produce about 20 bags. It was designed in Athens by the design collective 'Embassy for the Displaced' along with bag manufacturer 'Three Legs and a Model'. The production will be kindly hosted at the PIKPA self-organised refugee camp in Mytilene, Lesvos.

As rubber dinghies arrive on the coast of Lesvos, a huge amount of debris is accumulating on the shores. Piles of life vests and remains of boats are abandoned upon arrival. Many end up in the sea, or get buried in the sand to be discovered by future archaeologists, a testimony to this tragic journey, as well as an environmental liability for the island. At the same time, refugees have enough dry clothes, blankets and sleeping bags, but are underequipped when it comes to waterproof bags that can fit their few belongings and last them through the journey. Using the rubber that comes from the dinghies to make durable, waterproof backpacks and other survival tools tackles both problems at once.

The Embassy for the Displaced is looking for design-for-survival solutions to the refugee crisis that is unfolding in the Greek islands, all the way to western Europe, starting from backpacks and other accessories designed to respond to the particular necessities of the refugees in their journey.

If governments do not wish to assist these people in their quest for safety, then citizens, be it lifeguards, volunteers, or designers, should at least try.

The people to execute the project are already in place, what we are missing is funds for infrastructure. We are seeking your help to establish a small production line on the island of Lesvos. The first £10000 will be used for purchasing three professional sewing machines, along with the few materials that we can't source from boats or life vests, such as thread and elastic cord. Local volunteers involved in making the bags will be awarded a monthly pay, while we hope to use any additional donations to fund our research lab, in order to be able to visit the island regularly and to continue producing prototypes of new design ideas. While the actual cost for a backpack is substantially lower, £10 is sufficient to fund the production of one bag, given the added costs of equipment purchases, transportation et-al. The more backpacks we produce, the lower their cost will be, eventually reaching a minimum of around £2. Approximately 1000 people make it to Lesvos daily during the winter, a number that is expected to rise exponentially during the summer months, and we are hoping to provide as many as we can with backpacks.

We need your support in order to keep providing displaced people with free, high-resilience backpacks for their difficult journey.

story:
Short Summary

Welcome to Jah-Min Tours!   Our mission is simple:   Empower the tourist\traveler to Jamaica, by providing a personal touring and travel experience, while helping its elementary schools.  

As a commitment to its travelers, Jah-Min Tours will not have any allegiance to any specific tour operator or company.   This doesn't benefit you, the traveler.   When touring companies have allegiances this translates to someone else telling you where to go, when, and for how long. Wouldn't you like to visit a destination, where you're in control?  This is what Jah-Min Tours brings. Empowering the traveler.    You, as the traveler will be free to select what will make your visit to Jamaica the best travel experience.  However, this is only the beginning....

As the Founder, I am not only committed to delivering a personal touring experience to the traveler, but to give back to the Jamaican community by financially contributing to its elementary schools.   Its not only important to me to provide a one-of-a-kind personal experience to the traveler, but to also be charitable to its local community.  

My name is Syian Wignal Sr, the Founder of Jah-Min Tours, and I'm originally from Jamaica.   I migrated over a decade here to the U.S.   One of the most attractive attributes I admired of the U.S. was the entrepreneurial spirit.  In addition, I noticed what also came along with this spirit of entrepreneurship, was the charitable actions from these companies to its local community. It wasn't only the primary focus to provision a service to customers by these companies, but help the local community.    

In order for me to mirror the above, I thought about a service business I wanted to launch, and be able to help Jamaican elementary schools simultaneously.  I realized many touring companies provide nice, "canned" touring packages for the Jamaican traveler.  However, once the tour ended, the customer is left to figure on their own how to get from one destination to another.  If you were traveling, wouldn't you want to feel like you're in control of where you want to go, and when?   As travelers we all want a taste of the "1%" lifestyle and treatment.   Especially if you are going somewhere exotic like Jamaica!   This is where I got the idea to create a modern service that offers a unique, and personalize way of touring, and traveling thru Jamaica.

Each year Jamaican travel continues to increase.  In fact in 2015 it was a record breaking year for both airline and cruise liners to Jamaica! This means more "canned" tours at an increased cost, and cramped shuttles.  Wouldn't you, the traveler want the opposite?  Wouldn't you want it to be just you, a loved one,  or simply a small group of friends?  Wouldn't you want to see Jamaica on your schedule vs. the standard touring company package, where you fit your schedule to them?  All the while knowing a portion of what you paid is going to help elementary schools?   

This is what Jah-Min Tours wants to bring to you the traveler!   With such a service the traveler will feel as if they were part of the luxurious"1%'er" lifestyle.   Wouldn't you feel refreshed and special when returning home vs. feeling if you were part of a cattle herd, and then need a vacation from your vacation?   This is what Jah-Min Tours is offering a touring\traveling experience without being part of the traveling herd.   

What We Need & What You Get

We obviously need your assistance to get this started.  In short, we need seed money so we can accommodate the expenses below:

  • $15,000 to launch and cover these expenses:
    • Jamaican Business Regulation Fees
    • Jamaican Operating Licenses & Taxes
    • Vehicle Expansion
    • Office Overhead (Its required by Jamaica to have an office) 
    • Marketing Initiatives (Its required by Jamaica we have printed brochures, and uniforms)
    • Website Development
  • The amount you contribute will go toward your touring\travel purchase price with us when you visit Jamaica!  (We want to meet our funders!)
  • We are aware of the risk that comes with crowdfunding.   Not all crowdfunding opportunities meet their goals.  If we do not reach our goal, depending on the amount raised we will seek other investment partners to help us complete our goal.   Your funds will still be applied to the above expenses.   We will provide transparency with our communication as we seek other investment partners.   In an extreme situation where we missed our goal by a significant amount we will return all funds.   

The Impact

Your contribution will not only help us get launched, but help us disrupt the way people tour and travel Jamaica.  Most importantly, it will help us begin to help the elementary school have a better education.    Plus, they will have the opportunity to learn, and appreciate the results when successful entrepreneurship and charitable actions are partnered.   It only helps build stronger communities where disadvantages are present. 

Risks & Challenges

As with any new product or service there are risks.    Some of the risks we are aware of are:

  • A competitor realizes what we are attempting to accomplish, and attempts to duplicate.
  • Convincing competitors customers to give us a try
  • Jamaican regulation changes
  • U.S. & European economic climate impacts on Jamaican tourism. 

Some of the above risks and challenges are not within our control, but others are.   The first two serve as examples we can mitigate.  This is where our advantage lies.    It will require the standard touring and taxi companies to adjust their business model and price points, which can be costly to them.   Also, they will have to alter their brand from "mass touring" to providing a "1%er" touring and traveling experience.    This give us the edge because our brand is from the beginning to give you, the traveler the modern, personal "1%er" treatment.     

Another risk that can be mitigated is with Jamaican regulations.   I am very familiar with Jamaican regulations, how it operates, the process, and where the news is published.   This is due to time spent with Jamaican Board of Tourism.   This will help Jah-Min Tours remain informed when possible regulation(s) are gong to change.   

As the business climate, regulations change Jah-Min Tours will be committed to being transparent with this information to its funders by communicating such information regularly.

Other Methods of Contributing

If you are unable to contribute at this time, then all we ask is you share this page on your social media pages for others to consider funding!  IndieGogo has some share tools you can use to promote this page, so we please request for you to take advantage of such tools.  

Thank you very much for taking the time to read our information, and contribute.   We look forward to meeting and servicing you when you arrive in Jamaica!

story:
As the founder of My Aloha Paddle and Surf, Charlotte's leading and original Stand Up Paddle Company, our biggest success has been getting more people active and enjoying our amazing natural resources here in Charlotte and contributing to local charities and our community. 

We are locally operated and locally owned, and will continue to work with at least 12 local charities so we can be a blessing to others though our success.  

Your contribution allows us to expand these fun and fit activities throughout the Charlotte area, provide more jobs, and continue to make Charlotte great!!

A Win-Win!!

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal of $30,000 will be used to establish new locations and will go towards purchasing additional Cycleboats.  In return, you receive a discounted ticket to be one of the first to experience a Charlotte's first!!  Gratuitous pictures along with social posts showing you and your friends being one of the first!!!   All contributors will also be enrolled in our CCB (Charlotte Cycleboats) VIP Program.  The VIP program will offer priority booking for groups and discounted rates for future Cruises.

The Impact
Just as we have with Stand Up Paddleboarding, unique attractions and activities provide a memorable experiences for not only our local residents, but also for visitors and tourists from around the country that when returning home can speak about Charlotte, how amazing the people are, outstanding customer service, and how much fun they experienced while visiting.  When they return with their friends and family, they strengthen our economy by enabling other local businesses to thrive.  Just as we have with My Aloha Paddle and Surf, we are committed to donate up to 10% of our annual profits to local charities and back to our community. 

We are committed to bringing you a tremendously fun and safe new party experience on the water, and won't settle for anything less. Our waterfront location in Cornelius is already in place and with able parking, private Lake access and the commitment to the highest level of service.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: When will the tours start?
A: Our boats are custom, and built to our specifications, from the ground up.  Pending manufacturing delays, we are expecting to have the first boat in the water at the beginning of the summer season (June 21st)

Q: Where is Charlotte Cycleboats located?
A: The first location is at the Waterfront at the Waterstreet Seaport center in Cornelius, NC (less than a mile from Birkdale). Additional locations will be announced for 2018 season.

Q: Can I bring food and drink?
A: Yes, passengers are allowed to bring beer, wine and soft drinks on the tour. No hard alcohol is permitted.

Q: Do all passengers need to be 21+?
A: For tours that are listed 21+, all other tours are open to any age 13 years old and up. If the full boat is chartered for a private party, all ages are welcome. Any children under 13 years old must wear a life jacket on the boat at all times and on the docks.

Q. What if we get tired of pedaling or it gets windy?
A. We have an eco-friendly electric motor that we can use to assist if needed.

Q: Is there a bathroom?
A: We will be providing a portable restroom if needed.  

Q: How many people need to pedal to power the boat?
A: The boat requires a minimum of six passengers. If the minimum is not met, your tour may be rescheduled to a different time or date.

Q: How hard is the pedaling?
A: Pedaling is as hard or easy as the group decides, we can adjust the resistance!

Q: Do we need to bring a Designated driver?
A: No, the boat is charter by a tour guide and captain, you just have fun and enjoy being on the water.

Q: Can I move around the boat?
A: Yes. You are free to walk around the deck and enjoy the glide.

Q: What should I wear?
A: Dress appropriate to the weather, sunglasses and hats are great, comfortable clothes but you will be seated under a large canopy if needed, shielding the tour from direct sun and rain. 

Q: Do I need to wear a life jacket?
A: We supply very minimal, manual inflation waist life jackets are available on board, by request, Coast Guard approved life jackets are available for everyone in the case of an emergency.

Q: Is the boat wheelchair accessible? 
A: Yes, there is 4-5 additional seats without pedal stations. 
​
Q: What is the cancellation policy?
A: Cancellations at least 48 hours in advance will be refunded at no cost. Canellations within 48 will recieve a full value Cruise voucher for a future cruise. No refund is available if you cancel the cruise within 24 hours before the cruise. If a trip is canceled by CCB due to weather, the trip will be rescheduled at your convenience, or refunded 100%

Other ways to help - Social Media!!  Let your friends and family know about us through:

Facebook- Charlotte Cycleboats

Instagram - Charlotte Cycleboats

Twitter - CLT Cycleboats

story:
FUNING BOARD can convert most long board into electric ones in a few seconds

FUNING BOARD consists of remote control, power wheel &suspension parts, battery control unit and connector. The connector only weights 100g that can be placed on board all the time. Power wheel &suspension parts and battery control unit are connected by buckles which is very convenient for disassembly and assembly. The power battery of can be replaced, you can take more batteries if you need.

FUNING BOARD has different ways to play

Option 1:

Turn your board into electric ones in seconds, convert to your normal board in seconds. So that your own board not only can take you for a long trip, but also can bring you joy as a normal board.

 

Option 2:

Replace the original bracket of the long board with the power wheel bracket of FUNING BOARD, then it becomes a traditional four-wheel electric skateboard which can replace the battery.

There are more different ways to play waiting to be explored!

suspension self-adaption design

The special designed hanging device can be applicable to board shapes with different levels.

Equip dual motor

We want to make you feel awesome, so we do not using a single motor.

Maximum speed: 20 mph(32 KM/H).

800 W / Per motor.

Safe , smart and replaceable power battery

A single battery can travel 11.1 miles(18 KM)

Sine wave motor drive

3 speed modes

Easy to carry

 

In factory

story:
Partnered with P.T Pacific Aviation (http://www.p-aviation.com)

Introducing Bali Air Adventure

Bali Air Adventure is organized to provide scheduled passenger air transport service from Bali Benoa Harbor to Gili Trawangan in Lombok. BAA will offer "Morning Scenic Tours", "Gili Transfers" and "Afternoon Sunset Tours"

Bali Air Adventure is in the process of raising capital towards providing the necessary infrastructure, operating contracts and government certificates to allow for the commencement of schedule service in July 2017. We believe BAA business strategy is right and financially sound. We will provide efficient air transportation, offering excellent service to our guest at fares that is competitive, allowing BAA to be a long term success in the business.

 

Vision Statement

Bali Air Adventure strives to become a leading seaplane air transport in Indonesia applying best practices of the industry.

 

The Team

Our management team is prepared to perform and to contribute to the success of this project. The Bali Air Adventure team will be compromised of people who have many years of experience in the airline, travel and aviation industry.

With a passion for the travel industry, we require an extra push to get this project off the ground!

 

Transportation With Comfort

Our Product is a Twin Otter Seaplane aircraft with 19 seats. The seats will be exclusive in luxury leather. All seats will be equipped with multi language audio so that our guest will be able to listen to guided tours while enjoying the scenic flight. The audio will be in twelve languages, English, Chinese, Japanese, Korean, Russian, French, Spanish, Germany, Indian, Arabian, and Netherland and certainly in Indonesian language. The audio guide will provide our guest with information on Indonesia, Bali and also explanation on special places that we fly through. The service onboard will include exclusive meal boxes which contain main meals, light snacks, refreshments, water and tropical juice.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Due to obvious start-up costs relating to the technical, aircraft, training, marketing, promotions, corporate and IT aspects of Bali Air Adventure - we need your help!

Our goal is to raise $100,000 to kick start this project off the ground and we want you guys to believe in us!

If you like what you see, we please ask for a small backing through our "Support Bali Air Adventure" perk. You will be acknowledged through our Facebook page.

If you love what you see, we please ask for a small backing through our "Believe In Bali Air Adventure" perk. You will be acknowledged through our web site.

If you want to be one of the first passengers to experience Bali Air Adventure's "Morning Scenic Tours" redeem our perk at a discounted price today.

All backers will receive one electronic ticket. Valid for any period of time. Terms and conditions apply.

If you want to be one of the first passengers to experience Bali Air Adventure's "Afternoon Sunset Tours" redeem our perk at a discounted price today.

All backers will receive one electronic ticket. Valid for any period of time. Terms and conditions apply.

If you want to be one of the first passengers to exclusively experience Bali Air Adventure's "Gili Island Transfer" redeem our perk at a discounted price today.

All backers will receive one electronic ticket. Valid for any period of time. Terms and conditions apply.

Our "Trust In Bali Air Adventure" perk is for those of you who truly believe this is what Bali needs and that we will take this project above and beyond (quite literally). Through this perk, you will be acknowledged on our Facebook page, mentioned on our website, receive a Bali Air Adventure t-shirt, Bali Air Adventure hat, personalised handwritten postcard thanking you for your contribution and two e-tickets for any of our guided tours/transfers.

If you've got a group of friends we have the perfect package for you - You and four friends can receive our "VIP Experience" perk which will see you fly a special Afternoon Sunset Tour journey with Bali Air Adventure which includes: Best seats in the house, Champagne on arrival, Complimentary beverages and a Personal butler whilst enjoying a smooth ride over the Bali ocean with panoramic views and epic sunset snaps.

If we don't reach our current goal of $100,000 in 60 days. Don't worry - we can assure you that Bali Air Adventure will still continue forward and your appreciated funding will be used to help the project move along. All electronic tickets will still be redeemable once transportation begins.

 

The Why

The land transport to and from Gili all and all requires more than 7 hours journey, in comparison to our transfer time of 40 minutes. The land transfer would require journey within Bali (to Padang Bay), then four hours ferry, then 1 hour journey in Lombok and boat transfer for another hour from Lombok to Gili Islands.

Bali as the main tourism destination in Indonesia is going from strength to strength. The visitors into Bali in 2015 was totaling to 8 million, this is split between international and domestic visitors. The tourism industry is supported by better infrastructure throughout the island. The government recently completed the renovation of Ngurah Rai International airport and layover of both national and regional public roads.

In essence we believe that the tourism industry is sustainable in Bali therefore our business to support tourism will be viable. Our observations also indicate that the tourism sector in the nearby island such as Lombok, Sumba is growing exponentially. The Gili Island in Lombok is now one of the favourite destinations for Australians and tourists from Jakarta and other major cities in Indonesia.

 

The Challenge

A  seaplane air transport for scenic tours is a new style of business in Bali. With a business idea such as Bali Air Adventure, we understand that we are in the early stages of start-up with high costs. Our goal is to purchase the 19 seater DHC06-Twin Otter plane outright. Therefore, we require as much raised capital towards this adventure to further commence this operation.

 

Share This Campaign

If you've stumbled across our campaign and don't have the funds to back us, that's fine too! If you could spare 5 minutes of your time to Share it through Indiegogo's share tools whether that be through Facebook, Twitter, Email or just sending the link around to your friends!

A simple share can go a long way.
story_txt:

Introducing Bali Air Adventure
Bali Air Adventure is organized to provide scheduled passenger air transport service from Bali Benoa Harbor to Gili Trawangan in Lombok. BAA will offer "Morning Scenic Tours", "Gili Transfers" and "Afternoon Sunset Tours"
Bali Air Adventure is in the process of raising capital towards providing the necessary infrastructure, operating contracts and government certificates to allow for the commencement of schedule service in July 2017. We believe BAA business strategy is right and financially sound. We will provide efficient air transportation, offering excellent service to our guest at fares that is competitive, allowing BAA to be a long term success in the business.

story:
A casual conversation between two brothers has led to the villagers of Fethard on Sea embarking on a project to commemorate the sacrifice and bravery of the Helen Blake lifeboat men by building a replica of the Helen Blake Lifeboat.
 
In February 1914 the Helen Blake Lifeboat was launched to assist the crew of a Norwegian schooner, Mexico, which was in distress off the Keeragh Islands, approximately 6km to the east of the small fishing village of Fethard on Sea. 
 
During the daring rescue, the Helen Blake was wrecked and 9 of her 14 crew perished many leaving wives and young children.  However, their heroic effort together with those of the crews of the Rosslare, Kilmore, Wexford and Dunmore East Lifeboats saved the entire crew of the Mexico except one.
 
In 1915 a memorial monument was erected in the centre of Fethard Village and to date remains the only constant reminder of the unparalleled bravery of these RNLI volunteers. 
 
2014 marked the centenary of the tragedy and befittingly a number of events were held in honour of these courageous Helen Blake Lifeboat men.  Following the commemoration ceremony at the monument brothers, David and Keith Power, descendants of a Helen Blake crew member, came up with the idea that it would be a fitting tribute if a replica lifeboat could be built.  A committee was set up, initial funding secured, a feasibility study undertaken, the specification put together and the project started to take shape. 
 
It is anticipated that it will take 18 months to build the boat and funds are required for the materials.  We need to raise €20,000 to cover the cost of khaya, the special timber required for the hull, rigg and deck.
 
Local unemployed 18-25 year olds will be part of the team building the boat.  They will gain valuable training and experience in carpentry and boat building skills under the supervision of a local shipwright, which will hold them in good stead for future employment once the project is completed.  
 
The replica Helen Blake will offer locals and tourists alike the opportunity to relive history, tracing the journey of the RNLI volunteers on the original Helen Blake Lifeboat  from Fethard Dock to the site of the rescue of the Norwegian crew.
 
Your contributions to this very worthwhile project will enable us to purchase the timber to build the Helen Blake replica.  The project will benefit the local community; provide training and employment for 18-25 year olds; add an extra dimension to tourism on the Hook Peninsular and honour the 9 brave men who gave their lives to save the crew of the Mexico.
 
Please help us to make this dream come true and recognise the bravery of those RNLI volunteers lost and those who are risking their lives today - we can only do it with your help.
 
Thank you

story:
Brought together by British Polar Explorer, Felicity Aston, an international team of women from across Europe and the Middle East will set out to ski the last degree to the North Pole in April 2017. The expedition will face many physical challenges – temperatures down to -40°C, polar bears and shifting pack ice - but the core purpose of the expedition is to foster greater dialogue and understanding between women from Western and Arabian cultures. In addition, the expedition will work to inspire all women to reach beyond the expectation of others and to fulfill their own ultimate life ambitions.

....but before they can do that, they need to learn the skills that will allow them to succeed in the Arctic. They need some training.

The expedition plans to meet for the first time and complete their first training expedition in Iceland during September 2016. They will spend a few days on the South coast of Iceland learning the skills needed to travel in winter conditions (camping on snow, skiing, rations, clothing) before heading out onto one of the largest glaciers in Europe to complete a five day training expedition. Not only will this be a vital opportunity for the women (many of whom have no previous expedition experience) to learn how to travel across icy terrain - but the team will also have a chance to bond as a group and to begin to share their experiences with others through the website.

The team are a group of women brought together  from some 1000 applicants across Europe and the Middle East.

The team ranges in age from 26 to 47 and represents a diverse variety of occupations, backgrounds, perspectives and levels of experience in the outdoors. Within the team are journalists, scientists, teachers, wives, mothers, businesswomen, creatives, outdoor professionals and a wide range of skills. What each member of the team has in common is a commitment to the wider community and the determination to make the world a better place.

You can meet the team on our expedition website at:

www.euroarabianexpedition.com


What we need....

Every team member involved in the training expedition is committed to raising funds to pay for their own flight to Iceland and contributing something to the total cost. However, in order for it to be possible for women from all financial positions to be a part of the team, we need some help!

The total cost of the training expedition in Iceland will be £10,000. This includes money for food, transport in Iceland, some equipment, accommodation for the first few days of the expedition, insurance, and communications so that we can share as much as possible with those following the journey through the internet and social media - all for 13 people.

Any amount raised that exceeds what we need for the Iceland training expedition will be put towards the North Pole expedition in 2017. If we fail to reach our campaign target, we will still use any funds raised here and honour any promised pledges but will look to find the shortfall via other means.

What we can give in return....

An important aim of the expedition is to get as many people as possible enthused and inspired by taking them along with us on our journey. The pledges are designed to allow people to do that - either as individuals or as groups/schools/clubs. We take the pledges very seriously as a team and will work hard to make sure that they deliver a unique perspective for those that join us as virtual team members.
If you are unable to support us by buying a pledge, don't worry! We'd still love to have you along on our journey by following us on social media. It would also be really useful if you could spread the world about what we are doing.

In particular, if you know or are associated with anyone who might be interested in becoming a sponsor of either the Iceland Training Expedition or the North Pole Expedition, please do let them know about our website!

story:
WHERE THAT TO USE?

Qtok gives you an opportunity to be in correspondence with a real human interpreter,

send files for translation, and communicate via phone and speaker.

Even in case of poor connection you can also use voice memo and chat.

 

    

OUR ADVANTAGES

Everyday we work hard to make life of our clients
better and happier

 

WHY QTOK?

 

THE IDEA

We've come up with the idea while sitting in a German hospital and witnessing a patient hire an interpreter to help him communicate with a doctor. The interpreter demanded a full 3-hour pay, though the actual conversation lasted roughly 20 minutes!

We had a thought: "Why don't we create a simple way to get a full live translation in your smartphone?"

In your international travels, there are hundreds of cases when you could've used some help in translating and communicating with locals. You don't always need an expensive translator with an academic background, but you're likely to need an immediate translation when registering in a foreign hotel, or trying to communicate with local medical or legal officer. Imagine now, that you've got a mobile live translator app with real human translator right in your pocket for any occasion. That is exactly what we've created with Qtok!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

PERKS

We will be grateful if you help us make our product better.
If you choose to back us on IndieGoGo, you will receive a thank-you reward along with discount and pre-paid vouchers for our app. And even more — our brand t-shirt or a stickerpack!
Business-perk-backers additionally receive a lifetime discount on our services and a personal manager for your account for 3 years!
We deeply appreciate your feedback and are always open to your suggestions. We are fully invested in the process and always aim to make our service as comfortable to our clients as possible!

We will appreciate if you tell your friends about our service.

 

FAQ

 

Q: When will your service be fully operational?

A: Currently most features in the app work as a demo. However, we plan on delivering both multifunctional and specialized builds on November 2017.


Q: How will I make sure that you can help me in the exact date and time I need it?

A: You can book an interpreter's service in certain date and time in advance.

Q: Does the cost depend on the time of the day?

A: No, he fee is the same irrespective of booking type and remains the same 24 hours a day.

Q: How much will you charge me if my conversation with your translator is shorter than I expected?

A:  When using a paying mode in Qtok, the billing is per-second and fixed-rate. The 15-minutes conversation will cost about 15-20 dollars, you don't have to pay for an hour as other standard tariffs demand. By eliminating most of the ‘middlemen’ between the client and the executor, we can drastically reduce the consumer cost without affecting the performer’s fee.

Q: Is it possible to learn a language using your service?

A: Yes, of course!  Some translators are pleased to teach you the language you need  because they have a teaching experience as well.

Q: How can I access my translated  documents?

A: All your translated documents are saved in your phone /device and available offline.

Q: How can I make sure that I will get accurate and reliable translation of my documents?

A: In document translation, you can explain to an interpreter in your language all the subtleties you want to be conveyed which is impossible to do when using an electronic translator. All our translators are qualified experienced specialists.

Q: What if the translator I have chosen and discussed the subtleties is not available in the time of my emergency?

A: If your favorite interpreter isn't available when you need him/her, you can easily access experts in our broad Qtok base. We are working hard to employ professional translators from all over the world.

Q: Can I rely on your service in holding meetings and negotiations in foreign language?
A: You can prepare for a meeting in advance and choose one or two Qtok interpreter.

story:
Be Seen. Make Sure your Intentions are Known.

Stop, just stop. We all have to - wouldn't it be great if the car behind you knew you were going to brake before your paths met? Our taillight switches from a flash pattern to all lights active, looking just like the brake light all drivers are used to seeing.

 

Turn Signal

There's only one hand gesture cars recognize. Who can see them in the dark?  Our Warthog system not only indicates when you are braking, but also indicates when and in which direction you are turning!

 

Flash Pattern

We have 4 flash patterns.


Low, with a pattern of 2 lights, can run for 33 hours,
Medium, with a pattern of 4 lights, can run for 23 hours,

High flash, with a pattern of alternating 8 and 4 lights flashing can run for 14 hours,
While Our Ultra flash has all 12 lights flashing.

Pssst! There's a super secret fifth flash pattern with no flashing lights running, which adds extra emphasis to the brake and turn signals. Don't use this unless you have another light running!

The taillight is also smart enough to remember which pattern you used the time before.

Mounting

The control unit mounts on the handlebars with a pair of slim zip ties whose heads nestle inside the base of the unit. Once it's mounted, you will only need to remove the cover to replace the coin cell battery that powers it.

The taillight mounts to your seat post or rack, or clip it to your saddle bag or clothing. They're light weight; Wear several! Each can be configured to work with the same control unit, and each taillight can be set for different functions (left or right turn signal, brake only, etc.) to make your intentions even more clear. Each taillight can be configured to work with multiple control units, making it easy to move the taillights from bike to bike.

 

Technical Details

Who We Are

We are three friends who love bikes and technology. Commuting by bike has been the main means of transportation for Alex for over a decade. Having close calls with unruly drivers led to our desire to find a means to make us safer, and we've found it!

Alex Applegate
Chief Executive Officer / Co-Founder


With over 30 years of customer service and supply chain experience, Alex runs day to day operations. This understanding of business operations and bicycle commuting will push the company forward with successive product ideas, while keeping an eye towards continually improving the product. In his past employment at multinational high tech companies, he has handled large million dollar accounts, working with all aspects of operations from finance, sales and manufacturing, to ensure that parts are where they need to be. He intends to have a hands on approach to customer service.

A long time bicyclist, Alex has ridden his daily commuter bike (a Diamondback road bike, converted to a single speed) for over 50,000 miles on the streets of Dallas, TX and Albuquerque, NM, where he now lives. As a result, he knows the needs and constraints placed upon cyclists and this vision has shaped the Warthog's development. He is currently restoring a 1972 Raleigh Grand Prix, and hopes to ride it in an Eroica, which he is working to create here in New Mexico.
 

Jeff Weaver
Chief Technology Officer / Co-Founder

Before becoming CTO at rfCYCLE, Jeff accumulated thirty-five years of R&D experience in a variety of challenging projects from designing flight-control systems manufactured in New Mexico to producing wireless consumer devices assembled in China. As president of his own electronic product design company for twenty years, Jeff designed and manufactured a multitude of custom wireless devices for customers across the USA.  Since Jeff's childhood, the thought of becoming an electrical engineer, designing electronic circuits and being a major contributor in running a successful business was always in the forefront.  Today, as CTO of rfCYCLE, Jeff is excited to be taking yet another step up on the ladder of success.

After graduating from college in electrical engineering, Jeff moved to Albuquerque, New Mexico, to work for one of the largest aerospace companies in the country. Always an athlete growing up in Kansas, Jeff became a member of Albuquerque's premier adult runners club, Nosotros, and subsequently found a love for competitive swimming and bicycle riding after moving to sunny southern California. Since competing in foot races, biathlons, and triathlons in the mountains of New Mexico and on the beaches of California, Jeff has settled into a slightly less competitive  lifestyle yet continues to enjoy running, swimming, and cycling on a regular basis.

Presently living in New Mexico again, and training for yet another triathlon, Jeff looks forward to seeing a  new generation of cyclists being protected by the products designed and  manufactured by rfCYCLE.
 

Richard Skotnicki
Chief Operations Officer / Co-Founder

 

Before becoming COO at rfCYCLE, Richard amassed 45 years of industrial electronics experience in steel mills, forge shops, oil and gas, and rf identification in railroad automatic equipment identification around the country. As the director of manufacturing, his experience and demanding eye for detail has made product development move forward with continuous improvement. Richard's strict hand will be there to assure high standards from all our vendors and lead to a quality product for all our customers.

Born and educated in Western New York, Richard settled in Los Alamos, NM. One of his joys is taking his friends, not accustomed to the 7000 feet altitude, on the trails around town on his old Nishiki.

Where we are in the process.

We have spent the past several years developing the product and working with our suppliers to hone the product into something of which we are very proud. All the images and videos that you see were shot using manufacturing samples. We are happy, our suppliers are happy, and we are ready to place our first orders. Assembled in the USA.

Thanks to all our supporters!

This project has taken years and a ton of gray hairs to reach this point. Our friends and families have had to deal with our efforts, our ceaseless talking about the product and have been there with us through all the setbacks and victories to help us push forward to completion. To them, we owe a debt we can never repay. We have also been amazed by extraordinary help provided by the people below (a horribly incomplete list):

Josh Perkins (jperkins333@gmail.com) for his amazing design work. He is the one that created all the sexy molded plastic parts and overcame problems that caused redesigns to make the product close to perfection. His hand holding through these times were invaluable. 

Diane Albert (http://dianealbertlaw.com/ ), our patent attorney. It turns out that she is not only one kick-ass attorney, but is also a serious bike advocate who immediately believed in our product, and has worked hard, outside her role as attorney, to help move us down this path.

Ignatius Fischer from Witness Pictures (http://www.witnesspictures.com) . The man is a genius with a camera. Most of the images and pictures (and shooting a glowing red light is tougher than you think!) in this campaign and on our website were made by this man. 

And speaking of websites, we would be at a loss without the efforts of Andrew Taylor from Wirewood Consulting (https://wirewoodnm.com/ ). He not only made the rfCYCLE website a thing of beauty, but made this campaign something worth viewing.

And finally, thank you in advance to everyone who is supporting this campaign. We have self-funded this project from the start, leaving us very little money for advertising. Your interest, your sharing (pretty please) of this campaign with others (and maybe even, you know, getting a Warthog), are essential to its success. We could not go forward without you, and we know it.

 

Production Photos

Dear Will from Indiegogo:

Indiegogo's stated definition of manufactured is this:

“You have begun the process of turning the prototype into a mass-produced product. In order to be approved for Production, you need to provide clear evidence that your product is being manufactured. Some ways to highlight your current stage of production include non-rendered photographic evidence of production runs, tooling, molds, manufactured components “

Photographic evidence of production runs include every photo and video on this page, along with the photos below of manufactured components. If you looks closely at the interior shots, you can see the molding marks.

Thanks! Alex
story_txt:
Be Seen. Make Sure your Intentions are Known.
Stop, just stop. We all have to - wouldn't it be great if the car behind you knew you were going to brake before your paths met? Our taillight switches from a flash pattern to all lights active, looking just like the brake light all drivers are used to seeing.
 

Turn Signal
There's only one hand gesture cars recognize. Who can see them in the dark?  Our Warthog system not only indicates when you are braking, but also indicates when and in which direction you are turning!









 
Flash Pattern
We have 4 flash patterns.








Low, with a pattern of 2 lights, can run for 33 hours,

Medium, with a pattern of 4 lights, can run for 23 hours,



High flash, with a pattern of alternating 8 and 4 lights flashing can run for 14 hours,

While Our Ultra flash has all 12 lights flashing.


Pssst! There's a super secret fifth flash pattern with no flashing lights running, which adds extra emphasis to the brake and turn signals. Don't use this unless you have another light running!

The taillight is also smart enough to remember which pattern you used the time before.
Mounting
The control unit mounts on the handlebars with a pair of slim zip ties whose heads nestle inside the base of the unit. Once it's mounted, you will only need to remove the cover to replace the coin cell battery that powers it.
The taillight mounts to your seat post or rack, or clip it to your saddle bag or clothing. They're light weight; Wear several! Each can be configured to work with the same control unit, and each taillight can be set for different functions (left or right turn signal, brake only, etc.) to make your intentions even more clear. Each taillight can be configured to work with multiple control units, making it easy to move the taillights from bike to bike.











 
Technical Details


Who We Are
We are three friends who love bikes and technology. Commuting by bike has been the main means of transportation for Alex for over a decade. Having close calls with unruly drivers led to our desire to find a means to make us safer, and we've found it!
Alex ApplegateChief Executive Officer / Co-Founder

With over 30 years of customer service and supply chain experience, Alex runs day to day operations. This understanding of business operations and bicycle commuting will push the company forward with successive product ideas, while keeping an eye towards continually improving the product. story:
Disc Golf Resort Is Happening!

We have laid out 4 courses on this amazing property. We also have an 18 hole free-to-play pitch and putt course. Tee pads are going in, 54 baskets are ordered and on the way. We are gearing up to open this spring...

Our Goal On This Campaign

Disc Golf Resort, LLC has already invested $50,000+ in this venture. What we are looking for is an additional $50,000 from the disc golf community and community at large.

We need the additional funds to make certain we can have the 90 total baskets needed to complete this facility. We also need to pay for an environmental impact study for the property to assure we can install the final 2 courses the way we envision them. With funds above and beyond that, we hope to obtain a small fleet of golf carts to rent at the property, (think 5-10 carts), as well as fund the revamping of the existing restaurant/taproom on the property in hopes of reopening it for full year round service. 

What is this place?

This disc golf resort will be both a destination and a community resource. Kayak Point Disc Golf Resort is located in a Snohomish county park. As such, we will be operating under a vendor agreement in a pro shop/retail space that will cater to disc golfers, neighbors, and campers (from the nearby campground) alike. We also will serve food and beverages. The retail space, as well as the FREE 18 hole pitch-and-putt course, will be open to all during business hours.

Our goal is to bring more folks to the game of disc golf, by offering putter rentals or loaners at the shop and lessons to those who are curious. The full sized 18 hole courses will be pay-to-play, (likely $12-15/day), of various skill and challenge levels, and professionally maintained as well as constantly updated (multiple tees/pin placements).

The ability to rent the facilities for events such as weddings, corporate retreats, and of course tournaments will offer a new and exciting location for local groups and folks from all over the Puget Sound area and beyond.

Our Challenge

The county has only given us a two-year window in which to make this place a reality. Much work has been done already, but we need to show just how viable disc golf can be as a pay-to-play option, and that it can be a major draw for locals and travelers alike. If we don't, it's possible the courses could one day be pulled.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, consider joining us for a work party on the property. We've already had dozens of individuals show up and lend a hand, from disc golfers excited for a new venue, to neighbors looking to help reopen what they know is a gem of a park located only an hour from Seattle. Sweat equity is real! We are happy to offer future day passes to anyone who comes out to join us in getting this place open!

story:
2 years ago, we brought you The World's Smallest EDC Flashlight. We wanted to shake up the Everyday Carry market by providing awesome, minimal products everyone can use on a day-to-day basis. Introducing NanoPen, the pen that goes where you go.

When we say "World's Smallest", we mean it. Measuring in at a staggering 5cm in length, and 0.75cm in diameter, nothing else on the market comes close with the portability we offer.   

It's pretty F*CKING strong. Try to break it if you can. 

This material is superior because it is particularly resistant to deforming. It's Mohs Hardness is rated at 9 which is higher than Titanium and Steel.  

Using a Tungsten Carbide tip, this pen is more than just a writing instrument. We've tested the NanoPen thoroughly to ensure that it is a perfect EDC tool for the toughest tasks.

Have a neat idea? Sketch it out with ease. Fill out forms on the go. Puncture bothersome plastic packaging. Heck, even cut open all those Amazon boxes- The options are endless.  

The tungsten carbide ball is designed to be a perfect sphere that can grip any writing surface. Its surface is actually composed of over 50,000 polished surfaces and pits connected by a series of channels throughout the entire sphere. This design allows the ink to be present on both the surface and interior of the ball.  

At Slughaus we believe in pushing boundaries and elevating overall design & functionality in peoples lives. It's more than just a pen that fits on your keys, its a simpler way of living.  

The earliest design we have of a pen dates back to the late 1800's. These pens smudged easily and would leak, voiding them unusable. Fast forward to 1945, the ballpoint pen design we know today was perfected and patented.

In 2018 we like doing things differently, making the traditional ballpoint pen sleek and minimal, for you to carry ANYWHERE effortlessly.  

When we say take your EDC further, we mean take it with you anywhere and everywhere. We aren't a traditional Every Day Carry brand. We like to get creative and give new meaning to the way you carry things.

   

Hook it on to your backpack, duffel, or keychain to ensure you never forget a pen when you're traveling on-the-go.

Add it to your favorite jacker zipper, and utilize it as a zipper pull.  

Need less bulk on your Keys? Add it to a traditional ballchain and wear it as a necklace.  

Never lose your pen again.   

  
 
 
 

They say that size doesn't always matter. But it does when it comes to EDC.  

 
 
 
   
 

We've considered every possible aspect of the NanoPen from the size ratio of the key ring to body, to the finish of the metal to ensure proper grip when in use. We started from a standard pen and reduced it to an extremely minimal design, while giving it infinite function.

 

In order to perfect the NanoPen we had to go through various vigorous testing and revision. We worked with multiple pen manufactures to ensure our design was perfected to be the best tiny ballpoint pen on the market. Truly, there's nothing out there like it.  

   
SLUGHAUS is a small company based out of San Francisco with the sole mission of helping you stay minimal and functional. We believe that your everyday carry essentials influence your lifestyle. NanoPen's elegance inspires innovation, while its functionality keeps you on-the-go. We hope that our products not only help keep you minimal, but help mold your lifestyle as a whole.

story:
Whether you're an ocean explorer, poolside parent, treasure hunter, underwater photographer, boat owner, kayaker/paddleboarder, or in search of the latest yacht toy – NEMO is for you.

 

Your new travel companion. NEMO’s size makes it the perfect travel buddy for your next vacation. 

  • Only 10 pounds!
  • Easily fits into your duffle bag (or our NEMO backpack)
  • TSA and EASA/EURA acceptable
  • Smart Reg™ 
  • Rechargeable/swappable battery
  • Comfortable dive harness
  • Accessible (compact and lightweight) 
  • Air travel capable

 

 

While diving NEMO in a pool, all you need is the built-in flotation foam. Our high visibility flotation tube and dive flag should always be used in lakes, oceans and rivers – safety first!

 

 

This feature-rich backpack was designed specifically to carry NEMO wherever the call of the water beckons. These stylish packs are made out of textilene – a sturdy and resilient material that looks great too. Intelligently-designed straps and pockets all around the bag keep your NEMO neat and tidy.

The rollout mat provides a barrier between your equipment and the sand/surface. There's a convenient spot for your fins on the outside of the bag, plus plenty of space inside for your mask, GoPro, phone, reusable water bottle, or anything else. This bag is everything we want and more. 

 

 

Inside of NEMO is a custom battery-powered air compressor. The compressor pumps air to the diver through the 10-foot hose and out through our patent-pending Smart Reg™. 

Our Smart Reg™ saves battery life by monitoring breathing patterns to let the compressor know exactly when it needs to send air. This means NEMO doesn't just push air to you, but rather breathes with you.

What allows NEMO to be so compact, energy-efficient, and responsive is our patent-pending Smart Reg™ - the first of its kind!

Here’s how it works: A silicone diaphragm inside the Smart Reg™ moves when the diver breathes. A waterproofed sensor measures the diaphragm movement – it then sends an electronic signal which triggers the compressor to pump air at exactly the time and speed that the diver is inhaling.

NEMO pumps only the exact pressure, volume, and flow rate that the diver needs at their particular depth which means it uses just a fraction of the energy of any other underwater breathing system. That's why we can use smaller pumps, motors, and batteries - bringing you the most portable and affordable underwater breathing system ever!

 

We’re not just using some off-the-shelf compressor and sticking it in a box. NEMO’s compressor is an entirely custom design. We’ve built it specifically to ensure clean breathing air is supplied as efficiently and in as compact of a package as possible. Our engineers like to call the compressor an "oil-less linear two-cylinder brushless DC diaphragm pump.” Everyone else calls it "innovative."

NEMO is powered by a custom lithium-ion battery pack that is swappable and rechargeable. The pack and connector are IP67-rated to handle saltwater environments. It's under 100 Wh, so there are no issues with air travel! A charge-level indicator is located right on the battery itself so that you always know your battery level. Be sure to grab a few extra packs so that you can dive all day long!

 

NEMO’s flotation foam is made of cross-linked polyethylene and is shaped with a computer numerical control cutting machine. The foam is designed to give NEMO inherent buoyancy while keeping the main compressor unit in the water for cooling purposes.

 

Designed to give NEMO extra stability and visibility in open-water settings such as the ocean, the flotation tube provides an additional 22 pounds of buoyancy and is brightly colored so that family, friends, and by-passers can easily spot your location while you’re diving. The tube inflates with only two breaths and similarly deflates with ease. Not diving in an open-water setting like an ocean or lake? NEMO will float just fine without the flotation tube!

 

NEMO’s 10-foot air hose is the perfect balance of weight, flexibility, and durability. The coils prevent the hose from kinking and make it super easy to handle. The buoyancy of the hose allows excess to float on the surface so that it stays clear of you, the marine environment, and other divers underwater.

 

 

Meet the BLU3 Team:

 

Our systems make diving really simple. Our mission is to get as many people as we can to fall in love with the water. Why? Because the more people who love our waters, the more people who will help protect it.

Our BLU3 divers can contribute to the Project Baseline database using cameras and dive computers. Right now, the sign up process is a little complicated (we’re working on it) but the data you provide is invaluable – you’ll seriously be making a difference.

The goal is to prevent “Environmental Amnesia” – a term used to describe the unnoticed decline of ocean health over decades. We have to keep track of what is happening in order to stop it from happening.

Training 

Each NEMO will include a comprehensive training program that covers safety and best practices of both snorkeling and scuba diving. These lessons will also be available on our website to be reviewed at any time.

Know when your battery is low 

NEMO features a software-controlled low-battery routine that is designed to slowly reduce depth performance so that users will gradually feel the need to conclude the dive. 

The Buddy System 

An important rule to diving of any kind is to never dive alone. So convince a buddy or a group of friends to go in on one of our 2 or 6-unit rewards and dive BLU3 together!
story_txt:
Order your very own NEMO Dive System at diveBLU3.com

The compressor pumps air to the diver through the 10-foot hose and out through our patent-pending Smart Reg™. Our Smart Reg™ saves battery life by monitoring breathing patterns to let the compressor know exactly when it needs to send air. This means NEMO doesn't just push air to you, but rather breathes with you.
 
 
 The Smart Reg™What allows NEMO to be so compact, energy-efficient, and responsive is our patent-pending Smart Reg™ - the first of its kind!Here’s how it works: A silicone diaphragm inside the Smart Reg™ moves when the diver breathes. A waterproofed sensor measures the diaphragm movement – it then sends an electronic signal which triggers the compressor to pump air at exactly the time and speed that the diver is inhaling.NEMO pumps only the exact pressure, volume, and flow rate that the diver needs at their particular depth which means it uses just a fraction of the energy of any other underwater breathing system. That's why we can use smaller pumps, motors, and batteries - bringing you the most portable and affordable underwater breathing system ever! The CompressorWe’re not just using some off-the-shelf compressor and sticking it in a box. NEMO’s compressor is an entirely custom design. We’ve built it specifically to ensure clean breathing air is supplied as efficiently and in as compact of a package as possible. Our engineers like to call the compressor an "oil-less linear two-cylinder brushless DC diaphragm pump.” Everyone else calls it "innovative."The Battery PackNEMO is powered by a custom lithium-ion battery pack that is swappable and rechargeable. The pack and connector are IP67-rated to handle saltwater environments. It's under 100 Wh, so there are no issues with air travel! A charge-level indicator is located right on the battery itself so that you always know your battery level. Be sure to grab a few extra packs so that you can dive all day long! The Flotation FoamNEMO’s flotation foam is made of cross-linked polyethylene and is shaped with a computer numerical control cutting machine. The foam is designed to give NEMO inherent buoyancy while keeping the main compressor unit in the water for cooling purposes. The Flotation TubeDesigned to give NEMO extra stability and visibility in open-water settings such as the ocean, the flotation tube provides an additional 22 pounds of buoyancy and is brightly colored so that family, friends, and by-passers can easily spot your location while you’re diving. The tube inflates with only two breaths and similarly deflates with ease. Not diving in an open-water setting like an ocean or lake? NEMO will float just fine without the flotation tube! The Air HoseNEMO’s 10-foot air hose is the perfect balance of weight, flexibility, and durability. The coils prevent the hose from kinking and make it super easy to handle. The buoyancy of the hose allows excess to float on the surface so that it stays clear of you, the marine environment, and other divers underwater.  Meet the BLU3 Team:
 
  Our systems make diving really simple. Our mission is to get as many people as we can to fall in love with the water. Why? Because the more people who love our waters, the more people who will help protect it.Our BLU3 divers can contribute to the Project Baseline database using cameras and dive computers. Right now, the sign up process is a little complicated (we’re working on it) but the data you provide is invaluable – you’ll seriously be making a difference.The goal is to prevent “Environmental Amnesia” – a term used to describe the unnoticed decline of ocean health over decades. We have to keep track of what is happening in order to stop it from happening. 
Training Each NEMO will include a comprehensive training program that covers safety and best practices of both snorkeling and scuba diving. These lessons will also be available on our website to be reviewed at any time.Know when your battery is low NEMO features a software-controlled low-battery routine that is designed to slowly reduce depth performance so that users will gradually feel the need to conclude the dive. The Buddy System An important rule to diving of any kind is to never dive alone. So convince a buddy or a group of friends to go in on one of our 2 or 6-unit rewards and dive BLU3 together!  Download our video in hi-res, find content to make your own, and learn more about us.

story:
Living in Southern California, I find that most people at the beach lie on either a sandy towel or nothing at all. But the thought of being covered in sand makes me cringe. 

My name is Evan and I am the creator of DUO: the revolutionary 2-in-1 bag and blanket.  I have created this product in the hopes of making beach lives better. 

I need your support today in bringing this project to life so everyone can have a DUO in time for next summer.

DUO transforms from a bag to a blanket in 3 easy steps: 

DUO has plenty of space to carry all of your belongings, along with zippered pockets - both inside and out - to keep your big and little things safe.   

Unzip the sides of your DUO bag and a full-sized blanket will unfold and emerge in a matter of seconds. 

Lay your DUO blanket out on any surface you wish to relax upon. When you’re done relaxing, simply fold it back up - even with your things on it - and zip up the sides. That's it...you’re ready to go in less than a minute.

DUO isn't just a 2-in-1 bag and blanket. It's a GREAT 2-in-1 bag and blanket.

It's lightweight and with it, you actually have less to carry. 

The ability to carry all of your items like a traditional bag and also transform from a bag to a blanket in seconds makes life a little better.

DUO is made from quality, environmentally friendly materials. It is made mostly from a sueded micro-poly, 100% polyester fabric, making it comfortable, durable and lightweight.

It is water- and sand-resistant and 100% machine washable, making it easy to keep clean.

The bag is roomy enough to carry a full-sized towel, sneakers, water bottle, books, wallet, keys, headphones and even an iPad or portable speaker. 

Small enough that it is an approved carry-on item, it is the perfect bag to travel with when going on a sunny-weather vacation. 

The blanket is made with a layer of padding between the outer fabric for added fluffiness.

Plus, a 'hidden' pocket on the top side of the blanket allows for easy access to store your smaller items - phone, wallet, keys, etc. - while relaxing, or taking a dip in the ocean.  

It's all about the space: space in the bag to carry your items; space in the pockets to keep your belongings secured; and space on the blanket to comfortably lie down and relax. 

BAG DIMENSIONS: 17" (H) x 20" (W) 

In case those numbers don't mean anything to you, it's the same size as the average tote bag and can carry just as much.

BLANKET DIMENSIONS: 68" (H) x 40" (W)

In other words, the blanket is large enough to easily - and comfortably - fit an average sized person lying down or even a couple lying side by side.

LARGE POCKET DIMENSIONS: 12" (H) x 15" (W)

Large enough to carry a laptop or an ipad, among other things.

SMALL POCKET DIMENSIONS:  7" (H) x 10" (W)

Perfect size for your phone, keys or even your suntan lotion.

DUO is also a great companion for indoor activities - such as yoga or pilates classes, when you don't want to exercise directly on a borrowed, unwashed mat. 

It can even be used as a ‘windbreaker’ or a 'wrap' at a football game in the winter. 

In appreciation for your support today, we are offering all backers a DUO at discounted rates.

All backer orders will be fulfilled with the colorful patterned bag you've grown to love.

International Backers: Please note that additional taxes and fees may be applied when you are finalizing your order, depending on your country of residence. 

DUO hopes to make beach lives better and improve the environment. To make that happen, we need your help sharing our crowdfunding campaign with your friends and family.

Follow DUO and Share DUO to help support our oceans: Facebook, Instagram & Twitter.

Surfrider Foundation:  Protecting Our Oceans, Waves, and Beaches Since 1984.

Ocean Conservancy: Using the best in science-based solutions to tackle the biggest threats to our ocean.

One of the goals in creating DUO is to make the perfect accessory that everyone would love to own and want to take everywhere. With your support today, we can make that happen!


 

CHALLENGES AND RISKS

As with all crowdfunding projects, we are extremely grateful for your contributions. 

We are already heading into full production mode. Our material supplier and factory partner have been given the green light and orders should arrive by summer.

We will keep you posted throughout the production and shipping process so that you are completely up to speed on our progress.

While we don't anticipate any delays in shipping your order, we ask for your patience should that unfortunate situation arise, while we do the necessary course corrections.

story:
We have committed to a 5 day full of crazy bike tour in PEI. This is both our first long term biking adventure.
We will be touring with all the basic necessary,however vey minimal camping gear needed.
Being a photographer I will be documenting the whole trip and producing a book of the adventure.

The Confederation Trail, which is Prince Edward Islands’ leg of the Trans Canada Trail, runs tip-to-tip from Tignish to Elmira. there are over 400 kilometres of cycling on this adventure to be conquered.
Rain or Shine we will be biking the beautiful island of PEI and want to share and bring you with us on this crazy experience.

story:
What is BeMyGuide?


"Success is not counted by how high you have climbed but by how many people you brought with you." Will Rose

BeMyGuide.com is a web platform and online marketplace, designed to ease and enrich the traveler’s experience and to assist and support the local certified adventure guides all around the globe.

BeMyGuide is a personalized adventure lab where you can choose from more than 20 different outdoor activities like hiking, climbing, mountain biking, ski touring, paragliding, surfing, kayaking, etc. and combine them with your personal interests: history, art, flora and fauna, geography, photography, you name it. 

Booking a professional outdoor guide, you not only receive the right directions and instructions for your activity but you also get a local insider with all his travel and life-experience in hands.

And last but not least, we aim to create a sustainable online adventure community, where one can share experiences and receive new inspirations, before they embark on any new adventure.

Key features of the platform:

  • Worldwide map locations with professional local adventure guides
  • Diverse adventure experiences on land, water or air in one place
  • Our detailed and personalized search menu helps you to choose and contact your best-matching guide directly and tailor your next activity together (no agencies, no fixed itineraries).
  • The waiting room - a place for adventurers to find like-minded travelers and guides for their dream adventure
  • Live chat for direct contact with guides all around the world
  • Simple and secure online booking and payment systems
  • Calendars, ratings, reviews, wishlists...all as it has to be :)


Who Are We?

We are a team of 3. We are professional mountain guides but we're also passionate travelers and restless adventure-seekers. We understand the importance of personal contact and how crucial it is to know and trust your guide before you embark on any new adventure.



Stela Samouneva/ Co-founder, Business & Product development

Stela is our travel agent; she has built a 9+ year career in the adventure travel industry. She works on setting the idea, the business development and the content of BeMyGuide.

Evgenia Manolova/ Co-founder, Web & Design development

Evgenia is the technical geek of the team, with 8+ years’ experience in European software development companies. She is doing the tough job of back-end and front-end development of the project.

Dimiter Samounev/ Co-founder,  Social & Customer relations

Dimiter is a full-time international freelance mountain guide, who has turned his passion in profession. When not in the mountains, he takes care of customer’s service, social media and new memberships.



What We Need is.....What You Get


We have been working on BeMyGuide for the past 12 months, first on its core idea, later on its online projection. We are not funded to develop the platform. We do it solely out of our passion.  We devoted all our time to launch the website but we're running out of superpowers. We will need your financial support to push the website and launch it in spring 2016.

Your financial support will go directly for web design services and the development team’s salaries for the next month or so, until we are ready to launch.

We commit to making the web platform professionally and with love for traveling and adventures.


Campaign Goals


1.  6,000 $ will allow us to finalize a beta version by spring 2016:

 - 2,900 $ for finalizing stage 1 of back-end development

-  1,500 $ for web-design and front-end development

-  1,000 $ for initial web marketing and branding 

- the final 10%  go for fees to Indiegogo and PayPal


2.  Reaching a higher goal will significantly speed up the development process and the implementation of more functionalities on the web (online payment system, live chat, etc.). We have big dreams, but we work with short priorities.


As soon as we reach the campaign goal, we start working on the final phase of the project. We know it’s worth it! We have already been reached by 150 guides from 25 countries and contacted more than 10 adventure travelers with local certified adventure guides worldwide, without website! Sounds like a good start! These guides and travelers are eager to explore the adventure world through our platform. Let’s make this happen together.


Special Perks


Branded BeMyGuide.com Adventure T-shirts, you can choose your favorite activity, color, model, size, they are all lovely! Don't miss to have a look at all our adventure activities!




Our second special perk goes to those of you who want to support us and at the same time experience a  Hike to the Roof of the Balkans, Mt. Musala, Bulgaria, with one of the BeMyGuide founders! Not to be missed!


The Impact


Why is BeMyGuide so important to us and to the adventure traveling community?

  • There is a large market of certified adventure guides in Europe and worldwide, more than 50K local professionals (including mountain guides, kayak/rafting instructors, rock climbing instructors, surfing/scuba diving instructors, paragliding instructors, etc.). They provide diverse adventure services and are regulated in their respective countries. Currently, these guides are working independently, without a shared forum to promote their skills and services.

  • Using a matchmaking, peer-to-peet model, BeMyGuide.com will facilitate connecting travelers with reputable and safe certified guides and provide a community forum for open discussion of adventure travel related issues, experiences, and expertise.

  • We have identified and are able to provide a unique and innovative solution to the problem of providing direct, personalized, safe and reliable network for connection between adventure travelers and professionals worldwide. It's a new approach on an existing model of traveling, individual and independent, but with positive impact and understanding that the local guides are the wire to fully experience a new place and a new adventure.

  • And that's not all! We are planning to develop a mobile app that will make the experience of adventure traveling even more fun! Keep up to stage 2 of our project!


Wouldn't it be great if you could find like-minded adventure seekers from all around the globe and share your professional skills (if you are an adventure guide) and endless passion for adventures (if you are a traveler)! And turn all that into a memorable experience (and why not a new friendship)! That's what we are looking for!


    Other Ways You Can Help

    • Join our social media channels and share this campaign on Facebook and Twitter
    • Tell your travelers friends about the campaign
    • If you're an adventure guide, let your association, club or network of professionals know about BeMyGuide.com
    • Just spread the word in general!

    Thank you for reading about our project and let the adventure begin!
