story:
Short Summary

We - Joe and William - are two Washington, DC area teens who are capturing the world around us through photography.  We love to travel and show other people the cool things that we experience. Iceland has some of the coolest scenes on earth and the food is different than most other places. We want to go and share this experience with as many people as possible. 

What the Money Will Go to

We will need $5,500.  These funds will be used for:
  • Various pieces of camera equipment
  • Hotel rooms
  • Food 
  • Airfare
  • Rental car
If the funds don't reach our goal we will try to make it work with however much we get and we will still give our list of gifts for the people who gave money.

The Impact

We are taking this journey to show everyone the beautiful country of Iceland through the photographs we will be taking. We will also give back when you contribute you will receive gifts depending on the amount you give. 

Risks & Challenges

We might not get enough money because we are young. Also, challenges we could face include weather problems that could delay the trip because of Iceland's location. There could be some unanticipated global challenge that could interfere with our ability to travel during the time frame we originally planned. Another setback could be from illness which could delay the timing of our trip.

A way to overcome the challenge that we are just teens is showing all of you our work in photography. We encourage you to visit @joe_goldberg on Instagram.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute please spread the word for other people to see and contribute.

story:
PedalPod is a secure yet simple way of hanging any style of bike, large or small, mountain or road, by its pedal. Securing a bike in this way means no matter what style of cycle you have we can secure it!  Capable of supporting up to 25kg depending on the supporting wall, it is perfect for those who have little space to spare or like to keep things tidy and out of the way. The PedalPod is currently patent pending (#1520635.2) and all aspects of the logo and name have been trademarked and registered. 


Perhaps you have a really nice bike and think it deserves a place to stand out? The product makes a feature of your bike as the PedalPod can be bolted to all walls internal or external, therefore your bike could be secured in your front room, corridor or garage. 


We are confident that the PedalPod will also be the first product of its type to obtain "sold secure" status. This means it will be tested against theft to a level where insurance companies will pay out if your bike is locked to the PedalPod (if your home insurance covers bikes).

HOW IT WORKS

Mounting a bike to a PedalPod is simple and quick to do;

First, strap the crank arm to the frame of your bike using the nylon strap, make sure it is as tight as possible. 

(Please note that there are several different ways of strapping the frame and crank which all depend on what sort of bike frame you have, you will need to find the perfect way of securing the strap for your bike!)

Next, lift the bike and slot the pedal into the PedalPod. The PedalPod works by securing the axle of the bike pedal, this is the same on every type of bike so it doesn't matter what size or style pedals you have!

Finally, if security is a concern, use any type of bike lock (although we will always recommend a strong d-lock or chain!) to loop through the bike frame and holes in the side of the PedalPod.

Now your bike is stored securely and safely out of the way!  


OUR FUNDING GOAL

Our funding goal through Indiegogo is £10,000. Achieving this will make great steps in accomplishing the following;

PACKAGING

The packaging for PedalPod has already been designed and is waiting to go into production.

PRODUCTION

We have already designed the tool for manufacture of the plastic inserts and have sourced manufacturers for the other components so funding will go towards the costs of getting the manufacturing tool built and putting the PedalPod into production.

SECURITY TESTING

We strive towards producing products that give top security to bikes. So many bikes are expensive, top brand, lovingly customised or faithful life servers and of course cyclists want to protect them.

Using funding we can have the PedalPod Sold Secure tested and awarded as well as Secured by Design certified, both of which bike insurers love and often provide discounts to cyclists that keep their bikes kept in sold secure and secured by design storage.

A lot of the design process for PedalPod was centred around making the PedalPod as secure as possible so we are very confident that it will achieve Sold Secure Approval.

COLOUR OPTIONS

Whilst we have deliberately kept the PedalPod neutral in terms of colour scheme, we know that customers love a range of colours to choose from! With funding we can produce different colour schemes and customisation for those who feel the need to theme!

MARKETING

Having a great product is only half the battle, in order to get the PedalPod the exposure it deserves we need to market it to the cycling world at Bike Shows and Exhibitions, through media and print and setting up a PedalPod website and e-store. Part of the funds raised through Indiegogo will go towards this.

PERKS

TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS


INSTALLING THE PEDALPOD

PedalPod can be installed on most types of wall and we recommend the following fixings depending on different wall types;


For the PedalPod+ we will supply special ball bearing wall fixings which are extra secure and will mean the PedalPod+ cannot be unbolted by thieves. These secure fixings are for a solid wall, such as brick, only. 

PRODUCT TIMELINE

FAQs

Will it damage my bike? No, the plastic insert has been designed with rounded edges to eliminate any chances of scratching.

Will my pedal hold all that weight? Pedals are designed to withstand extremely high loads in usage, so holding a bike on the wall will be no problem!

Will the strap scratch my bike? The metal buckle could scratch the frame if you are not careful. We recommend trying the strap in a few different places before hanging your bike up to work out which is the best placement for it.

Is there a particular way to tie the strap? Every bike frame is different so there is no set way to tie the strap. You will need to find the right way for your bike, remember to tie it as tight as possible!

Can the strap break? The strap is made from a triple woven nylon to make it as strong as possible and the buckle has been designed to ensure there is no chance of the strap loosening. In short, if used properly, no it will not break!

Can I buy a replacement strap? Of course, replacement or additional straps will be available to purchase from our website for £4.99 + postage.

Do I have to use the strap? If saving floor space isn't a concern, then you can install the PedalPod at a low level and allow the bike to rotate until the front wheel can rest on the floor.

Do I have to lock my bike in the PedalPod? No, locking your bike makes no difference to how the bike is held in the PedalPod and an unlocked bike will still be level and safe in the PedalPod. Locking simply means that your bike is secure so if you are using a PedalPod outside or in a garage then you really should be using a strong D-lock or chain to protect your bike from theft. Slip the lock through the holes on either side of the PedalPod and through the bike frame to ensure maximum security.

What height ceiling height do I need? Ceiling height isn’t a concern as you can mount the PedalPod as low as 500mm from the floor. You will need to leave 1100mm clear space from the top of the PedalPod and ceiling to ensure the handle bars do not clash with the ceiling.

What sort of wall is best to put a PedalPod on? We recommend a brick/hard wall, however with the correct fixings a plaster/dry wall is also fine. Please see our recommended fixings chart for more information on which fixings to buy.

Where can I buy fixings? All the fixings we recommend can be purchased from your local DIY or home improvement depot/store. 

What does Sold Secure mean? Sold Secure is an organisation that assess and test all security products to award them with either Bronze, Silver or Gold certification. We have already had 2 of our other products tested by Sold Secure and have achieved all three certifications so we know what we are doing when it comes to designing secure bike storage! Insurance companies are more likely to give you discounts or better rates for bike insurance if you store your bike in a Sold Secure certified product. 

What is Secured by Design? Secured by Design is a UK Police initiative that focuses on 'designing out crime' and acknowledges quality security products. In their own words - 'Secured by Design member company status is awarded to companies producing security products that pass standards and tests nominated by the police service. The standards and related tests must demonstrate the product effectiveness in preventing or reducing crime, usually by resistance to physical attack.'


WHO ARE WE?

PedalPod is the latest design from bike storage manufacturer Cyclepods. 

Cyclepods is all about bikes and cyclists. Our total focus is on helping cyclists feel more confident that their bikes are being held securely, and safely, in locations which fit with their travel and commuting plans. We believe that bike storage for the 21st Century should be stylish, secure and most of all space-saving.

Cyclepods was started in 2005 by our Creative Director, James Steward. James was a student in Design at Nottingham University when his bike was stolen. Being his only form of transport as a financially strapped student, the loss of his bike affected his day to day life as well as being deeply frustrating!

It was then that James decided to use his skills as a designer to create a bike storage solution that was secure but also made a statement, so that bikes don’t need to be stored in cramped, rusty stands hidden at the back of buildings. 

Together with his partner Natalie Connell, they launched Cyclepods and have since installed bike storage solutions all over the UK in schools, rail, businesses, parks and public spaces. We have also designed a number of unique bike storage solutions with safety and security for cyclists always being our top priority.

story:
Since moving to Red River in 1963, Judy and John Miller have made skiing their life’s work — from their ownership of Powder Puff Mountain to the founding of Enchanted Forest Cross Country Ski Area in winter 1985-86. They were led by optimism and love, along with so many of their dear friends, customers and customer/friends (is there a difference?). Drought, and the ups and downs of business have made it hard to get by. “Snow farming” is not for the timid!

In 2010 Geoff Goins and Ellen Miller bought the business and, in subsequent years, tried different ways to expand. Some — yurt camping —worked really well. Others — a retail shop — left the business in debt. It’s debt Enchanted Forest could have weathered without… well… the weather. Since the 2014-15 ski season the business has operated at a deficit it was oh so close to erasing — until this year. We call it “snow farming” but when drought years hit hard — and this year has hit especially hard — it can be devastating.

This year’s dry weather could mean with end of Enchanted Forest. So we are asking for your help. We need to bring our payments to the USDA Forest Service up to date. We need to pay for liability and workers’ comp insurance. We need to repair our ancient Chevy Suburban to use as a shuttle and snowplow. We have other expenses, too. If we were able to take care of these, we would be able to carry forward this season — and beyond (see our plans below).

Our fundraising goal represents our best estimate of what it will take to bring the business back from the precipice, yes, even during this drought year.

We are already blessed to have American Music Legend Michael Martin Murphey as a longtime friend and customer and now this multiple Grammy nominee has generously offered to host a family friendly "Michael Martin Murphey and Friends Bootstraps Benefit" at The Motherlode, 7 p.m., Saturday, January 6, 2018, here in Red River. We know with his help — and yours — we can weather this disaster.

We truly believe that Enchanted Forest belongs to everyone and we will re-open. By pledging to help, you'll not only be investing in our future, but also investing in the future of cross country skiing, snowshoeing, trail running, mountain biking — outdoor sports in Northern New Mexico.

With much love and gratitude,

Ellen, Geoff, Judy, John, Mike, Linda, Larry, Bob, Harry, Martha and Anna

We have plans!

With the help of our dear friend Bob Walsh, Lead Environmental Designer for Roothouse Studio in Boulder, Colorado, and the guidance of our partners at the USDA Forest Service, Questa Ranger District, we have a 10-year Master Development Plan with proposed plans (awaiting USFS approval) that include:

  • Improving current trails;
  • New trails — ski, snowshoe and dog friendly;
  • Expanded mountain biking and hiking trails (essentially this would be summer use of newly expanded snowshoe trails;

  • More overnight yurts, including the addition of two to three yurt “pods” (three small yurts) to accommodate groups and large families;

  • Glade skiing (for telemark or Randonnee/Alpine Tour backcountry ski touring and mountaineering gear);

  • Mountain bike and/or fat bike rentals for year-round biking;

  • Tree canopy tours with aerial bridges, platforms and zip lines;

  • Camping platforms for tent camping;

  • Snow-play area for families with young children to go sledding;
  • New base lodge with dining and heated restrooms with indoor plumbing.

Other plans could include disc golf, outdoor summer concerts, yoga retreats, trail running, nature hikes, photography workshops, "summer camps" for adults with in-house activities as well as river rafting, rock climbing, paddleboarding and other excursions.

Links:

John and Judy Miller: Blazing paths for New Mexico skiing

Home on the Slopes

The culmination of over half a million miles traveled, hundreds of engineering and design hours, close collaboration with medical professionals, and over 50 prototypes, the SONO Pillow has redesigned the travel pillow from the inside out to bring a new class of comfort to today’s traveler.

Our design approach encompasses ergonomics grounded in science and aesthetics. The pillow features meticulously crafted ergonomic design features that combine to gently tilt the head back towards its natural state: an inner skeleton for structural resilience, thermosensitive memory foam that holds its form, and a thin neck band and hefty side bolsters that conform to your neck and collar bones. All combine to support the head in order to reduce lateral flexion, reduce soreness, and promote healthier breathing and more a restful sleep.

 

A Modern Pillow for the Modern Age

Most travel pillows don’t provide enough support where it’s needed – at the sides and front of the head and neck. Inflatables don’t adapt to the human form, beads disperse, cushions don't hold their shape – and none offer anything beyond a softer surface to lean on. This is what we set out to change.

The basic design of travel pillows hasn’t changed in over sixty years. Though most modern transportation now comes with built-in headrests. So that extra material behind your neck is pushing your head forward, causing tension, soreness and restricting breathing.

 

 

 

The Science

Working with engineers and medical professionals we researched how travelers actually sleep on planes, trains, buses and automobiles. We then took all our data and started to design something that we wanted to use ourselves. We took a long, honest look at every prototype. We wanted to make it perfect. And we have.

 

 

We started shaving down pillows to find the perfect form. Many collapsed. We looked at different core structures, from exoskeletons to articulated plastic to aluminium spines. We designed, tested, iterated and repeated. 50+ prototypes and much collaboration with kinesiologists, doctors, engineers and designers later, we settled on just the right blended memory foam density to fit your form while preserving the ergonomic integrity of the pillow.

 

 

By rethinking the form and material density, SONO Pillow promotes more natural, unobstructed breathing while reducing muscle strain and lateral flexion – that is, the overextension of the muscles in the side of your neck. We do this by removing the bulk of the pillow from the back of the neck and filling the side bolsters instead. This side support gently lifts your head to its natural position by providing enough firmness to support the weight of your head – allowing your neck and shoulder muscles to relax. This in turn reduces muscle strain, while properly aligning your windpipe. Both of which lead to more natural breathing, higher oxygen absorption, and ultimately a better healthier sleep.

 

 

 

 

 

The Travel Bag

We're proud of SONO Pillow. It's the result of a lot of research, collaboration and hard work, so naturally we want to take care of it. This is why we designed a travel bag to keep it as clean and convenient to carry as possible. We've added a passport pocket to keep your documents within easy reach while in transit, and selected durable, water-resistance materials and added a shoulder strap to allow it to double as a day pack.

 

 

 

Select Your Colour

For the first time, we're proud to offer three new colour options in addition to classic black.

 

 

 

The Reviews

We sent the SONO Pillow far and wide to see how it performed on the road.

"Elevating (the travel pillow) to a new level of comfort" – The Huffington Post

“Five out of five” – GadgetFlow

“SONO Pillow will help you sleep like a rock on the plane” – Trend Hunter

“SONO Pillow provides total comfort” – Gamin Traveler

“SONO Pillow is a must have to rest your weary head” – Paul Foster

“The travel essential I didn’t know I needed” – MillieGoes

 

 

 

 

 

Free Shipping

Did we mention all of our pillows come with FREE shipping?

 

 

 

 

The Cover

We all know the traveling environment isn't the most sanitary. One big challenge for us was to find the healthiest, skin-friendly, allergen-repelling material we could. Cotton traps allergens, spandex lacked durability, and most others lacked comfort. We also wanted the material to be machine washable, so as to offer the most comfortable and clean travel experience possible.

We finally settled on hypoallergenic velour for it’s allergen free – and washable – properties. 

 

 

 

Flexibility

To maintain ergonomic integrity, it was crucial the pillow be rigid enough to hold its shape. After much trial error we discovered the perfect blended memory foam combined with a internal spine that allows the SONO Pillow to stay in place no matter how you like to sleep. It conforms to your shoulders and neck maintaining its form while being soft enough to ensure a good nights sleep.

 

 

 

Stretch Goal: The SONO Sculpted Eye Mask

Less of a stretch goal and more of a stretch gift! If we manage to break $25K in fund raising, we'll ship each SONO Pillow with a 3D eye mask as our way of saying thank you.

With its cave like shape and blackout quality, the eye mask relieves pressure on the eyes and doesn’t disturb carefully applied makeup or eyelashes. Complimenting the form and figure of the SONO Pillow, it's the perfect combination for a more comfortable travel experience.

 

 

 

Production Timeline

Campaign Start: April 04

Campaign End: May 04

Production Start: May 08

All Orders Shipped By: June 15

 

 

Media, Corporate & Social

You can find a complete media pack here
For corporate sales, please email us at hello@sonopillow.com

Instagram: @sonopillow
Facebook: @sonopillow

 

 

Risks and Challenges

The SONO Pillow has already gone through several successful production runs. We've worked with our current manufacturer many times over the years, have visited the manufacturing facility on several occasions, and have excellent relationships in China to ensure efficient, worldwide distribution. 

There are always risks however. These include the ability to ramp up production suddenly, should demand spike. However we've confirmed that our manufacturers can have equipment and personnel on standby should it be needed.

We're also confident that we'll ship on time as our distribution channel has been streamlined over the course of several previous production runs.

And of course, we'll always do our best to respond to any questions and comments within 24-48 hours both during and after the campaign.

These include the ability to ramp up production suddenly, should demand spike. However we've confirmed that our manufacturers can have equipment and personnel on standby should it be needed.We're also confident that we'll ship on time as our distribution channel has been streamlined over the course of several previous production runs.And of course, we'll always do our best to respond to any questions and comments within 24-48 hours both during and after the campaign.

story:
Short Summary

This idea blossomed from 6 months in the COVID-19 Pandemic. I wanted something to do. I started looking up cabins in Big Bear - too expensive… I switched to Hotels -too many people (and still too close to reality), and while we have a tent and supplies, the idea of packing everything just to sleep on the floor just didn’t feel “it”. I finally came across an RV sharing website that I will be forever grateful for. The website has various types of Vans and Pop up campers but while they were all so perfect for what the goal was, they were just as expensive as a hotel. In that moment I decided that I could make something better, for less. I feel that once we go back to our daily "normal" lives, we should not be okay with the one (or less) vacation a year that we limit ourselves to. Anything that separates you from the normality of life is a vacation. If people need to work out multiple times a week to keep their body in shape, we must have to something similar for our mental health.

What We Need & What You Get

Everyone who donates can get a free night (per $50.00 donated) of camper rental once the project is completed! The initial goal id $5,000 but the more we raise, the better technology we can add to each camper. Unfortunately, campers are expensive, so $5,000 is barely enough to purchase and refurbish a camper. The goal is to add small solar panels to keep lights on and batteries charged, a small propane gas stove attached to the storage units, and depending on funding, a camper refurbish of a sink and personal bathroom  (more comfort requires more funds :c ) but that can only happen with time, money and willpower!

The Impact

I believe this idea can help students and families alike. Like mentioned before, things in SoCal are expensive. No wonder people cant take time off without worrying about breaking the bank! I want to change that. I grew up camping and spent the last 5 years in the Hospitality and Tourism industry. I know what people want, and need to enjoy a night away from home and especially what they need in camping. All you need is the food!

Risks & Challenges

There is only one risk, but its a big one. People. don't. reserve. While we hope for the best, and have plans to promote on almost every social media website possible (excluding twitter... I don't understand it) we must prepare for the worst. If anything, all the money raised can make the dream come true and the business of renting the one camper will never die. But we might not be able to grow. If the project fails, $25.00 a night will be the standard rate for all the indiegogo sponsors, because all those who help will mean the word to me. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, no worries, spreading the word can help if you share the same dreams as I. Together we can start a new generation of traveling.

story:
The Adventure Begins

Josiah and Rachel's Surprise Wedding & Around-the-World Honeymoon


1) We got hitched in a surprise wedding! 

On Sept 6th, we gathered our immediate families at Franceschi Park in Santa Barbara for a “scenic view.” After everyone arrived, a violinist, who “happened” to be at the park began playing Pachelbel's Canon in D. Rachel emerged from the park bathroom in a white dress, Josiah put on a blazer, and a friend who is a pastor arrived.  Our families thought we might be announcing our engagement, so when we told them we were getting married right then, they were floored. We always wanted a small family wedding, but we also love the surprise element of elopements, so this was a way to have the best of both worlds.  

We'd love to have you come to our reception in 2016 

Current plan: open invite to those who know us and any friends we haven't met yet. Details TBD. We hope you'll be there.

2) Tiny wedding, big travel dreams

The money we saved on a big wedding is going towards our first big adventure: an around-the-world trip. We figured we could spend thousands of dollars on one evening, or we could go on a life-changing trip, and invite everyone to be part of the journey. We're hoping to start a family in the next few years, and know that will make international travel more difficult, so we're taking the opportunity now to make this dream come true. 

The trip will span 15 cities, 13 countries and 5 continents

Rio De Janeiro, Brazil  - Reykjavik, Iceland - Paris, France - Le Mont-st-Michel, France - Barcelona, Spain - Rome, Italy - Messina, Sicily - Crete, Greece - Marmaris, Turkey - Eilat, Israel - Aqaba, Jordan - Salalah, Oman - Muscat, Oman - Dubai, United Arab Emirates - Hong Kong, China - Sydney, Australia

3) We want to connect with you through this adventure 

As we travel, we'd love this crazy thing to bring us closer to our friends and family - maybe even connect us with new people.  We want this much more than normal wedding gifts. For those that want to give we have a ton of "perks" to share the experience of the trip with you.

For those who want to contribute in ways that don't cost money. Thank you! Do you know somebody we would enjoy meeting in a city we are visiting? Want to join us for a stop on the trip? Do you know an activity that we'd regret not doing? Have any lodging hookups? Hugs? Etc.  

We plan on starting a Facebook group to provide travel and reception updates.

Estimations derived from spending so far, nomadlist.com and other research.

All money we raise will be spent on transportation, lodging, meals, or activities during the trip, perks and shipping for perks. Any remaining funds we raise will go towards the reception we will be hosting when we return.  


Special thanks to:

Adam Watson for Photo and Video
Tim Coleman for officiating the wedding
Lola Macy for playing the violin

story:
Short Summary

Ben Stone told me his thoughts on a "Freedom Bed & Breakfast" at his home on 18 February 2017. I met Dan Sullivan the next day to get this project started.  We expect to have the preliminary work done in about 60 days.

Our team consists of Dan Sullivan, coder; Ben Stone, originator; Jim Davidson, marketing & business operations.

Our goal is to help hosts evaluate freedom travellers and offer them places to stay, for whatever fee they choose to charge.

We want to bring freedom activists together while keeping travel funds among our community as much as possible. We also want to free the slaves, stop the wars, end the state.

What We Need & What You Get

We have begun coding. We expect to spend about $12,000 on the first three months of coding, plus $10,000 for marketing, offshore hosting, business operations, and contingencies.

  • We will use our best security tools to keep user info private.
  • Contributors get a free membership in the site. 
  • We offer books from Ben Stone & Jim Davidson.
  • All funds raised go to site & app coding until our goal is met.

The Impact

Imagine if 200,000 liberty enthusiasts spent $2,000 a year with others in our community instead of on hotels and restaurants. That would be $400,000,000 a year! We want our app to facilitate that change.

  • We'll encourage hosts to accept digital funds, silver, cash, etc.
  • Our team has worked on freedom projects for decades.
  • We want to be the leaders in freedom travel.

Risks & Challenges

We believe the coding challenges have been met before, so our main risk is timing. It may take longer to get it done, but we are confident we can complete the work.

  • All three of us have coding backgrounds.
  • If needed, we can engage code support from our community.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you have no funds to send

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Who is Picture Worth CF?

Picture Worth Custom Framing is a top-rated wall décor company headquartered in Houston, Texas. In addition to creating some of the most unique designs in the custom framing industry, within the last year PWCF has introduced a revolutionary twist on artwork: making your art come to life with your favorite photos and videos.

 

Many of our peers in the Houston marketplace are excited about the uses of our augmented reality service, however we saw the need for a central platform that would allow for mass cooperation and celebration within the community.


•    By using the uncover: HOUSTON app with smart devices, you can reveal content such as videos and links on promotional materials and signage.

uncover: HOUSTON serves content directly to the viewer, and has the ability to bridge the gap between the countless number of businesses, artists, educators, city officials, and more. The internet is becoming harder to sort through by the hour. It is time to take advantage of the sights of the city around us, to allow it to connect us to one another.

 

As a backer of the uncover: HOUSTON project, PWCF is making sure that you start out with a way to participate immediately. With our SmartArt service, different commercial sponsors will be able to use custom canvases to host their first interaction in uncover: HOUSTON.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, and thanks for checking out our campaign!

So who are we? Well... we're probably just like you. 
At the front you see a campaign for a bamboo coffee cup, but behind that we're just a couple trying to find their place in the world and build a future together... but a future with a lot less waste! The name 'thefoxsays' (I know, theres a song right?!) comes from my partners love of foxes, so much so, that she spends most of her free time caring for them or trying to protect them from illegal hunts.

Over the years we have commuted to work, whilst walking through town or even the countryside all we see is litter... EVERYWHERE! Especially non-reusable paper cups, not to mention the plastic lid! 

But why do we continue to waste when we could just re-use?

What We Need & What You Get

To put it simply:

  • We need your support! We have produced our first batch which is ready to ship.
  • You will receive your reusable cup made from Organic Sustainable Bamboo. (Discounted from the RRP)
  • Choice of two colours (Orange or black) or why not just get both?!
  • We would love to reach our funding goal, but if we don't then any support will have already gone a long way! If we do, we will continue to explore other reusable everyday items that can be released to market.

The Impact

Backing this campaign can only have a positive effect!

  • You're 1 less person using a paper cup... thats 1 less cup that ends up in a land fill!
  • Bamboo is sustainable, it grows REALLY REALLY fast! No more cutting down our forests!
  • You get CHEAPER Coffee!! That's right! Most coffee chains now give you discount when you use your own cup!
  • And who says it has to only be used for coffee? ;)

Risks & Challenges

It hasn't been easy...

  • We knew nothing about manufacturing a product, but luckily we got friendly with some really cool guys and their work is impeccable! 
  • We also knew nothing about shipping, but we got in touch with an agent and they guided us through the process. Now we are through the manufacturing process and we have the goods in hand & ready to send on to you.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, or a coffee mug just isn't for you:

  • Please share our Campaign! You can do this by using the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks! 

??.

story:
Short Summary

Me and my sons love active sports like snowboarding, running etc.

When I am chasing my boys down the slope, I feel hot and sweaty, while riding the lift up the mountain I am cold. I need my garments to keep me warm when I am sitting in lift chair as well as when I am dashing downhill.

Thus came the Caliente heated garments idea. I have been working with IoT since late 1990s so integrating the IoT controls and other electronics was not so difficult. Caliente is a line of winter garments with integrated heating elements and heating control. These are light weight garments that replace bulky winter clothing. 

I have spent last 8 months sourcing materials and technology. We are testing a full set of product samples and IoT controls. Everything is looking good. Next stage is to place a bulk order.

This is where I need your help! With your pledge and support I will have enough funding to buy bulk product to enter the market.

To succeed, I need $30,000 for inventory and other expenses. If I do not meet my goal, I will manage and grow at a slower pace.

Support this campaign and be first to own most comfortable winter garments. Show off this winter, you made it happen.

story:
Atmos is the most comprehensive, versatile and quietest all-rounded handy inflation, vacuum and compression device on the market. No matter where you go, it can help you to save more space and get much better user experience in outdoor sports.       

There are always many inflating and deflating tasks to tackle in our daily life, e.g. struggling of packing clothes into a suitcase before a trip by sealing vacuum storage bag, vacuum-sealing a food storage bag to keep food fresh, inflating a deflated ball or air pillow etc. whatsoever. Using manual pump can be extremely tired. Most of the traditional pumps are so big and unportable. Stop wasting your time, your breathe and your energy trying to inflate or deflate anything again! Now simply use Atmos - the perfect accessory for inflating and deflating with ease and convenience! 

Atmos is named after the word “Atmosphere” which is the atmospheric frequency high pressure reflecting the high power of this product. Atmos is the most powerful, durable, multi-functional, compatible, handy vacuum & air pumping device in the world. 

It is so compact and portable with clean white, streamline and simplicity in design that is very comfortable and easy to hold. Ideal for people who love traveling, sports and healthy diets. You can definitely improve your quality of life with Atmos! 

 Save twice your time and double your space!   

Atmos will compress a vacuum bag full of clothes and double your packing capacity in just over 4-5 minutes. Always pack smarter and faster with Atmos! It definitely helps to save time when packing, save space in your suitcase/backpack/bags when traveling, and even work well for home storage by saving up to 4x more space in your closet. Use Atmos and vacuum bags to increase space-saving mobility that can improve the quality of life. 

 Atmos can inflate flat sport balls

With Atmos, getting some air into the balls to increase the air pressure is so convenient, fast and easy! You will no longer have to cancel your plans of kicking around the football or starting a football game in the park. Just make sure you always have an Atmos in your sport bag or pocket!    

To inflate the ball to the correct pressure it is recomended you use a ball pressure gauge. With our pressure gauge adapting to Atmos, you can easily control the pressure within the spec. when you are inflating the ball and also check the air pressure of the ball from time to time. 

Atmos is compatible to a wide range of athletic balls including basketball, football, soccer ball, volley ball, rugby ball etc. It only take less than half a minute to fully inflate the ball from totally flat, with very little effort. It is very lightweight, compact and portable, making it ideal to carry around whenever you need to top up pressure. Atmos comes with 4 standard inflation pins and you don't need to worry about losing one. Atmos will fit your needs perfectly.

Atmos can keep food fresh 

 Improper storage exposes food to air can cause food poisoning. Like to eat healthy and save money on your food bill? Use Atmos to compress the food bag or freeze bag or to keep the food fresh and store for a longer time

                                         

 

 Atmos offers you an air pillow!  

 We offer you a pillow bag which can be used as a storage bag, as well as an air pillow that can be easily inflated (just open to blow the air in) and deflated (by using Atmos to air out) in few seconds. The best travel air pillow that is designed to carry when traveling. You can bring this inflate air pillow with you on any trip without the hassle of space because they're hassle-free to pack. Absolutely perfect for long-haul flights and other journeys.

How to used the air pillow

Designed for Travel 

Atmos is cordless, portable, compact and lightweight that you can carry it everywhere you go at all time. It is cordless and rechargeable so it can be operated without a power cord attached to an electrical outlet to provide main power. Just simply recharge Atmos with wall charger or portable power bank when it’s running out of battery. Easy and simple! With Atmos, there is no limitation as you can use it anywhere at anytime.

Ultra-Long Duration

Atmos consists of a 1000 mAh lithium battery cell. The battery can support the pump to operate for up to 60 minutes. Enough for deflate 8 vacuum bags or inflate 25 basketballs.  It also support quick charging. To reach 100% capacity, it just needs one hour.

Compatible with most of the vacuum bags on the market  

In each box, we offered one adapter compatible to most of the vacuum bag on the market.  If you already have vacuum bags, just quickly connect the adapter to the nozzle, Atoms will help you to save up to 50% space. 

 We offer Atmos vacuum bags in different sizes.  

FLEXTAIL offers their exclusive vacuum bags that are compatible with and perfect match for Atmos. You'll be amazed at how much extra space you can save when you use these high quality, sturdy, long lasting and strong seal FLEXTAIL vacuum bags for storage.  

Atmos has much better performance than VAGO and ZK190. Atmos is the only one has battery inside. Do you like use VAGO with a powerbank or a wall charger? Or you would prefer to use Atmos with battery inside. Of course Atmos.

With your order you will receive at least one of each of the following items:

  • ✔  Atmos Device
  • ✔  Inflatable accessories ( 4 needles in each pack )
  • ✔ Atmos vacuum nozzle
  • ✔  Micro USB charge cable

With our pressure gauge adapting to Atmos, you can easily control the pressure within the spec. when you are inflating the ball and also check the air pressure of the ball from time to time. Atmos is compatible to a wide range of athletic balls including basketball, football, soccer ball, volley ball, rugby ball etc. It only take less than half a minute to fully inflate the ball from totally flat, with very little effort. It is very lightweight, compact and portable, making it ideal to carry around whenever you need to top up pressure. Atmos comes with 4 standard inflation pins and you don't need to worry about losing one. Atmos will fit your needs perfectly.Atmos can keep food fresh  Improper storage exposes food to air can cause food poisoning. Like to eat healthy and save money on your food bill? Use Atmos to compress the food bag or freeze bag or to keep the food fresh and store for a longer time                                         
  Atmos offers you an air pillow!   We offer you a pillow bag which can be used as a storage bag, as well as an air pillow that can be easily inflated (just open to blow the air in) and deflated (by using Atmos to air out) in few seconds. The best travel air pillow that is designed to carry when traveling. You can bring this inflate air pillow with you on any trip without the hassle of space because they're hassle-free to pack. Absolutely perfect for long-haul flights and other journeys.How to used the air pillow

 
Designed for Travel Atmos is cordless, portable, compact and lightweight that you can carry it everywhere you go at all time. It is cordless and rechargeable so it can be operated without a power cord attached to an electrical outlet to provide main power. Just simply recharge Atmos with wall charger or portable power bank when it’s running out of battery. Easy and simple! With Atmos, there is no limitation as you can use it anywhere at anytime.Ultra-Long DurationAtmos consists of a 1000 mAh lithium battery cell. The battery can support the pump to operate for up to 60 minutes. Enough for deflate 8 vacuum bags or inflate 25 basketballs.  It also support quick charging. To reach 100% capacity, it just needs one hour.Compatible with most of the vacuum bags on the market  In each box, we offered one adapter compatible to most of the vacuum bag on the market.  If you already have vacuum bags, just quickly connect the adapter to the nozzle, Atoms will help you to save up to 50% space.  We offer Atmos vacuum bags in different sizes.  FLEXTAIL offers their exclusive vacuum bags that are compatible with and perfect match for Atmos. You'll be amazed at how much extra space you can save when you use these high quality, sturdy, long lasting and strong seal FLEXTAIL vacuum bags for storage.  Atmos has much better performance than VAGO and ZK190. Atmos is the only one has battery inside. Do you like use VAGO with a powerbank or a wall charger? Or you would prefer to use Atmos with battery inside. Of course Atmos. With your order you will receive at least one of each of the following items:
✔  Atmos Device
✔  Inflatable accessories ( 4 needles in each pack )
✔ Atmos vacuum nozzle
✔  Micro USB charge cable

story:
Relaxing shouldn’t involve running around with a massive balloon.
With AirThrone, let your phone (any phone) do the pumping for you.

We’re not here to make you more productive. We might do that accidentally, but we’re actually just here to take your relaxation to the next level. To a supreme degree you've yet to experience.

We love air loungers (and have been making them for years) but one day we found ourselves wondering: “what could be even lazier than sitting on an air lounger?”  

NOT MAKING ANY EFFORT TO INFLATE IT. Boom. 

Not only is AirThrone more comfortable, it’s been designed to hold firmly in place so you won't be slippin' and slidin'.

Just wipe it down with a moist wipe or cloth.

story:
What´s it about:

Mzuzo is a browser and app based service designed to show its users how to explore cities while in airport transit. It will tell what is possible to do and see in the time available, how to get there and most importantly how to get back to catch the connecting flight. 

Most frequent travelers know those long, annoying hours spent waiting for connecting flights that too often are scheduled too many hours away. Food and drink are as expensive as the duty free shops are repetitive. When finally one takes off one might catch a glimpse of the magnificent city one has just spent an entire day in but seen nothing of. With the help of mzuzo and its companion app  you can now use these hours to explore the city. We will tell you how to get to the places you always wanted to see and most importantly how to get back to the airport in time. 

I have been flying around this globe my whole life. First of all because I love traveling, then after, moving county to visit "home" and now to see my grown children who are spread over 3 continents. 

Cheaper flights normally come with long layovers. I have made it a habit to leave the airports to do some sight seeing and with this seen some places I would have never gotten to otherwise. I have also realized that most people would love to do the same but don't  quiet dare.  

Out of this Mzuzo was born. 


And this is how it Works:

       Home screen:

     :  

 

After receiving  basic data from the user such as destination, arrival/departure times, nationality and interests a suggested list of attractions to visit is generated. 

In this sample the user has a layover in Paris and the options to  to visit the Eifel Tower, the Louvre, Momart, a Rodin exhibition and Notre Dame.

         2. Choice screen:

Once you chosen what you like to do we will work out an exact itinerary, of how to get to your chosen destination (with public transport or taxi) and back, how long it takes, the costs involved  info on poi and many other useful tips about your trip and destination. 

The user can then select a destination of choice and a detailed itinerary is displayed. The following information is provided::

Transport options, costs involved, map, info on poi, map, c

ommon phrases, and where possible ticket buy options. 

 

       3. Result screen:


Mzuzo is to develop a network covering all major airports and with this becoming the  only one-stop-shop for stopover travelers. It will change the way we view air travel. What once was the most annoying part of of any journey can now be a bonus, an adventure in itself. 


The technology around this product is based on Mobile Development for IOS and Android, as most of our users will access the Mzuzo platform from mobile devices. HTML, CSS and Javascript web based development will be used for the front end of the public website. In conjunction with the above code languages we will also use Django Framwork to implement the back-end logic for the web apps. Rest API is to be deployed to support the Mobile Apps. 

Our biggest challenge will be the implementation of intelligent algorithms that will automate the data selection and then recommend optimal tour options based on the users profile and preferences. A Beta phase will be vital to ensure comprehensive user experience and testing of the application. 

Our time line:

The initial testing phase in our lab has taken place over the last 3 months. With a solid base, the first edition of our product can now be developed; this stage will be completed by mid 2015. The app will run for a month in Beta phase to iron out any initial problems. 

Concurrently our marketing team is creating awareness around the product. 

Some relevant figures:

According to IATA  (International Air Transport Association) statistics there was a 32% rise in air travel between 2009 (2,5 billion) and 2014 (3,3 billion)  It predicts a minimum of 3.6 billion air passengers annually by 2016. Exact figures about  the percentage of passengers world wide who have stopovers in their journeys have not been released, but looking at the data available (Heathrow 38%) it is clear that the numbers are large and  and increasing. 

 

Where you come in:
To make this happen we need your help. Funds raised will go to 75% towards IT development and the rest to run a pre-launch marketing campaign. 
A project like Mzuzo stands (or falls) with the amount of people who know about it, so please make noise. Please share our Facebook and Twitter pages as well as use the Indigo sharing tools. To those who donate a sign of appreciation we we will send you one of our T-shirts. 

Mzuzo-Shirts

story:
LETS GO WHEELING!

We are Phil and Paul, founders of the Virginia Outlaw ORV.  Both Phil and I have had a dream to build and operate an Off-Road Vehicle Park (ORV) in the Southeastern and Hampton Roads area of Virginia for many years.  This deserving area is void of a safe and organized park for drivers, riders, and enthusiasts of 4X4 trucks and rigs.   We have decided to take the reins and to act on a dream and make it a reality.....for all of us.  This is a business start up where we are working together with local Wheeling Clubs and Businesses to locate the right property to purchase or lease to buy.  Our park will be a full time operation with all the amenities to enjoy a family friendly safe and exciting wheeling experience: Camping, vehicle pressure wash stations, special events for all ages including competitions and fund raisers, clean bath houses and much more as we grow.

WHY THE HUGE GOAL of $200,000? 

 Don't let the goal scare you, with $30k we will have what we need to secure property.  That is 300 Wheelers  giving $100  This is a FLEX campaign where 100% of the proceeds given will go to the the birth and eventual operation of the ORV park!  This means that if we miss the goal, no big deal, your generosity will still assist in the development of the park.  But just think about it, what kind of park would we have right here in Hampton Roads if we met our goal?  Check out the bullets below:

  • $30,000- Secure the land/Begin cutting trails!
  • $45,000- Check in office
  • $50,000- Lease Heavy Equipment
  • $100,000- Meeting Hall/Playground/Storage Garage!
  • $200,000- Campground/Bath Houses/Restrooms


Guarantees

IF by January 2017 we are not able to open the gates to wheel, then the  "Rider", "Driver", "Believer," "Member", and "Founder" Perks will be refunded minus any tangible items such as hats, stickers, shirts etc that was received.  No doubt an undertaking such as this could take a year to open the gates.   We want YOU to have full trust in what we are doing and we want you to be comfortable to contribute without worry.

FAQ

Some of the questions and concerns have been the following:

  • WHERE- The 757 and Hampton Roads area.  Basically no more than 2 hours from the Ocean front!
  • WHAT IF "we pay for perks and a park never happens?"  Simple, non tangible perks such as Memberships, Day Ride/Drive Passes, and Founders will be refunded if the park for whatever reason fails to open, minus the hats, shirts, and stickers that you will receive.
  • WHAT IF "I dont have a 4x4 truck but I like the idea?"  Give what you can, watch what crowd funding can do when small amounts are given from masses of generous people.  You can contribute ANY AMOUNT without having to choose a perk!

Why Indiegogo?

Like most of you, Phil and I work a typical 9 to 5, we both own homes in the area, both have families with beautiful wives and amazing children.  In order for us to open the gates to an ORV park, we will need your help.  Due to the fact that this business is not what most banks, lenders, and municipalities recognize as a "normal" venture, it has more than the usual hurdles in its way.   And Indigogo provides a pathway to making dreams come true for so many, it provides normal "Joe's" like Phil and I a path to their dreams.  

What Risks & Challenges?

Here are the challenges that we face and how we will overcome them:

1)City/Counties- Getting the blessing, permits, and support of the local Officials and Municipalities.  One of the ways we get past this is numbers.  The politicians and local administrations want to see the numbers.  They need to know that this will bring people to their city and increase revenue.   And this site can show them that people like us are serious about wheeling!

2)Safety- Keeping the park safe for everyone, this means strict course rules.  

  • 5 min safety video
  • CPR/First Aid Trained employees and volunteers
  • seat belts
  • bumper flags
  • Helmets for certain rigs and events

3)Environment- Keeping the park clean, taking care of our beloved planet.  

  • The park will follow all environmental requirements to code.
  •  Vehicles will be sight inspected for leaks before entry.  
  • Littering and Pollution will NOT be tolerated

Let us not forget....Our Local Military 

Hampton Roads is surrounded by Americas best, the men and woman in uniform who have volunteered to put their lives at risk so we can be a free nation!   Locally many of those gals and guys own some of the most decked out rigs!  Jeeps, Ford's, Toyota's, Chevy's, Dodge's, the list goes on and on!  Problem is, they don't have a place here to legally utilize those rigs!!  This is a passion of ours, help us give them a place to get muddy!

Cannot contribute financially?

That's okay, make our campaign VIRAL!  Use the Indigogo share tools.  Put it on facebook, tweet it, tell your friends and neighbors!!!!!!  Word of mouth is the most powerful marketing there is!

Cannot contribute financially?
That's okay, make our campaign VIRAL!  Use the Indigogo share tools.  Put it on facebook, tweet it, tell your friends and neighbors!!!!!!  Word of mouth is the most powerful marketing there is!

story:
WHAT IS ROCKETSTAR?

Rocketstar, LLC, is a rocket engine company based in New York City, currently developing a new generation of rocket engines, beginning with an aerospike engine intended to democratize space and unlock its promise of the future by creating a cost-effective, reusable, reliable, environmentally friendly and highly cost effective rocket engine. RocketStar’s aerospike technology is far superior to the traditional multi-stage, single-use and relatively expensive rockets adopted by the space industry. RocketStar’s aerospike engine will serve to hasten milestones in space exploration, space tourism and, ultimately, space colonization.

OUR VISION:

To create new standards in hypersonic propulsion used for space exploration and, ultimately, colonization of the Solar System, thereby helping to ensure the future of humanity.

WHAT'S AN AEROSPIKE ROCKET ENGINE?
WHY IS IT SO EXCITING?

Aerospike engines are the answer to space travel. Current bell nozzles, which have worked to get us to space since the 60's, are lacking the economies of scale required to make space travel routine. What is the challenge for which we are providing a solution? We are creating an altitude compensating engine, so we don't have to throw away the rocket every time we go up, we can keep reusing it over and over again.

Traditional bell nozzles have a static pressure within the bell, they do not change as they move through the atmosphere, even as the Earth's atmosphere does.  To compensate for the loss of thrust, rocket companies are forced to throw away the engine for a larger bell nozzle, hence the need for stages.

Aerospikes have no need to do that.  They are open to the atmosphere and thus have a one-to-one correlation with the atmosphere change, preserving thrust.


Benefits of Aerospike technology:

  • Single-Stage-to-Orbit - as opposed to using multiple stages, which are the discarded after each use.
  • Reusable Launch Vehicle - as opposed to one use and done.
  • Cost Effective - 40% increased thrust and over 50% weight savings.
  • Environmentally Friendly - liquid oxygen and liquid hydrogen propellant yields a water byproduct.
  • Thrust Vectoring - yields extreme accuracy and maneuverability.

WHY WE NEED THE FUNDS

We are appealing to individuals who have been inspired by human accomplishment in space. Whether it was the moon landings, deep space probes, Space Shuttle, rendezvous with a comet or plans to colonize Mars, there  is tremendous interest in what lies for us out in space.

Our goal is to raise $250,000 for completion of an aerospike rocket engine prototype and to conduct a comprehensive Burn Test, both of which are required prior to building a full-fledged engine.

Deliverables – funding will be used to accomplish the following development milestones by March 2016:

  • Computational Fluid Dynamics Test (CFD): we will do thorough computer testing to robustly check our design.
  • Finalize design of proprietary nozzle and begin patent process: Once the CFD analysis is completed, we can implement our design process for a new generation aerospike engine.
  • Build test prototype: creation of a fully functional small scale prototype for testing, diagnostics and data capture for analysis.
  • Comprehensive prototype burn test: with full diagnostics and data capture -- this will allow us to show our prospective clients how well our rocket engine performs.

REWARD LEVELS

The Impact

You shall be contributing to and, thereby, participating in humankind's unprecedented access to space.

The campaign will provide individuals with a special opportunity to participate directly in space technology that will facilitate the overarching quest to routinely move humans beyond the confines of Earth. There are several levels of participation, ranging from $1 to $50,000, with compelling custom curated rewards for each level of funding.

With each level, you not only have the pride of being part of mankind's space era, but you will receive awards that let you cherish your involvement.  We have designed specific mission patches for this event, just like the mission patches that were awarded to the crews of Mercury, Gemini, Apollo and the other heroes of the Space Age.

The Mission Patch

Glow-in-the-Dark Patch

Zefram Cochrane Patch - In Star Trek: First Contact, Zefram Cochrane created the first functional warp drive and then made first contact with the Vulcans.  It was the beginning of a new age for humanity.  In honor of Leonard Nimoy and all the cast and crew of Star Trek and their vision of a new age, we have created this special award.

We have also designed the following items as rewards for your generous support:

High quality pin  (for illustration purposes only)

Mars Pen - guaranteed to write until man sets foot on Mars

Medallions  (for illustration purposes only)

These rewards proudly signal your involvement with RocketStar and the quest for space.  Higher donations will receive more thanks and more collectibles exemplifying your support for this mission.


Finally, for super donors we have reserved: 

Custom-made Apollo era flight jacket - painstakingly recreated from Colonel Al Worden's Apollo 15 jacket

Astronaut Helmet specially commissioned by Rockstar
(for illustration purposes only)

Orlan Astronaut suit replica based on the space suit used by both NASA and the Russian's since the 1970's  (for illustration purposes only)

And last, but not least, we have reserved one slot for someone to NAME THE ENGINE.  The name that you choose will go down in history on the next generation rocket engine that will get us into space! This individual will also start and be present for our Burn Test, as well as be flown out to the east coast for dinner with the whole team.

Risks & Challenges

There are obviously major challenges that need to be overcome and resolved.  This is not rocketry, this is rocket science.  

That is why we have assembled a team of experts in mechanical engineering to solve this issue.  They have worked on problems for major engineering firms in the past, and have the knowledge to overcome the challenges presented.  In addition, on our advisory board we have a founding member of NASA as well as several scientists that have in their belts such discoveries as water on Mars and on the Moon.  They are used to very large problems and finding solutions in a measured and deliberate manner.  Combine that with our other advisory board members and consultants who all specialize in Finance, Marketing, and have deep connections in the industry, we feel we have a winning team that can make things happen.

RocketStar Team

Detailed bios can be found at: http://rocketstar.nyc/team/


FAQ

  1. If an aerospike engine is so good, why is it not being used for space travel?Cost of materials and computer power were much different ten years ago. Advances in both areas are allowing for a re-approach to a design that didn't quite work before the age of carbon fiber.  With our resources at the University at Stony Brook and tax advantages in New York State, it makes it very cost effective for Rocketstar to build this engine.
  2. Why wouldn't Elon Musk and SpeceX already be using aerospike engines in their quest for Reusable Launch Vehicles?
    SpaceX has chosen to modify existing engines to prove that the company is viable and integrate further improvements later.  We have spoken to Elon Musk about our design and he is waiting on the results from our Burn Test.

  3. Your video shows earlier tests of aerospike engines. What were the results of these tests?
    The result is that the engine works great, but the fuel tanks and space plane itself were plagued with problems.  Most of that was due to cost of the materials that lined the liquid hydrogen tank.  The other problem was that the cost to manufacture the engine was so high.  Cost of materials and technology have advanced far enough for us to create a more advanced engine that will overcome these issues.

  4. Why should I be excited by my money not going to a real engine that would be used for the space exploration you speak of?
    Because there isn't a way for your money to directly go to a space program, and there is no engine that goes past low earth orbit at this moment.  When our engine is brought to market, the industry will have a true single stage to orbit rocket engine that can carry humans and cargo past low earth orbit and back again.

  5. What competition do you have?
    Not much.  Firefly Space Systems is developing an aerospike engine, but they are developing the whole rocket ship to go to space.  That is a lot of design and testing work and they haven't even started cutting metal.  We just want to sell our engines to rocket companies for them to use in their own rockets.  We have spoken to Firefly to help them with their endeavour.  We both share the same goals: get humanity to space.

  6. What's your best guess on how long will it take before RocketStar's aerospike engine is being used to transport individuals into space?
    Our goal is within three years.

  7. What advantages does RocketStar have over others developing rocket engines?
    We have the best people, the best facilities and the best tax advantages.  New York wants manufacturing to come back to Long Island and Upstate New York, and we want to bring it to them.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate just one dollar to help, that's ok!  We love the fact that you are even considering helping us, and would very much appreciate you spreading the word.  The more people know about this program, the more there is a chance that people will donate to the cause.  The journey of a thousand steps starts with the first one, but it is carried to the finish line by the other 999 steps!  By you spreading the word, we are one step closer to finishing that goal!  So, please!  Spread the word!  Carpe Astra!
story_txt:
WHAT IS ROCKETSTAR?
Rocketstar, LLC, is a rocket engine company based in New York City, currently developing a new generation of rocket engines, beginning with an aerospike engine intended to democratize space and unlock its promise of the future by creating a cost-effective, reusable, reliable, environmentally friendly and highly cost effective rocket engine. RocketStar’s aerospike technology is far superior to the traditional multi-stage, single-use and relatively expensive rockets adopted by the space industry. RocketStar’s aerospike engine will serve to hasten milestones in space exploration, space tourism and, ultimately, space colonization.
OUR VISION:
To create new standards in hypersonic propulsion used for space exploration and, ultimately, colonization of the Solar System, thereby helping to ensure the future of humanity.


WHAT'S AN AEROSPIKE ROCKET ENGINE?WHY IS IT SO EXCITING?
Aerospike engines are the answer to space travel. Current bell nozzles, which have worked to get us to space since the 60's, are lacking the economies of scale required to make space travel routine. What is the challenge for which we are providing a solution? We are creating an altitude compensating engine, so we don't have to throw away the rocket every time we go up, we can keep reusing it over and over again.
Traditional bell nozzles have a static pressure within the bell, they do not change as they move through the atmosphere, even as the Earth's atmosphere does.  To compensate for the loss of thrust, rocket companies are forced to throw away the engine for a larger bell nozzle, hence the need for stages.



Aerospikes have no need to do that.  They are open to the atmosphere and thus have a one-to-one correlation with the atmosphere change, preserving thrust.





Benefits of Aerospike technology:


Single-Stage-to-Orbit - as opposed to using multiple stages, which are the discarded after each use.

Reusable Launch Vehicle - as opposed to one use and done.

Cost Effective - 40% increased thrust and over 50% weight savings.


Environmentally Friendly - liquid oxygen and liquid hydrogen propellant yields a water byproduct.

Thrust Vectoring - yields extreme accuracy and maneuverability.


   WHY WE NEED THE FUNDS 
We are appealing to individuals who have been inspired by human accomplishment in space. Whether it was the moon landings, deep space probes, Space Shuttle, rendezvous with a comet or plans to colonize Mars, there  is tremendous interest in what lies for us out in space.
Our goal is to raise $250,000 for completion of an aerospike rocket engine prototype and to conduct a comprehensive Burn Test, both of which are required prior to building a full-fledged engine.
Deliverables – funding will be used to accomplish the following development milestones by March 2016:


Computational Fluid Dynamics Test (CFD): we will do thorough computer testing to robustly check our design.

Finalize design of proprietary nozzle and begin patent process: Once the CFD analysis is completed, we can implement our design process for a new generation aerospike engine.

Build test prototype: creation of a fully functional small scale prototype for testing, diagnostics and data capture for analysis.

Comprehensive prototype burn test: with full diagnostics and data capture -- this will allow us to show our prospective clients how well our rocket engine performs.



REWARD LEVELS


The Impact You shall be contributing to and, thereby, participating in humankind's unprecedented access to space.
The campaign will provide individuals with a special opportunity to participate directly in space technology that will facilitate the overarching quest to routinely move humans beyond the confines of Earth. There are several levels of participation, ranging from $1 to $50,000, with compelling custom curated rewards for each level of funding.
With each level, you not only have the pride of being part of mankind's space era, but you will receive awards that let you cherish your involvement.  We have designed specific mission patches for this event, just like the mission patches that were awarded to the crews of Mercury, Gemini, Apollo and the other heroes of the Space Age.

The Mission Patch


Glow-in-the-Dark Patch


Zefram Cochrane Patch - In Star Trek: First Contact, Zefram Cochrane created the first functional warp drive and then made first contact with the Vulcans.  It was the beginning of a new age for humanity.  In honor of Leonard Nimoy and all the cast and crew of Star Trek and their vision of a new age, we have created this special award.

We have also designed the following items as rewards for your generous support:

High quality pin  (for illustration purposes only)Mars Pen - guaranteed to write until man sets foot on Mars

Medallions  (for illustration purposes only)
These rewards proudly signal your involvement with RocketStar and the quest for space.  Higher donations will receive more thanks and more collectibles exemplifying your support for this mission.
Finally, for super donors we have reserved: 

Custom-made Apollo era flight jacket - painstakingly recreated from Colonel Al Worden's Apollo 15 jacket

Astronaut Helmet specially commissioned by Rockstar(for illustration purposes only)
Orlan Astronaut suit replica based on the space suit used by both NASA and the Russian's since the 1970's  (for illustration purposes only)
And last, but not least, we have reserved one slot for someone to NAME THE ENGINE.  The name that you choose will go down in history on the next generation rocket engine that will get us into space! This individual will also start and be present for our Burn Test, as well as be flown out to the east coast for dinner with the whole team.



Risks & Challenges

 There are obviously major challenges that need to be overcome and resolved.  This is not rocketry, this is rocket science.  
That is why we have assembled a team of experts in mechanical engineering to solve this issue.  They have worked on problems for major engineering firms in the past, and have the knowledge to overcome the challenges presented.  In addition, on our advisory board we have a founding member of NASA as well as several scientists that have in their belts such discoveries as water on Mars and on the Moon.  They are used to very large problems and finding solutions in a measured and deliberate manner.  Combine that with our other advisory board members and consultants who all specialize in Finance, Marketing, and have deep connections in the industry, we feel we have a winning team that can make things happen.
RocketStar Team


Detailed bios can be found at: http://rocketstar.nyc/team/

FAQ



If an aerospike engine is so good, why is it not being used for space travel?Cost of materials and computer power were much different ten years ago. Advances in both areas are allowing for a re-approach to a design that didn't quite work before the age of carbon fiber.  With our resources at the University at Stony Brook and tax advantages in New York State, it makes it very cost effective for Rocketstar to build this engine.


Why wouldn't Elon Musk and SpeceX already be using aerospike engines in their quest for Reusable Launch Vehicles?SpaceX has chosen to modify existing engines to prove that the company is viable and integrate further improvements later.  We have spoken to Elon Musk about our design and he is waiting on the results from our Burn Test.


Your video shows earlier tests of aerospike engines. What were the results of these tests?The result is that the engine works great, but the fuel tanks and space plane itself were plagued with problems.  Most of that was due to cost of the materials that lined the liquid hydrogen tank.  The other problem was that the cost to manufacture the engine was so high.  Cost of materials and technology have advanced far enough for us to create a more advanced engine that will overcome these issues.


Why should I be excited by my money not going to a real engine that would be used for the space exploration you speak of?Because there isn't a way for your money to directly go to a space program, and there is no engine that goes past low earth orbit at this moment.  When our engine is brought to market, the industry will have a true single stage to orbit rocket engine that can carry humans and cargo past low earth orbit and back again.


What competition do you have?Not much.  Firefly Space Systems is developing an aerospike engine, but they are developing the whole rocket ship to go to space.  That is a lot of design and testing work and they haven't even started cutting metal.  We just want to sell our engines to rocket companies for them to use in their own rockets.  We have spoken to Firefly to help them with their endeavour.  We both share the same goals: get humanity to space.


What's your best guess on how long will it take before RocketStar's aerospike engine is being used to transport individuals into space?Our goal is within three years.


What advantages does RocketStar have over others developing rocket engines?We have the best people, the best facilities and the best tax advantages.  New York wants manufacturing to come back to Long Island and Upstate New York, and we want to bring it to them.



Other Ways You Can Help If you can't donate just one dollar to help, that's ok!  We love the fact that you are even considering helping us, and would very much appreciate you spreading the word.  The more people know about this program, the more there is a chance that people will donate to the cause.  The journey of a thousand steps starts with the first one, but it is carried to the finish line by the other 999 steps!  By you spreading the word, we are one step closer to finishing that goal!  So, please!  Spread the word!  Carpe Astra!

story:
Short Summary

Preserve Greystone, founded in 2008, is a New Jersey-based organization dedicated to protecting the open space and historic buildings at the former Greystone Park Psychiatric Hospital in Morris County, NJ. The Kirkbride/Main Building, which functioned as the original hospital, is an important local landmark and piece of American, architectural and mental health history.

State law requires DEP approval for demolition of sites that are either on the State Register of Historic Places, or even eligible for the list. The State Historic Preservation Office awarded Greystone a certificate of eligibility in 2009, but the State Treasury Department has awarded a contract for demolition of the massive historic structure without seeking DEP approval.

Preserve Greystone is appealing the award of the demolition contract in New Jersey’s Appellate Division. On February 23rd, the group filed its latest brief with the assistance of James F. Sullivan, Jr., Esq. of Connell Foley, LLP, who is representing the group on a pro bono basis. This is the third round of written arguments, and the group has requested oral argument to further make its case.

“The State has repeatedly broken off communication with stakeholders and not engaged the public or potential developers in a meaningful way,” said Huebner in reference to the group’s recourse to the courts.

We believe that by raising funds to further our legal battle by finding additional volunteers and publicizing our cause we can bring the discussion back to the public realm. This demolition will cost at least $50 million dollars of tax payer money. Redevelopment will cost the community very little and bring in jobs and tax revenue. We will also save millions of tons of waste from being generated from the destruction of the building.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Write to your local representative and the governor of New Jersey
  • Share our campaign
  • Visit our facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/preservegreystone
  • Visit our webpage: www.preservegreystone.org
  • Send us a message of what you would want to see at Greystone Park
