story:
How It All Started

It was around one and a half year ago when we, a group of friends, went for a trekking with a Bakhtiari nomad family. After that, it occurred to us what we can do to stop the imminent extinction of this authentic nomadic lifestyle. So, we got the idea of creating a social business, to kindle a sense of self-esteem in the nomads in a way that they continue their precious lifestyle. In other words, they do not abandon their tents for living in cities.
Read more about us: https://nomad.tours

So, we came up with a complementary model for rural development.The decision was reached after consultation with some anthropologists and professors. see our international Team members here: www.nomad.tours/who-we-are/

How Do We Help to Preserve Nomadic Lifestyle?

In our work model, we take a small group of responsible visitors to nomad families to live with them for some days. During these days, we accompany the nomads during their daily life, respecting their traditional culture in all its aspect and not causing any changes. We are fully committed to low impact travel that not only preserves but gives back to the amazing people and places we go. In other words, when tourists join the nomads in their daily lives, they provide the nomads with supplementary income, which is, of course, lower than the amount they earn through shepherding. So, on the one hand, the additional income would financially help them, on the other hand since it is not a large income in comparison to their owns’, they would be encouraged to keep on with their own lifestyle. Moreover, when they see how everybody is appreciative of their lifestyle, they would be encouraged to preserve it.

Who Are Bakhtiari Nomads?

Persian Bakhtiari nomads are a group of remaining nomad tribes in the dazzling landscapes of the Zagros Mountains. They are descendant of ancient Bakhtiari nomads who used to live in the area many years ago. They migrate twice a year to provide their flocks with fresh grass. Once in spring, when they move to their summer pastures, and then in fall when they move to lower altitudes. Since a hundred years ago, the number of these authentic people has declined. Different regimes and groups have tried to stop their migration under the pretext of supporting them or making their lives easier, but in fact, these measures were attempted to patronize and thus control the Bakhtiyari, which made them lose their self-esteem. Hundred years ago, a quarter of the population were Nomads. 50 years ago the population of these people decreased and they made 10% of the whole population. Now, after years of continuing decline, there is just 1% of them, which is something around 1million. Fortunately, there are still thousands of them keeping the culture alive. But they are experiencing a dramatic decline.

An article published in National Geography about fading away of Nomadic lifestyle, you can get access to this article which published on October 2018 from this link. Also you can find an article to  know more about Bakhtiari people on our Weblog.

What We Intend to Do?

We firmly believe that the unique and memorable experience of migration with nomad families in lush green valleys and mountainous regions, which is like no other experience, have a mutual benefit for both the nomads and tourists. On the one hand, the visitors would experience something quite different from what they see in their daily lives in cities. Passing through pastoral landscapes and living the authentic life of nomads influenced by the mother nature, leave them in deep appreciation for this lifestyle, and it is going to be a turning point in their lives since they would not be the same persons when they go back to their daily routine. On the other hand, when the nomads see how their unique lifestyle is being appreciated by the visitors, they might hopefully see this as an opportunity to stay, rather than to choose to abandon a precious lifestyle. 
Cultural diversity and Biodiversity is of global importance and we wish to help preserve Nomadic lifestyle which is a great sample of sustainable use of Nature. this culture has so much to be learned from since it is in perfect harmony with nature. Their lifestyle, especially their migration is one of the most authentic and intimate ways humans can relate to nature and this knowledge which is gained in thousands of years can be quite helpful.


Reward Levels 

Please choose a reward level and help us make Nomads known to the world to prevent their extinction. They have a very rich history and their lifestyle is really worthwhile to maintain. The rewards are selected from Nomadic handicraft which has a broad historical background. By doing so, we wish to help protect it, and also we seek to make them and their art known to the world.

What Happens During Nomads’ Seasonal Migration if You Join it? 

After some trekking among beautiful pastures, Nomads’ black tents are seen. We join them in almost all aspects of their unique lifestyle. We eat what they eat, we shepherd their flocks, milk the goats, bake bread. Finally, we accompany them among mountains while their sheep & goats move through pastures, grazing fresh grass.

 

Read the a full story of Migration tour, here.

How Your Contribution Impacts?

So far, our project has run on a purely voluntary basis. Three of us have worked full-time during last year, the other fifteen have been helping us on a part-time basis from all around the world. The Nomads also expressed an interest in having the travelers while migrating. They like to be connected to a wider global audience. Now we are planning to extend our social business to make it more sustainable and self-reliant. So, we need to have more experienced staff, an office, and some basic facilities, so that we can learn more about Bakhtiari Nomads and Nomadic lifestyle, and then make valuable content about them (weblog, photos, and videos). Through these content-making process, we aim not only to make a record of their extraordinary lifestyle but also to educate those adventurous visitors who wish to join us and participate in these fantastic expeditions and trek with nomadic tribes as they migrate with their goats, sheep, and mules. By understanding the background, the visitors should appreciate and enjoy the whole experience even more.

The money you are going to give us is going to be used at first helps us to expand our local community partners since we will buy the handicrafts from them. The rest is used for hiring a group of professional facilitators for local community development, and finally in Creation and diffusion of content about the community for general public and promotion of our work. 

On the next step, when the 10k CA.$ goal is earned, we wish to involve the schools of Anthropology of the World, so that the professors and students would be able to experience the nomadic lifestyle in person, and eventually to share with the world a deeper insight about the Bakhtiari and nomadic lifestyle. We would also like to make a documentary film about the current situation of Bakhtiari nomads. We believe that nothing can represent them and their special lifestyle better, as such a film. It would also be more convenient and watching it, would address more people more directly. So, they can learn about this specific culture more easily. 

Backing this project supports Nomadic art; Jajim (tablecloth) Reward #4 & 5

We have so many ideas, but we try to be careful not to make any hasty decision. So, for the moment we would like to focus our attention on small but important steps.

Risks or challenges

Although this is our first crowdfunding experience, we’ve been selling the Nomads’ s handicraft for more than a year. We have young international partners who collaborate with us in delivering the rewards on time. The biggest challenge of this project is being in contact with the Nomads. But as we have a close relationship with Nomad partners and we meet them so often, hopefully, there would be no problem. 
That said, there are always things that can pop up and throw us off course. We’ve learned the hard way that you can’t control the things you can’t control. When things come up, we promise to keep you well-informed and pledge to fix things quickly to our backer’s satisfaction.
story_txt:
How It All StartedIt was around one and a half year ago when we, a group of friends, went for a trekking with a Bakhtiari nomad family. After that, it occurred to us what we can do to stop the imminent extinction of this authentic nomadic lifestyle. So, we got the idea of creating a social business, to kindle a sense of self-esteem in the nomads in a way that they continue their precious lifestyle. In other words, they do not abandon their tents for living in cities.Read more about us: https://nomad.toursSo, we came up with a complementary model for rural development.The decision was reached after consultation with some anthropologists and professors. see our international Team members here: www.nomad.tours/who-we-are/How Do We Help to Preserve Nomadic Lifestyle?In our work model, we take a small group of responsible visitors to nomad families to live with them for some days. During these days, we accompany the nomads during their daily life, respecting their traditional culture in all its aspect and not causing any changes. We are fully committed to low impact travel that not only preserves but gives back to the amazing people and places we go. In other words, when tourists join the nomads in their daily lives, they provide the nomads with supplementary income, which is, of course, lower than the amount they earn through shepherding. So, on the one hand, the additional income would financially help them, on the other hand since it is not a large income in comparison to their owns’, they would be encouraged to keep on with their own lifestyle. Moreover, when they see how everybody is appreciative of their lifestyle, they would be encouraged to preserve it.Who Are Bakhtiari Nomads?Persian Bakhtiari nomads are a group of remaining nomad tribes in the dazzling landscapes of the Zagros Mountains. They are descendant of ancient Bakhtiari nomads who used to live in the area many years ago. They migrate twice a year to provide their flocks with fresh grass. Once in spring, when they move to their summer pastures, and then in fall when they move to lower altitudes. Since a hundred years ago, the number of these authentic people has declined. Different regimes and groups have tried to stop their migration under the pretext of supporting them or making their lives easier, but in fact, these measures were attempted to patronize and thus control the Bakhtiyari, which made them lose their self-esteem. Hundred years ago, a quarter of the population were Nomads. 50 years ago the population of these people decreased and they made 10% of the whole population. Now, after years of continuing decline, there is just 1% of them, which is something around 1million. Fortunately, there are still thousands of them keeping the culture alive. But they are experiencing a dramatic decline.An article published in National Geography about fading away of Nomadic lifestyle, you can get access to this article which published on October 2018 from this link. Also you can find an article to  know more about Bakhtiari people on our Weblog.What We Intend to Do?We firmly believe that the unique and memorable experience of migration with nomad families in lush green valleys and mountainous regions, which is like no other experience, have a mutual benefit for both the nomads and tourists. On the one hand, the visitors would experience something quite different from what they see in their daily lives in cities. Passing through pastoral landscapes and living the authentic life of nomads influenced by the mother nature, leave them in deep appreciation for this lifestyle, and it is going to be a turning point in their lives since they would not be the same persons when they go back to their daily routine. On the other hand, when the nomads see how their unique lifestyle is being appreciated by the visitors, they might hopefully see this as an opportunity to stay, rather than to choose to abandon a precious lifestyle. Cultural diversity and Biodiversity is of global importance and we wish to help preserve Nomadic lifestyle which is a great sample of sustainable use of Nature. this culture has so much to be learned from since it is in perfect harmony with nature. Their lifestyle, especially their migration is one of the most authentic and intimate ways humans can relate to nature and this knowledge which is gained in thousands of years can be quite helpful.
Reward Levels 
Please choose a reward level and help us make Nomads known to the world to prevent their extinction. They have a very rich history and their lifestyle is really worthwhile to maintain. The rewards are selected from Nomadic handicraft which has a broad historical background. By doing so, we wish to help protect it, and also we seek to make them and their art known to the world.What Happens During Nomads’ Seasonal Migration if You Join it? After some trekking among beautiful pastures, Nomads’ black tents are seen. We join them in almost all aspects of their unique lifestyle. We eat what they eat, we shepherd their flocks, milk the goats, bake bread. Finally, we accompany them among mountains while their sheep & goats move through pastures, grazing fresh grass.


 


Read the a full story of Migration tour, here.
How Your Contribution Impacts?So far, our project has run on a purely voluntary basis. Three of us have worked full-time during last year, the other fifteen have been helping us on a part-time basis from all around the world. The Nomads also expressed an interest in having the travelers while migrating. They like to be connected to a wider global audience. Now we are planning to extend our social business to make it more sustainable and self-reliant. So, we need to have more experienced staff, an office, and some basic facilities, so that we can learn more about Bakhtiari Nomads and Nomadic lifestyle, and then make valuable content about them (weblog, photos, and videos). Through these content-making process, we aim not only to make a record of their extraordinary lifestyle but also to educate those adventurous visitors who wish to join us and participate in these fantastic expeditions and trek with nomadic tribes as they migrate with their goats, sheep, and mules. By understanding the background, the visitors should appreciate and enjoy the whole experience even more.The money you are going to give us is going to be used at first helps us to expand our local community partners since we will buy the handicrafts from them. The rest is used for hiring a group of professional facilitators for local community development, and finally in Creation and diffusion of content about the community for general public and promotion of our work. On the next step, when the 10k CA.$ goal is earned, we wish to involve the schools of Anthropology of the World, so that the professors and students would be able to experience the nomadic lifestyle in person, and eventually to share with the world a deeper insight about the Bakhtiari and nomadic lifestyle. We would also like to make a documentary film about the current situation of Bakhtiari nomads. We believe that nothing can represent them and their special lifestyle better, as such a film. It would also be more convenient and watching it, would address more people more directly. So, they can learn about this specific culture more easily. Backing this project supports Nomadic art; Jajim (tablecloth) Reward #4 & 5We have so many ideas, but we try to be careful not to make any hasty decision. So, for the moment we would like to focus our attention on small but important steps.Risks or challengesAlthough this is our first crowdfunding experience, we’ve been selling the Nomads’ s handicraft for more than a year. We have young international partners who collaborate with us in delivering the rewards on time. The biggest challenge of this project is being in contact with the Nomads. But as we have a close relationship with Nomad partners and we meet them so often, hopefully, there would be no problem. That said, there are always things that can pop up and throw us off course. We’ve learned the hard way that you can’t control the things you can’t control. When things come up, we promise to keep you well-informed and pledge to fix things quickly to our backer’s satisfaction.

story:
Introducing the Getaway Bag: A 360-Degree View

What fits?

 

A home for every item you need to bring for your next family adventure (see the "Packing Guide" below for the full list of items shown here!)

The travel backpack every parent needs.

We are No Reception Club, a small but mighty travel essentials startup, founded by two parents (Gemma + Daniel) who absolutely love family travel, but grew extremely frustrated by the limited products available to make it easier. Our mission is to inspire parents to unplug and go on adventures with their little ones. We do this by creating intelligently and elegantly designed bags to make it easier to go on every kind of family adventure -- from Saturday "daycations", to overnight staycations, to week-long vacations!

 

Our first two products: the Getaway Bag and the Sidekick

Our first product is the Getaway Bag, a travel backpack so organized that parents can use it with their eyes closed, and while balancing a little one on their hip. We pushed the boundaries of organization, accessibility, versatility, and capacity in ways never seen before in a diaper bag, and without compromising on style or comfort. Our second product is the Sidekick, a hip pack that helps you breeze through diaper changes on-the-go, with a special pocket that allows you to retrieve diaper wipes one-handed.  

 

Introducing the Sidekick. Breeze through diaper changes with one-handed access to diaper wipes!

 

 

 

Stop digging aimlessly to find that one item.

Traveling with a baby or toddler (or both!) can be pretty difficult, particularly when you aren't properly equipped for the journey. The Getaway Bag is packed with intelligent features to simplify every part of traveling with your little one(s). Fit and organize everything you need to get your child and you to your destination.  Access exactly the item that will end the tantrum ASAP, and one-handed. Contain casualties from diaper blowouts and spills with aplomb. Glide through airport security stress-free. And on top of all that, feel good knowing that your bag is made from durable recycled materials. Yes, we thought of everything.

 

Top Feature Highlights

 

Features Deep Dive

 

 

1. Instant Side Access 

 

Instant side access openings into the Main Compartment and the Essentials Compartment (see Feature #4) mean you can get to what your child needs fast. Side Access is super convenient when you're wearing the bag, it's adjacent to you, or it's under the seat in front of you. 

 

But don't worry, the Main Compartment also opens from the top and front too -- so whatever you need is always just one zipper or buckle away.

 

2. Flexible Organization System   

 

Customize your bag with our adjustable shelves exactly how you want them

The Getaway Bag has a flexible organization system using 2 Adjustable Shelves that velcro securely inside the Main Compartment. The shelves enable you to create 1, 2 or 3 distinct sections. Because packing needs change based on your trip, your growing child, and your growing family, the flexible shelves help you adapt the Getaway Bag to your evolving organizational needs.  

 

The backpack that grows with your family

 

3. Odor-Resistant Emergency Compartment 

The Emergency Compartment contains inevitable "messes" that happen along the journey (think: diaper blowouts, muddy shoes, soiled clothing, wet swimsuits) and keeps them separate from the rest of your things. It's fully lined in odor-resistant, waterproof, easy-to-clean fabric. And when it's empty, the capacity simply transfers into the Main compartment so you don’t waste any space!

 

4. Essentials Compartment for critical items

 

The Essentials Compartment keeps all your diaper changing essentials (or other critical items once your little one is out of diapers) instantly accessible. It is spacious enough to fit multiple diapers, a changing pad, diaper wipes, and cream -- and is 100% compatible with the Sidekick, making this an unbeatable travel system for parents.

 

5. Parent Pockets for your things 

 

 

Front Parent Pocket for your small travel essentials (hand sanitizer, masks, tickets, travel guides)

 

TSA-Approved Laptop Sleeve for your tech (laptop, tablets, chargers)

  • Top/Hood Parent Pocket for your day-to-day essentials.
  • Front Parent Pocket for small travel essentials. Includes key clip.
  • TSA-Approved Laptop Sleeve fits up to a 16" Laptop, tablets, magazines. The clamshell design means you can avoid removing your laptop when going through TSA airport security.

 

6. Insulated Lunch Bag (included) 

 

Ships with an insulated Lunch Bag lined with EVA foam to keep your little one's food or liquids cool or warm for multiple hours. Fits all common milk bottles. Easily remove the lunch bag at mealtimes or security checkpoints for screening. The lunch bag measures 8" H x 6" W x 3.75" D.
 

7. Stroller Straps (included)  
 

Ships with 2 Stroller Straps that attach easily to stroller handles.

 

8. Exterior Water Bottle Pockets 

 

Stay hydrated throughout the journey with 2 expandable Exterior Water Bottle Pockets - one for you, one for your little one.

 

9. Luggage Handle Pass-through 

A Luggage Handle Pass-through slides conveniently over luggage handles to help you move swiftly with multiple bags.


10. Security/Passports Pocket 

 

A concealed Security/Passports Pocket is hidden discreetly behind the Luggage Pass-through, and is ideal for storing passports, cash, and other small valuables.

 

11. Detachable Sternum Strap (sold separately)

 

For longer adventures, we have a detachable sternum strap add-on that can be easily attached (snap-on, snap-off) to the shoulder straps on the Getaway Bag for increased support. 

 

Optimal Fit for Different Body Types

 

The Getaway Bag's Shoulder Straps and Quilted Back Panel design maximize flexibility and comfort on a wide range of body types, making it easy to switch between parents of different sizes.

 

 

Size + Capacity

  • Size: 19.7” Height x 10.2” Width  x 6.5” Depth.
  • Capacity: 24 Liters. 
  • Flight Ready: Meets international carry-on size limit requirements.
  • Weight: 2.7 lbs when empty; 3.4 lbs w/ dividers + lunch bag.

 

Sustainable + Premium Materials

Our personal commitment to choosing sustainable materials wherever possible from the very beginning, is what led us to only considering and ultimately choosing higher-priced recycled materials for both our shell and lining fabrics, as well as vegetable-tanned leather trim.

  • 100% Water-Resistant Recycled Polyester
  • 100% Vegetable-Tanned Leather Trim
  • 61% Recycled Polyester + 39% Nylon Interior Lining
  • Premium Metal Front Buckles + YKK zippers throughout
  • Easily wipes clean with a damp cloth. Machine washable in cold water on gentle cycle, as needed. Lay flat to dry.
  • Packaging: Our polybag shipper is 100% recyclable and is made of 100% pre-consumer recycled content. We reduced packaging by combining the polybag and shipper envelope, typically two separate pieces, into one.  

 

 

 

Whether you’re in an aircraft lavatory, the backseat of a car, or the corner of a public restroom -- changing a diaper in tight quarters and on-the-go is challenging. Wear the Sidekick to keep your hands fully available to hold onto your little one and grab wipes one-handed, so you can complete that diaper change ASAP. 

 

Features Deep Dive

1. Retrieve Diaper Wipes One-Handed. 

 

The Sidekick’s back pocket is designed to hold a pack of diaper wipes, with a magnetic closure that enables you to quickly access wipes with just one hand… freeing your other hand to stop your little one from escaping!

 

2. Fits all Diaper Changing Essentials 

 

The Sidekick comfortably fits 4-6x diapers (depending on the diaper size), 1x diaper cream, 1x hand sanitizer, and 1x changing pad (included). The interior slip pocket holds a couple day-to-day essentials (e.g. phone, keys, credit card), while keeping them separated from your diaper items.

 

3.  Changing Pad (included) 

 

Ships with a soft, padded Changing Pad that folds up compactly when not in use. Water-resistant, easily cleaned fabric that is also entirely machine washable (lay flat to dry). Lined with custom hand-drawn illustrations featuring vignettes of parents and little ones on adventures together.

 

Size + Capacity

  • Size: 6” Height x 11” Width x 2.75" Depth.
  • Capacity: 3 Liters 
  • Weight:  0.5 lbs 

 

Sustainable + Premium Materials

  • 100% Water-Resistant Recycled Polyester
  • 53% Recycled Polyester + 47% Nylon Interior Lining
  • Premium Metal Buckles + YKK zippers
  • Easily wipes clean with a damp cloth. Machine washable in cold water on gentle cycle, as needed. Lay flat to dry.
  • Packaging: Our polybag shipper is 100% recyclable and is made of 100% pre-consumer recycled content. We reduced packaging by combining the polybag and shipper envelope, typically two separate pieces, into one. 

 

 

The Complete Backpack

 

Packing for you and your little one(s) can be a challenge, but do not worry as the Getaway Bag has you covered. Here's our packing guide for a newborn: 

 

The Main Compartment: 3 Ways to Pack  

We know packing needs change as children get older and families grow, so we love how the Getaway Bag enables you to adapt to your family’s evolving needs.

 

Newborn: 1x baby carrier, 1x breast pump, 1x lunch bag (which can hold up to 2x milk bottles), 3x long-sleeve sleepers, 1x hand towel, 1x shoes, 3x toys.

 

Toddler: 3x long sleeve sleepers, 1x shoes, 1x hat, 2x large stuffed toys, 5x smaller toys, 3x books, 1x lunch bag, 1x bib, 2x snack/food items, 1x water bottle.

 

3 to 4-year-old: 1x jacket, 1 sweater, 1x shirt/pants combo, 1x hat, 4x toys, 2x books, 1x bucket with multiple beach toys, 1x coloring book + crayons, 1x lunch bag, 1x water bottle

 

 

Our first (small) production run is already done! 

We finished 14 months of product development for the Getaway and Sidekick, and have already invested a lot of time and our personal savings to complete our first small production order earlier this year of 100 units (50x Getaway Bags + 50x Sidekicks). Unlike many other crowdfunding projects, we are well beyond the prototype stage. This approach requires more upfront investment, but it enables us to have a shorter and more accurate timeline for the delivery of your packs. Also, as a backer, you don’t have to wonder if this project will even succeed -- because it already has! You can also take comfort knowing that other parents have already tested out the first small production and given us feedback below!

 

Initial Parent Feedback 

Using our first small production run, we have been able to gather valuable product feedback from our initial parent testers:

The Getaway Bag

 

The Sidekick

 

 

Experienced Product Team + Factory

We should also mention that producing great products is not new territory for us. Our team has years of experience in consumer goods from companies including Timbuk2, Ralph Lauren, Theory, The North Face, Banana Republic, Amour Vert, One Kings Lane and Chairish. Not only that, we’ve partnered with one of the best technical bag manufacturers in the world, behind many of the household brand names in outdoor, travel, and fashion. 

The Vietnam-based factory we work with has been vetted extensively for workplace conditions, safety measures, and labor practices. The team’s working relationship with the factory extends past 15+ years, and we’ve worked closely with them during the design and development of this backpack. We are proud to call them both partners and friends.

 

Satisfaction Guaranteed & a Lifetime Warranty

We are so confident you’ll love the Getaway Bag and the Sidekick that we guarantee that you will. When you receive your bag(s), if you’re not 100% satisfied with the quality, simply send it back within 2 weeks of receipt for a full refund of the purchase price (shipping and handling fees are non-refundable). We’re pretty sure you’ll be more excited to plan a trip with your family, than return it though!

 

For our Kickstarter and Indiegogo backers only, we will also stand behind all our bags with a lifetime guarantee. This covers manufacturing defects and excessive damage occurring during normal use. Normal wear and tear from everyday use is not covered. We hope your bag is perfect, but if you notice a problem, just let us know and we will work with you to make things right.

 

 

Here is a breakdown of how we will use the funds we raise during this campaign:

  • The majority of the funding will be used to finance our next production run
  • Packaging and shipping
  • Indiegogo and processing fees

 

 

  • Research & Design: March - October 2020
  • Prototyping: November 2020 - May 2021
  • Small-batch 1st Production Run (self-funded 50 Getaway Bags + 50 Sidekicks): Delivered to San Francisco July 2021
  • Indiegogo Funding Period: August 2021 - April 2022
  • Indiegogo Bags Delivered: May 2022 

 

 

In order to reduce shipping costs for our early supporters, No Reception Club will cover a significant portion of the actual cost to ship. When you pick the reward, you will be shown what you will be charged to ship to your country. 

Note: Prices do not include taxes, customs fees and/or VAT. That will be subject to the laws and regulations of your individual country, and is due at delivery.  Any customs fees are not dictated by No Reception Club or Indiegogo. 

 

"I don't see my country as a shipping option": At this time, we will only be shipping to the US and Canada. If you do not see your country as a shipping option, it means that we currently do not offer shipping to that country. However, do send us an email if you are from a country that is not shown, we'd love to know about it. If there are enough people who are interested in your country such that it makes sense logistically to ship to that country, we will add it as an option later.

 

 

We (Daniel + Gemma) started NO RECEPTION CLUB in early 2020, just 9 months into parenthood, inspired by our love of traveling with our son Emmett -- and wanting to make it easier to travel with him even more often. We're based in San Francisco where we have lived the last 6 years, but previously lived in New York, Philadelphia, and originally a 15-minute-walk apart in Toronto, Canada over the span of 15 years.  We've been together a pretty long time.

 

Prior to starting NO RECEPTION CLUB, Gemma spent a decade as a merchant and fashion buyer at brands including Ralph Lauren, Theory, Banana Republic, and Amour Vert. Her experience spans women's and men's apparel, accessories, and home categories. Daniel has pursued a multi-year career in the tech sector at various digital-first consumer brands including Yelp, Chairish, and One Kings Lane. And finally, our veteran product designer Greg Bass has spent his over 20-year career designing innovative bags and other products for a multitude of brands including Timbuk2 where he previously led design, and The North Face.

Packaging: Our polybag shipper is 100% recyclable and is made of 100% pre-consumer recycled content. We reduced packaging by combining the polybag and shipper envelope, typically two separate pieces, into one.  

 
 
 
Whether you’re in an aircraft lavatory, the backseat of a car, or the corner of a public restroom -- changing a diaper in tight quarters and on-the-go is challenging. Wear the Sidekick to keep your hands fully available to hold onto your little one and grab wipes one-handed, so you can complete that diaper change ASAP. 

 
Features Deep Dive
1. Retrieve Diaper Wipes One-Handed. 
 
The Sidekick’s back pocket is designed to hold a pack of diaper wipes, with a magnetic closure that enables you to quickly access wipes with just one hand… freeing your other hand to stop your little one from escaping!
 
2. Fits all Diaper Changing Essentials 
 
The Sidekick comfortably fits 4-6x diapers (depending on the diaper size), 1x diaper cream, 1x hand sanitizer, and 1x changing pad (included). The interior slip pocket holds a couple day-to-day essentials (e.g. phone, keys, credit card), while keeping them separated from your diaper items.
 
3.  Changing Pad (included) 
 
Ships with a soft, padded Changing Pad that folds up compactly when not in use. Water-resistant, easily cleaned fabric that is also entirely machine washable (lay flat to dry). Lined with custom hand-drawn illustrations featuring vignettes of parents and little ones on adventures together. Size + Capacity

Size: 6” Height x 11” Width x 2.75" Depth.
Capacity: 3 Liters 
Weight:  0.5 lbs 

 
Sustainable + Premium Materials

100% Water-Resistant Recycled Polyester
53% Recycled Polyester + 47% Nylon Interior Lining
Premium Metal Buckles + YKK zippers
Easily wipes clean with a damp cloth. Machine washable in cold water on gentle cycle, as needed. Lay flat to dry.
Packaging: Our polybag shipper is 100% recyclable and is made of 100% pre-consumer recycled content. We reduced packaging by combining the polybag and shipper envelope, typically two separate pieces, into one. 

 
 
The Complete Backpack
 
Packing for you and your little one(s) can be a challenge, but do not worry as the Getaway Bag has you covered. Here's our packing guide for a newborn: 
 
The Main Compartment: 3 Ways to Pack  
We know packing needs change as children get older and families grow, so we love how the Getaway Bag enables you to adapt to your family’s evolving needs.
 
Newborn: 1x baby carrier, 1x breast pump, 1x lunch bag (which can hold up to 2x milk bottles), 3x long-sleeve sleepers, 1x hand towel, 1x shoes, 3x toys.
 
Toddler: 3x long sleeve sleepers, 1x shoes, 1x hat, 2x large stuffed toys, 5x smaller toys, 3x books, 1x lunch bag, 1x bib, 2x snack/food items, 1x water bottle.
 
3 to 4-year-old: 1x jacket, 1 sweater, 1x shirt/pants combo, 1x hat, 4x toys, 2x books, 1x bucket with multiple beach toys, 1x coloring book + crayons, 1x lunch bag, 1x water bottle
 
 
Our first (small) production run is already done! 
We finished 14 months of product development for the Getaway and Sidekick, and have already invested a lot of time and our personal savings to complete our first small production order earlier this year of 100 units (50x Getaway Bags + 50x Sidekicks). Unlike many other crowdfunding projects, we are well beyond the prototype stage. This approach requires more upfront investment, but it enables us to have a shorter and more accurate timeline for the delivery of your packs. Also, as a backer, you don’t have to wonder if this project will even succeed -- because it already has! You can also take comfort knowing that other parents have already tested out the first small production and given us feedback below! Initial Parent Feedback 
Using our first small production run, we have been able to gather valuable product feedback from our initial parent testers:
The Getaway Bag
 
The Sidekick
 
 
Experienced Product Team + Factory
We should also mention that producing great products is not new territory for us. Our team has years of experience in consumer goods from companies including Timbuk2, Ralph Lauren, Theory, The North Face, Banana Republic, Amour Vert, One Kings Lane and Chairish. Not only that, we’ve partnered with one of the best technical bag manufacturers in the world, behind many of the household brand names in outdoor, travel, and fashion. 
The Vietnam-based factory we work with has been vetted extensively for workplace conditions, safety measures, and labor practices. The team’s working relationship with the factory extends past 15+ years, and we’ve worked closely with them during the design and development of this backpack. We are proud to call them both partners and friends. Satisfaction Guaranteed & a Lifetime Warranty
We are so confident you’ll love the Getaway Bag and the Sidekick that we guarantee that you will. When you receive your bag(s), if you’re not 100% satisfied with the quality, simply send it back within 2 weeks of receipt for a full refund of the purchase price (shipping and handling fees are non-refundable). We’re pretty sure you’ll be more excited to plan a trip with your family, than return it though! For our Kickstarter and Indiegogo backers only, we will also stand behind all our bags with a lifetime guarantee. This covers manufacturing defects and excessive damage occurring during normal use. Normal wear and tear from everyday use is not covered. We hope your bag is perfect, but if you notice a problem, just let us know and we will work with you to make things right.
 
 
Here is a breakdown of how we will use the funds we raise during this campaign:

The majority of the funding will be used to finance our next production run
Packaging and shipping
Indiegogo and processing fees

 
 

Research & Design: March - October 2020
Prototyping: November 2020 - May 2021
Small-batch 1st Production Run (self-funded 50 Getaway Bags + 50 Sidekicks): Delivered to San Francisco July 2021
Indiegogo Funding Period: August 2021 - April 2022
Indiegogo Bags Delivered: May 2022 

 
 
In order to reduce shipping costs for our early supporters, No Reception Club will cover a significant portion of the actual cost to ship. When you pick the reward, you will be shown what you will be charged to ship to your country. 
Note: Prices do not include taxes, customs fees and/or VAT. That will be subject to the laws and regulations of your individual country, and is due at delivery.  Any customs fees are not dictated by No Reception Club or Indiegogo.  "I don't see my country as a shipping option": At this time, we will only be shipping to the US and Canada. If you do not see your country as a shipping option, it means that we currently do not offer shipping to that country. However, do send us an email if you are from a country that is not shown, we'd love to know about it. If there are enough people who are interested in your country such that it makes sense logistically to ship to that country, we will add it as an option later.
 
 


We (Daniel + Gemma) started NO RECEPTION CLUB in early 2020, just 9 months into parenthood, inspired by our love of traveling with our son Emmett -- and wanting to make it easier to travel with him even more often. We're based in San Francisco where we have lived the last 6 years, but previously lived in New York, Philadelphia, and originally a 15-minute-walk apart in Toronto, Canada over the span of 15 years.  We've been together a pretty long time. Prior to starting NO RECEPTION CLUB, Gemma spent a decade as a merchant and fashion buyer at brands including Ralph Lauren, Theory, Banana Republic, and Amour Vert. Her experience spans women's and men's apparel, accessories, and home categories. Daniel has pursued a multi-year career in the tech sector at various digital-first consumer brands including Yelp, Chairish, and One Kings Lane. And finally, our veteran product designer Greg Bass has spent his over 20-year career designing innovative bags and other products for a multitude of brands including Timbuk2 where he previously led design, and The North Face.

story:
We came to the island 3 years ago, chasing a dream of finding a place to raise our future family. We fell for the magic of Pelee Island and found The Nest. The Nest offers lakefront views, bird watching, disc golf, cannabis cultivation, permaculture living, social events, nature hikes, glamping accommodations, a tiny house community and 3.5 acres of serenity. While at The Nest you can find yourself in the middle of the forest or on the water's edge. Imagine being surrounded by monarchs, waking up to the chatter of bird life, casting a line into Lake Erie to catch a prehistoric sturgeon and ending your day by sampling the fruit of the land while stargazing - all from our southern escape. 

We intend to offer a unique experience that can only be discovered on Pelee Island. Come and explore Ontario's best kept secret at Canada's most southern inhabited island.

Melissa is an avid sewer/quilter, paper artist, writer, interpreter, entrepreneur, sailor, knitted sweater lover, rock-tumbling, sheet-tucking, forehead-kissing wife & mom. She believes in doing what's right, comfy beds, cozy slippers, locally-grown organic food and the odd glass of Pelee Island wine.

Roles:

  1. Creature comfort specialist
  2. BnB management
  3. Quality control/food & beverage specialist
  4. Maintenance & cleaning
  5. Social media representative

Justin can be found sailing Wind Dreamer, flying drones, in the kitchen, tending to the garden (Gramly Farm), building something, fixing something or dreaming up the next big project. He stands for good hard work, quality service, organic food, sustainable living, craft beer and all things tiny living.

Roles:

  1. Building-related projects
  2. Farming & cultivation
  3. Cooking breakfast
  4. Maintenance & cleaning
  5. Marketing & advertising

WHY DID WE DECIDE TO NEST HERE?

After listing our 1000 sq. ft. house in Brampton, Ontario, we were looking for the perfect place to raise a family, that would provide waterfront, boat access, permaculture living, large trees, community and the best growing environment where we could host friends and strangers. After countless hours of searching online and many frustrations, we finally found The Nest. We got on a ferry the next day, and after a 3.5 hour drive plus a 1.5 hr ferry ride, we arrived with a stern warning that our adventurousness may result in us not leaving the island the same day and having to possibly sleep in our Smart car. As we drove the island, we met many soon-to-be familiar faces and felt the embrace of the community in what we found out later is not the typical time to visit the island.  We also saw many things that day, including; amazing countryside, birds and some of the best beaches. But one area on the island stood out to us in particular - the South Shore. The idea of The Nest had already started at this point, and it was only going to be a matter of time until we would finally be there for good.

WE NEED YOUR HELP

We have invested in the purchase of the property, 3 years of endless work trips, discovery and exploration. Now we ask for you to invest your vacation with us, your time, second hand items or just good vibes. We will keep doing what we have always done - make handmade items, share our journey and celebrate as each project comes to an end with food and drinks. Come be a part of the beginning of a growing community. Maybe you'll even decide to come back once in a while to see the latest project, because we have no intention of stopping anytime soon.

PRE- BOOK ONE OF OUR STAYS IN A HAND-CRAFTED LUXURY YURT.

  1. Lock in the INDIEGOGO* pricing
  2. Get the date(s) you want once booking becomes available
  3. Receive updates, photos & video content
  4. All "Early Adopters" will be part of a commemorative name plaque on the pergola
  5. VIP access
  6. Our ever-lasting gratitude

CAN'T VISIT? HERE ARE SOME OTHER WAYS TO HELP  "THE PERKS"  Available now!

a) EARLY MORNING FORAGING (COOKBOOK) - It includes the recipes we will be serving at The Nest, exclusive stories of how each dish was inspired. A break down of what is available on the island. Did you know Pelee Island is a micro-climate, meaning its growing season is two weeks longer than other areas of Canada?

 b) A COLOURING BOOK - Colour your way around Pelee Island through a series of our illustrations from all of our visits.

c)  A POST CARD- We will send you or someone of your choosing a unique Pelee Island  image.

 d) BIRD HOUSE -  A multi-unit bird house made from salvaged building materials, made personally by Justin and assembled by you.

e) DISC GOLF DISCS A putter, driver and mid range will be available with various graphics.

f) PLEASE SHARE OUR STORY- We are always influenced by the stories of others, so please share ours!

WHAT WE ARE BRINGING TO THE COMMUNITY ON PELEE ISLAND.

Melissa brings her business Maekr.ca offering sewing services, paper crafting, German/English, Spanish/English translation/interpreting and photography.

Justin brings his business Hunnie Doo a home service company working in the house/cottage/boat maintenance and renovation industry as well as general labour. He also brings his skills as a drone photographer and marketing expert.

We have also both worked in the service industry in the kitchen as well as front of house, bartending & serving. Some places you may have been served by them include, Mai Bistro in Etobicoke and Calamus Estate Winery in Jordan Ontario.

THE NEST IS LOCATED ON SOUTH SHORE RD. PELEE ISLAND, ONTARIO, CANADA.

Between Stone Rd and Curry Rd.

5 min walk to the Stone Alvars Conservation and Pelee Island Bird Observatory.

15 min drive to anywhere else on the island.

To get to The Nest.  By Ferry / Plane

GURTY & PURDY- TWO YURTS - TWO DIFFERENT PERSONALITIES

Accommodations pending local approval (yurts and contents currently being fabricated and acquired by us)

Yurt Features

  1. Sustainable off-grid living in a Yurt (minimal maintenance compostable toilet, grey water system, propane appliances and a solar powered home battery system)
  2. Designed for the average size family (4-6 people per yurt)
  3. Comfortable memory foam beds
  4. High quality cotton sheets
  5. Large windows to take in scenery
  6. Wood stove for rustic feel and coziness
  7. Private BBQ
  8. Outdoor Shower
  9. Entertainment

 

WHAT TO DO ON YOUR VACATION

We have vacationed on the island for a few years now and will be happy to help you plan your stay. There are a lot of interesting things to do on Pelee, all suitable for various times of the day. If you choose to come stay with us, we will provide you with our personalized guide to the island.


Recreation:
Bike rentals & trails
Hiking (Stone Alvars, Fish Point, etc.)
Bird Watching
Boat Charters
Hunting (Pheasant, Turkey, etc.)
Scudder Marina
Public Beaches
+more

Leisure:
Wine Tasting (Pelee Island Winery)
Restaurants
Evening Entertainment
Craft Shops & Markets
Roadside Vegetable Carts
Art Displays
Performances
Sunset Views
Music Festivals
+more
 

 

 

OUR MENU

We don't want to spoil the surprise of the Cookbook, but what we can tell you is that if it's on the island and you can eat it, we've probably included it in this book. Roughly 9240 acres of Pelee Island is cultivated and there are still many other varieties of edibles found on the other 2000+ acres of land. 

EARLY MORNING FORAGING

12 RECIPES ACCOMPANIED BY 12 AMAZING STORIES

24 PAGE, Square Coffee Table Cookbook.

 

Available here until Jan 1, 2021  as well as on our website

Our menu for breakfast at The Nest will be based on these recipes. Excluding items that are unavailable due to high demand. Our recipes and stories come directly from our travels and really show how diverse of a diet we can have. We swear by this recipe list and hope you enjoy it too.

Check out our Instagram page for updates on the Cookbook

 

Our unique take on a bird motel. For every purchase we will be donating $5 to PIBO. Hole positioning, venting and hanging design is specifically made for the smaller varieties of bird that don't mind being close to one another. Among these birds are Purple Martins and House Wrens.

Picture 1 below shows all 14 pieces (excluding the graphic film), Picture 2 is the completely assembled bird motel with "Camo" graphic applied, Pictures 3-7 graphics available as well as camo.

The box is made of salvaged wood, rope and new plexiglass which allows the sun to keep the box warm in the cooler months and the UV graphic films pictured above protect the bird motel in the hot months and can easily be changed year after year to keep this bird motel unique. All films are designs or photos taken by us. We also take special requests for your own graphic (additional fees may apply).

 

All discs are made by Prodigy Disc Golf. We are offering a few different designs. We are producing 25 Putters, 25 Drivers, 25 Mid Range. All proceeds from the sale of discs goes exclusively to the disc golf course. We will be starting with 6 baskets and 9 tees. Check out the perk for more information.

PHASE # 1 - PROJECT WINTER WARRIORS

With your help to meet our goal, you will ensure we have everything we need to spend the winter living on Pelee Island which will allow us to build, create, discover and find the very best experiences for our guests.

  1. Two Yurts manufactured
  2. Install baskets for disc golf course and groom course
  3. Start the building of our permaculture farm (Gramly Farms: Roughly 2000 sq. ft.)
  4. Prepare appropriate parking spaces for tiny homes

 

PHASE #2 - THE MAIN HOUSE - INFORMATION COMING 2021

After the funding Campaign, we will announce further details about Phase #2

story:
FÜRST's Air Beanie is the NEWLY IMPROVED version of last year's Tatsu Down Beanie. Thousands of people like you made that the MOST POPULAR beanie in Kickstarter history!

This is the WARMEST and most VERSATILE beanie that you will ever wear - with even more features and abilities!

 

Packs to the size of a golf ball (stuff sack will be included)

 What's New

  • UPGRADED FILL: Nano-Coated Down for Water Resistance
  • ENHANCED SHELL: Windproof & Water-Resistant Nylon
  • STREAMLINED SHAPE: Sportier Form-Factor, Glove-Like Fit
  • IMPROVED COMFORT: Moisture Wicking, More Breathable

Why Invest in a Down Beanie?

Our heads are up to 5x more sensitive to temperature changes compared to other parts of our body. Therefore, it's essential to keep it warm and protected in cold climates. 

We've long used knit beanies, but they tend to be itchy, inconvenient to pack away, and susceptible to strong winds. 

Often we forget them at home because they're relatively bulky and don't fit into our pockets or take too much space in a purse.

Our previous project to address these issues, the Tatsu, became the most backed beanie on Crowdfunding history ever. After delivering thousands of pieces in the past year, we've learned a lot from the feedback we've received. And by tweaking and tinkering with new ideas, materials, and manufacturers, we're now ready to introduce the result.

MEET AIR,

FÜRST's Improved Down Beanie 

Think of it like an ultra-lightweight, extremely warm down jacket for your head.

With the Air, we strove to provide a more comfortable fit while introducing nano-coated, water-resistant down for even more weather resistance.

The pattern is inspired by Japanese designs, and we've incorporated advanced materials and construction techniques to produce an even higher performance product.

What hasn't changed is our commitment to help under-served youth discover the outdoors and become future stewards of our environment.

 

We're continuing to only use RDS-Certified (Responsible Down Standard) goose down that has been independently verified to ensure cruelty-free treatment of the animal.

Our 700 Fill Power Goose Down is rated higher (which means it's warmer and lighter) than certain recognized brands' jackets, and this grade of down feather can only be found in larger, more mature animals. This premium FP offers an incredible combination of warmth and packability. 

FÜRST's specially treated down features a Permanently-Bonded Water-Resistant Coating. This nano coating enhances the natural hydrophobic nature of goose down to ensure additional protection against the elements.

Down is one of best insulators known to man. High quality goose down offers unparalleled versatility and comfort across a wide temperature spectrum. Compared to other beanies you might own, you'll stay warmer at lower temperatures, and it'll weigh a lot less too!

Our ultra-fine 20 denier nylon is made of a tight weave of silky soft fabric that naturally blocks the wind and provides strong protection against water. It’s also the perfect balance between durability and lightweight protection, allowing the down to loft to its maximum potential.

 

Even as the weather warms up, or as you engage in strenuous activity, you'll stay comfortable longer without having to remove and store your beanie. The Air Beanie is breathable thanks to microscopic perforations in the material small enough to resist liquid water droplets, yet large enough to vent water vapor (your sweat moisture) for it to escape

The Air beanie is also lined with a moisture wicking sweatband that keeps your head dry longer even if you work up a sweat. 

 

Weighing in at just 1 oz (29 grams), the Air beanie can practically vanish as it’s able to compress down to roughly the size of a golf ball. Once it's no longer needed, you can easily stow it away in a pocket or to your purse. This makes it perfect for everyday carry, so you always have it available on hand.

 

 

 

After hundreds of hours of development, and many revisions and prototypes, we're excited to present this product, but we still need your support to make the project a success. A pledge of any amount, however small, will mean a lot to us:

 

[HELP US SPREAD THE WORD] 

We can't thank you enough for checking out our project and helping us make the Air Beanie a reality. We know not everyone will be able to support this campaign with a pledge, but if you support what we stand for, please help us spread the word by sharing on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Reddit, and other media.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

How to Clean Your Air Beanie

When properly cared for, your FÜRST Air Beanie can last for decades. Periodic cleaning will help your down beanie last longer and perform at its best.

Machine-wash

  • Machine-wash on a gentle cycle at 82 °F (28 °C). If available, select the ‘extra rinse’ option. Use a down-specific soap or detergent, like Nikwax Down Wash.
  • Skip the spin cycle. It’s better for your beanie to drip dry and/or use a tumble dryer.

Hand-wash

  • Soak your beanie for up to 60 minutes. Again, go for a down-specific detergent. 
  • Rinse by lightly squeezing out excess water (don’t wring it!) and follow the drying steps below.

Drying

  • Once the wash is complete, carefully remove your beanie and lay it flat on a rack to dry. As you do this, gently fluff up the down filling.
  • It may take up to 24/48 hours to drip dry depending on ambient conditions. As it dries, continue to occasionally fluff it.
  • When almost dry, put it in a tumble drier on the lowest heat settings and check it regularly to prevent overheating. To maximize the loft of your Air Beanie, throw in two to three clean tennis balls to help fluff it up further.

Down is a tough performer against the cold, but when thoroughly soaked (even with the Air's nano-coating), it'll require a little extra attention to ensure it doesn’t get damaged.

Things to Avoid:

  • Fabric softener. Stick to a down-specific detergent for the best results.
  • Dish washing detergent. It will strip the natural fats and oils found in down that prevents it from clumping together and that provides its incredible loft.
  • Dry cleaning. The solvents used in some dry cleaning processes can damage your beanie.
  • A top loader with an agitator. It’s a rougher wash, and your versatile beanie deserves a gentle hand.
  • The spin cycle. Down is heavy when it’s wet, so err on the side of caution to avoid damage.
  • Wringing. Don’t wring your beanie, no matter how heavy it is. If you must, gently shake any excess water off while supporting its weight and squeeze out excess water.
story_txt:
FÜRST's Air Beanie is the NEWLY IMPROVED version of last year's Tatsu Down Beanie. Thousands of people like you made that the MOST POPULAR beanie in Kickstarter history!
This is the WARMEST and most VERSATILE beanie that you will ever wear - with even more features and abilities!

 
Packs to the size of a golf ball (stuff sack will be included)

 What's New


UPGRADED FILL: Nano-Coated Down for Water Resistance

ENHANCED SHELL: Windproof & Water-Resistant Nylon

STREAMLINED SHAPE: Sportier Form-Factor, Glove-Like Fit

IMPROVED COMFORT: Moisture Wicking, More Breathable


Why Invest in a Down Beanie?
Our heads are up to 5x more sensitive to temperature changes compared to other parts of our body. Therefore, it's essential to keep it warm and protected in cold climates. 
We've long used knit beanies, but they tend to be itchy, inconvenient to pack away, and susceptible to strong winds. 
Often we forget them at home because they're relatively bulky and don't fit into our pockets or take too much space in a purse.
Our previous project to address these issues, the Tatsu, became the most backed beanie on Crowdfunding history ever. After delivering thousands of pieces in the past year, we've learned a lot from the feedback we've received. And by tweaking and tinkering with new ideas, materials, and manufacturers, we're now ready to introduce the result.

MEET AIR,
FÜRST's Improved Down Beanie 
Think of it like an ultra-lightweight, extremely warm down jacket for your head.
With the Air, we strove to provide a more comfortable fit while introducing nano-coated, water-resistant down for even more weather resistance.
The pattern is inspired by Japanese designs, and we've incorporated advanced materials and construction techniques to produce an even higher performance product.
What hasn't changed is our commitment to help under-served youth discover the outdoors and become future stewards of our environment.
 

We're continuing to only use RDS-Certified (Responsible Down Standard) goose down that has been independently verified to ensure cruelty-free treatment of the animal.
Our 700 Fill Power Goose Down is rated higher (which means it's warmer and lighter) than certain recognized brands' jackets, and this grade of down feather can only be found in larger, more mature animals. This premium FP offers an incredible combination of warmth and packability. 

FÜRST's specially treated down features a Permanently-Bonded Water-Resistant Coating. This nano coating enhances the natural hydrophobic nature of goose down to ensure additional protection against the elements.
Down is one of best insulators known to man. High quality goose down offers unparalleled versatility and comfort across a wide temperature spectrum. Compared to other beanies you might own, you'll stay warmer at lower temperatures, and it'll weigh a lot less too!

Our ultra-fine 20 denier nylon is made of a tight weave of silky soft fabric that naturally blocks the wind and provides strong protection against water. It’s also the perfect balance between durability and lightweight protection, allowing the down to loft to its maximum potential.
 

Even as the weather warms up, or as you engage in strenuous activity, you'll stay comfortable longer without having to remove and store your beanie. The Air Beanie is breathable thanks to microscopic perforations in the material small enough to resist liquid water droplets, yet large enough to vent water vapor (your sweat moisture) for it to escape

The Air beanie is also lined with a moisture wicking sweatband that keeps your head dry longer even if you work up a sweat. 
 

Weighing in at just 1 oz (29 grams), the Air beanie can practically vanish as it’s able to compress down to roughly the size of a golf ball. Once it's no longer needed, you can easily stow it away in a pocket or to your purse. This makes it perfect for everyday carry, so you always have it available on hand.
 

 


 





After hundreds of hours of development, and many revisions and prototypes, we're excited to present this product, but we still need your support to make the project a success. A pledge of any amount, however small, will mean a lot to us:
 
[HELP US SPREAD THE WORD] 
We can't thank you enough for checking out our project and helping us make the Air Beanie a reality. We know not everyone will be able to support this campaign with a pledge, but if you support what we stand for, please help us spread the word by sharing on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Reddit, and other media.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
How to Clean Your Air Beanie
When properly cared for, your FÜRST Air Beanie can last for decades. Periodic cleaning will help your down beanie last longer and perform at its best.
Machine-wash

Machine-wash on a gentle cycle at 82 °F (28 °C). If available, select the ‘extra rinse’ option. Use a down-specific soap or detergent, like Nikwax Down Wash.
Skip the spin cycle. It’s better for your beanie to drip dry and/or use a tumble dryer.

Hand-wash

Soak your beanie for up to 60 minutes. Again, go for a down-specific detergent. 
Rinse by lightly squeezing out excess water (don’t wring it!) and follow the drying steps below.

Drying

Once the wash is complete, carefully remove your beanie and lay it flat on a rack to dry. As you do this, gently fluff up the down filling.
It may take up to 24/48 hours to drip dry depending on ambient conditions. As it dries, continue to occasionally fluff it.
When almost dry, put it in a tumble drier on the lowest heat settings and check it regularly to prevent overheating. To maximize the loft of your Air Beanie, throw in two to three clean tennis balls to help fluff it up further.

Down is a tough performer against the cold, but when thoroughly soaked (even with the Air's nano-coating), it'll require a little extra attention to ensure it doesn’t get damaged.
Things to Avoid:

Fabric softener. Stick to a down-specific detergent for the best results.
Dish washing detergent. It will strip the natural fats and oils found in down that prevents it from clumping together and that provides its incredible loft.
Dry cleaning. The solvents used in some dry cleaning processes can damage your beanie.
A top loader with an agitator. It’s a rougher wash, and your versatile beanie deserves a gentle hand.
The spin cycle. Down is heavy when it’s wet, so err on the side of caution to avoid damage.
Wringing. Don’t wring your beanie, no matter how heavy it is. If you must, gently shake any excess water off while supporting its weight and squeeze out excess water.

story:
What is Baja Glamping?

My name is Frances Valadez, I am the owner and one of the hosts of Baja Glamping along with my mother, sister and brother. We are all originally from San Diego, California but now I reside full time on the property as a dual citizen.

In the early 90s my father came upon Mulege with his brother on a road trip and instantly fell in love with the town, scenery and the people(how could you not?), once I came into the world we began coming down every summer and winter break. It started with tents at Playa Coyote then it evolved into our 1970s renovated airstream in between the famous palms on Coyote then in 2004 he bought what is now Baja Glamping. 

In 2016 our beloved Papa passed due to Cancer so we decided to take over the land and finish what he had started. Although people have stayed with us off and on over the years, we established Baja Glamping officially 1 year ago and are working very hard to make it the best it can be. We have two indoor spaces available for rent, camping plots, a disc golf course, and loads of ocean equipment like SUPs, snorkeling gear, spears, and Kayaks.

We appreciate all of our guests, friends, and family who have visited and helped us through the years to create our beautiful home. We look forward to the future and what we will become and hope to shed some light on the magical town we are fortunate enough to call our home.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Over the last few years, we had many friends and family offer to help us out but we weren't quite sure what we needed, and what the best way to go about that would be so we decided to wait for a clear vision in order to best use our resources and your generosity. 

After living and working on the property over the last year we have a clear vision of what we would like to accomplish and have already begun work on a few things, but would love to accomplish a few more before next summer-which is where you come in. We don't want to ask for only your charity, so we would like to offer advanced and discounted pricing on our new accommodations as well as a chance to experience some awesome activities and visit the lovely Bahia De Concepcion. 

Some of the things we are already working on

- Digging out and refurbishing our 30-year-old well along with adding a pump so we can water our plants consistently and completely sustainably. 

-Refurbishing our two existing rooms including new handmade wooden decks with welded metal framing and a shaded hangout area.

- Remodeling our old Adobe house to add another room.

- Building a new shower, bathroom, and kitchen area. 

-Leveling and grading a tent camping zone.

What we would like to start with your help.

- Greywater system to maximize the usage we get out of our shower and kitchen water.

- Small ranch/orchard so our guests can have fresh milk, eggs, and made right in their backyard. 

-2 new yurts for added Outdoor Camping.

- A new gate and tree/fence around the property for added privacy and shade

The Impact

Not only will you be helping our family and dream, but also the local community in Mulege.  As with any area that relies on tourism the past 2 years have been tough for local artisans, fishermen, ranchers, and many other workers. Our business along with many others like Mulege Brewing Co, Pollo Berthas, JC's restaurant, Boneys Restaurant, El Candil, Estrella Del Mar, and many many others bring much-needed foot traffic to this area. 

All construction, farming, and equipment(that can be) will be purchased locally and completed by workers who live in Mulege.  5%percent of all money raised will be donated to a local orphanage "Casa Hogar El Altisimo" that our family knows does amazing work with local kids.  If you would like more info on them please feel free to contact us directly. 

As Airbnb super hosts we are well versed in providing an experience guests can enjoy, and would like your help to create an even better one. 

 

For more info check out our Airbnb page here and for more great photos of the property and surrounding businesses and acitivies give us a follow on instagram @BajaGlamping
