story:
WAIDT?, What Am I Doing Today? Now you have an answer!

WAIDT App or What Am I Doing Today? Can easily be summarized as the ultimate concierge application. What does it do? It saves guests time and money in their search for fun experiences anytime, anywhere!

Think of how long it takes you to find things to do on vacation, a free weekend from work, or a special night with a loved one. One hour? Three Hours? or More! You'll be surprised to know it takes some people hours at least a minimum of 6 hours from our research, and in some cases, it continues even when they land in their vacation spot.  Now with our App, hours become mere minutes, and your ability to plan your vacation or have a fun night out becomes simpler than calling for an Uber or Lyft.  

 

How did we get here?

It's my fault, and I'm proud of it.  My name is James Alexander, and my background is as diverse as Elon Musk's ideas for the new world.  I have worked in several industries in Orlando, but my journey in this city began with a national television show called The Daily Buzz.  I produced, booked, marketed, served as community liaison and sales, which included working with National & International companies producing their paid segments for TV shows, and negotiating contracts with Public Relations Firms.  

In 2014, I decided to leave the show after some changes and start my own company.  During my time with the Daily Buzz, finding things to do was easy because I was deeply connected to the industry.  My kids benefit by having an active schedule that included all things Orlando.  But when I started a business outside of entertainment, finances change dramatically, and so did my network.  I wanted to keep the same spirit of exploring the world. Still, I ran into several problems, including too many websites wanting my email to send ads, credit/debit card information that could be compromised, filters galore, hours in front of the computer or phone, and maintaining a budget. Yes, it sounds like chaos because it is!  Every time I would come up short on finding things to do within a reasonable budget. So like any good journalist, I researched to see if there was an app or website that was easy to use, personalized to me, customizable, and my payment for the experiences is made in one place, not several.  There was none, and then I decided to create WAIDT App.  There's more to the story; just WAIDT it gets better!

To further verify my assumptions, I joined Starter Studio, a tech accelerator located in Downtown Orlando.  It was there my passion for the development of this app grew by leaps and bounds.  I knew I had lightning in a bottle, and I could wait to show it off to you!

 

This rollercoaster gets another rider!

I shared my enthusiasm with a good friend who I trust to tell me the truth, wrong or right, about my ideas. JohnCarlo Pellicciotta was the first person I had to sell it to utilize his 15 years of experience in the Visual Communication field. He has a Master’s Degree in Arts, where his main area of study was Interactive Multimedia Arts. His career began in 2006 as a Web Designer specializing in e-Commerce software. He focused on two elements critical to creating a successful and well-designed website, User Interface and User Experience, commonly known as UI/UX.  His ideas fueled revenue growth and companies’ online presence across several industries, including Perfumania, Westgate Resorts, and the American Management Association.

In short, I knew he would be great as my Chief Technical Officer.  JohnCarlo has a passion for creating and innovating. The world will benefit from the unique and progressive ideas Mr. Pellicciotta has for the future of WAIDT.

 

It works!

Thanks to the innovative minds at Mythic Development, my idea now has a brain and personality matrix, more on that for contributors. The team at Mythic looked at my mapped-out idea, and within weeks we had the timeline created from start to launch for the app. This is an important step because you, as a contributor, have to be comfortable with building this platform.

Mythic Development has streamlined the development process, from building software, fixing or replacing older software structures, software architecture, integrations, and data reporting large and small. Get the information and software you need: no matter your field, where you are, or what device you are using.

Mythic Development places security at the forefront of every project. You can rest easy knowing that your information is safe and secure. Everything we do is encrypted using the strictest guidelines in the industry.

Our development team is superior to most development teams because our answer is “Yes, we can” – regardless of how complex the product you imagine. We fully understand every level of the development process, and our team knows nothing is impossible.

Past clients of Mythic Development include NASA, Boeing, and Citrix.

 

Here's where you come in!

The brain and matrix of the platform are done, but we need your help to get through our final steps before launch.  Those steps include Travel and Tourism organization fees, marketing, conventions, UI/UX, legal fees, insurance, call centers, social media managers, staff, accounting, payroll, inventory, i.e., tickets, CLIA, and the United States Travel Association.

As a father, this app is my legacy for my children. I have sacrificed a career in Television to put my focus on this platform.  I know the public wants it and needs it when we are emerging, in some places, from COVID-19 and looking for things to do.  Pre pandemic, I had to verify my feelings about the existence of this app, and I did.  In fact, while doing it, I paid myself to pitch and market the platform to our core customers, tourists. How? I did over 1k rides under Uber and Lyft in Orlando's tourist hotspots of International Drive, Disney, Universal, and Sea World. I have amassed an email list of 750k who want to use this today. I've done the homework, graduated from a Tech Accelerator, developed the relationships, been on TV (Starter Studio - Waidt App), and stand one step away from completing this project.

Help me complete this phase of my journey. 

 

Here's what we need?

We need to raise $2.5 Million to accelerate the final steps and launch this platform in months. That includes finalizing all contracts, memberships, and placement on the Android and Apple Store. We have even created a utility token on Pancake Swap to aid in fundraising. You can find details on how your money is used on the tokennomics page of our website.

What Do You Get?

There are perks for being part of our Day One Program via Indiegogo. 

We understand there are levels to this, and we want to maximize your participation and make sure you feel appreciated for your donations.

Copper: $20

  1. Travel Blog and Newsletter Updates

 

Bronze: $50

  1. Copper Level

  2. Name listed on contributor thank you graphic on Social Media.

 

Silver: $100

  1. Bronze Level

  2. Name called during one of our live updates on Facebook & Instagram

Gold: $250

  1. Silver Level
  2. Zoom Link for Monthly updates on the project
  3. Branded T-shirt
  4. 30 days VIP Membership

Platinum: $500

  1. Gold Level
  2. Choose from one three branded items (Hoodie, Coffee Mug, or Dad Cap)
  3. 3 months VIP membership

Diamond: $1000

  1. Platinum Level
  2. Personal Thank You Video from Founder
  3. Access to the Beta version of platform *location Specific*
  4. 6 Months VIP Membership

 

The Impact

The impact of this platform goes beyond helping Guests find things to do in a personalized and easily customizable way. It also is a vast marketing platform for businesses large and small seeking volume to increase revenue. Additionally, the platform will provide tiers of discounts for the guest through membership levels while allowing them to share their experiences with friends and family to purchase.

I have done the homework, made connections with multiple hospitality and entertainment industry entities, identified multiple revenue streams, and created a platform to help small businesses, planned for cryptocurrency and real estate. This app will change the way people look for recommendations, plan vacations, spend time with their children, and explore their cities. 

My background in television, sales, marketing, real estate, and hospitality aided me in creating an App that came to be because of my love for my family.  We are not a faceless corporation. We are dedicated to creating a life full of memories.  Please be part of our journey. 

Risks & Challenges

Risks involved with this app include copying our platform by other companies. We solved this by creating parts of the platform, including algorithms that can be patented.  Any infringement of those patents will result in negative Public Relations and a massive lawsuit from our law firm. A team of patent lawyers is ready to ensure all bases are covered.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute right now, please share our platform with your family and friends.  We are working tirelessly and need all the help we can in getting this information out to the public.
story_txt:
WAIDT?, What Am I Doing Today? Now you have an answer!
WAIDT App or What Am I Doing Today? Can easily be summarized as the ultimate concierge application. What does it do? It saves guests time and money in their search for fun experiences anytime, anywhere!
Think of how long it takes you to find things to do on vacation, a free weekend from work, or a special night with a loved one. One hour? Three Hours? or More! You'll be surprised to know it takes some people hours at least a minimum of 6 hours from our research, and in some cases, it continues even when they land in their vacation spot.  Now with our App, hours become mere minutes, and your ability to plan your vacation or have a fun night out becomes simpler than calling for an Uber or Lyft.  
 
How did we get here?
It's my fault, and I'm proud of it.  My name is James Alexander, and my background is as diverse as Elon Musk's ideas for the new world.  I have worked in several industries in Orlando, but my journey in this city began with a national television show called The Daily Buzz.  I produced, booked, marketed, served as community liaison and sales, which included working with National & International companies producing their paid segments for TV shows, and negotiating contracts with Public Relations Firms.  
In 2014, I decided to leave the show after some changes and start my own company.  During my time with the Daily Buzz, finding things to do was easy because I was deeply connected to the industry.  My kids benefit by having an active schedule that included all things Orlando.  But when I started a business outside of entertainment, finances change dramatically, and so did my network.  I wanted to keep the same spirit of exploring the world. Still, I ran into several problems, including too many websites wanting my email to send ads, credit/debit card information that could be compromised, filters galore, hours in front of the computer or phone, and maintaining a budget. Yes, it sounds like chaos because it is!  Every time I would come up short on finding things to do within a reasonable budget. So like any good journalist, I researched to see if there was an app or website that was easy to use, personalized to me, customizable, and my payment for the experiences is made in one place, not several.  There was none, and then I decided to create WAIDT App.  There's more to the story; just WAIDT it gets better!
To further verify my assumptions, I joined Starter Studio, a tech accelerator located in Downtown Orlando.  It was there my passion for the development of this app grew by leaps and bounds.  I knew I had lightning in a bottle, and I could wait to show it off to you!

 
This rollercoaster gets another rider!
I shared my enthusiasm with a good friend who I trust to tell me the truth, wrong or right, about my ideas. JohnCarlo Pellicciotta was the first person I had to sell it to utilize his 15 years of experience in the Visual Communication field. He has a Master’s Degree in Arts, where his main area of study was Interactive Multimedia Arts. His career began in 2006 as a Web Designer specializing in e-Commerce software. He focused on two elements critical to creating a successful and well-designed website, User Interface and User Experience, commonly known as UI/UX.  His ideas fueled revenue growth and companies’ online presence across several industries, including Perfumania, Westgate Resorts, and the American Management Association.
In short, I knew he would be great as my Chief Technical Officer.  JohnCarlo has a passion for creating and innovating. The world will benefit from the unique and progressive ideas Mr. Pellicciotta has for the future of WAIDT.

 
It works!
Thanks to the innovative minds at Mythic Development, my idea now has a brain and personality matrix, more on that for contributors. The team at Mythic looked at my mapped-out idea, and within weeks we had the timeline created from start to launch for the app. This is an important step because you, as a contributor, have to be comfortable with building this platform.
Mythic Development has streamlined the development process, from building software, fixing or replacing older software structures, software architecture, integrations, and data reporting large and small. Get the information and software you need: no matter your field, where you are, or what device you are using.
Mythic Development places security at the forefront of every project. You can rest easy knowing that your information is safe and secure. Everything we do is encrypted using the strictest guidelines in the industry.
Our development team is superior to most development teams because our answer is “Yes, we can” – regardless of how complex the product you imagine. We fully understand every level of the development process, and our team knows nothing is impossible.
Past clients of Mythic Development include NASA, Boeing, and Citrix.

 
Here's where you come in!
The brain and matrix of the platform are done, but we need your help to get through our final steps before launch.  Those steps include Travel and Tourism organization fees, marketing, conventions, UI/UX, legal fees, insurance, call centers, social media managers, staff, accounting, payroll, inventory, i.e., tickets, CLIA, and the United States Travel Association.

I have sacrificed a career in Television to put my focus on this platform.  I know the public wants it and needs it when we are emerging, in some places, from COVID-19 and looking for things to do.  Pre pandemic, I had to verify my feelings about the existence of this app, and I did.  In fact, while doing it, I paid myself to pitch and market the platform to our core customers, tourists. How? I did over 1k rides under Uber and Lyft in Orlando's tourist hotspots of International Drive, Disney, Universal, and Sea World. I have amassed an email list of 750k who want to use this today. I've done the homework, graduated from a Tech Accelerator, developed the relationships, been on TV (Starter Studio - Waidt App), and stand one step away from completing this project.
Help me complete this phase of my journey. 
 
Here's what we need?
We need to raise $2.5 Million to accelerate the final steps and launch this platform in months. That includes finalizing all contracts, memberships, and placement on the Android and Apple Store. We have even created a utility token on Pancake Swap to aid in fundraising. You can find details on how your money is used on the tokennomics page of our website.

story:
For far too long the wireless shifting market has been dominated by uber expensive wireless shifting devices. We built XSHIFTER, the world’s first affordable wireless bike shifting device, to make sure that you can focus and enjoy what bikes are made for: riding.

XSHIFTER converts ANY bike to wireless shifting. Whether you’re using a mountain or trail bike, a downhill, a road, a tandem, or a recumbent bike, the XSHIFTER can change the way you ride.

 

Sync the XSHIFTER system with IOS or Android app and adjust your shifting right from your mobile phone. With the app, you can now fine tune your gears on-the-go and update your ELink and Pod software, anywhere, anytime.

 

 

 
 
 
THE XSHIFTER
 
 
                            THE POD
 
 
 
THE E-LINK
 
 

 

                     IT'S MODULAR

 

All you have to do is install the XSHIFTER onto your bike, configure the POD settings, and start riding your bike.

 

The E-Link is designed as a tangle-free, worry-free gear shifting mechanism that operates in milliseconds.

The POD is a completely programmable device so you can configure everything from press time to multiple shifting options. Choose from semi-auto, multi shift, to manual.

 
 

Easy installation in just two easy steps: 1) ditch your old mechanical shifters and throw away old cables; 2) Install XSHIFTER and POD on your bike, and ride.

 

THE VISION
 
BEHIND XSHIFTER 
 
 

As bicycle enthusiasts, we wanted to reinvent the cycling experience by putting the focus back into riding. Although wireless shifting systems are already available in the market, we feel that existing models lack a certain accessibility, preventing all kinds of cyclists from enhancing their riding experience.

XSHIFTER is the product that combines much needed innovation and affordability in the biking industry. For the same functions, users of XSHIFTER are able to enjoy similar amazing features, for much less cost.

In order to be truly accessible, the XSHIFTER had to be adaptable. This is why it fits with all kinds of bikes, gears, and designs.

With XSHIFTER, we believe that we are able to recapture the essence of bicycling by allowing XSHIFTER users to focus on the best thing about being a cyclist: riding.

 

WHY CROWDFUNDING?

Paul Gallagher, the inventor of XSHIFTER, has over 30 years of experience engineering equipment for top grade companies like Harley Davidson, HB Performance, and SRAM.

XSHIFTER was invented after Paul realized the huge opportunity for innovation in the biking industry. And so he started thinking with one question in mind, "How do I make bicycling even more enjoyable?" Ultimately, the answer came in the form of an incredibly smart wireless bike gear shifting mechanism called XSHIFTER. 

A part of XSHIFTER’s goal is to make the best products possible accessible to all kinds of bicyclists. With a platform like Indiegogo, XSHIFTER is dedicated to learn from the biking community in its goal to continually optimize its cycling products.

story:
You don't have to build it. I will.

Here's how you can play your role in my next project. You can pledge for a night stay inside 3 reclaimed van that will be converted into a camper. Choose from few pledging option that will include great extreme sport activities, planned itineraries and dining experience!

But to those who don't know me, let me introduce myself to you. On 2014, I have made the whole Malaysian stumbled on my move to buy a piece of land in Klang and building my very own home using reclaimed containers! It has been 3 solid years for me living in this beautiful house. Since then, many youngsters has followed my step and realizing their dream home too. 

My passion in Living Big in Small Spaces continues with the next project that I believe it has been very popular recently namely TubeStay @ Bukit Jugra. The project has been funded by great people here in IndieGogo and we managed to erect 10 Tubes with complete queen sized bed with air-conditioner fitted in. They just love it! Now, TubeStay will be relocated to a new great place that will be announced soon.

I just can't stop from exploring and thinking about realizing a Campervan Park here in Malaysia. I know it has to begin now, and allow me to share the experience to everyone of you that will be pledging your stay here. Let's support this cause as I wanted to encourage more creative mind to be motivated and follow the same path or creating something better. I seek no financial gain as my main objective but more to grow up catalyzing growth and creativity within community.

How this concept will be realized? 

The whole idea will require approximately RM 60,000 or around USD 15,000.

  • This include paying RM1,200 monthly rental that exclude electricity and water bills.
  • The fund will then be utilized to buy 3 second hand van preferably Fiat Ulysse MPV, a Nissan Vanette van and Ford Spectron Van
  • There will be a lot of expenses required to renovate and beautify the van so it can fit in 1 queen sized bed, a small mini sink, small storage, ventilation and insulation.
  • Do keep in mind, landscaping and renovation of existing toilet is indeed necessary so as paying fair salary to volunteers and workers.

Your pledge will also help me ensuring

  • 2 Extreme sports community to continue offering great experience on Paragliding and Trike Drifting to the public and obviously you during your stay here.
  • It will help the surrounding to have great place for public to relax and unwind while exercising.
  • A public Musolla (praying room) and Toilet will be helpful for the public that come exercising in Bukit Jugra.

Execution

Upon successful fundraising, I will require 3 solid month to complete the project before start accepting our 1st guest (you).

  • The van have to be purchased and maintained before interior renovation begin
  • The landscape at the area need to be perfected so as the communal facility
  • Funders will get the chance to pick their date to stay from the system in the website that will be launched together with the park (Date Selection turn is based on who pledge 1st).
  • 1st day of stay is targetted on 1st October 2017.

If you are pleased to just supporting the idea

You can still pledge minimum amount and be thanked with postcard from me.
Or maybe, sharing this campaign among your friends in social media will be a helpful gesture too.

Join me.

story:
T&O Star backpack is the most solid backpack in the world. It comes with a 14.25-inch-long and 11-inch-wide bullet-proof panel. The backpack is made with UHMWPE ballistic fabric. Additionally, it was created with special techniques to make the plate as light and portable as possible. NTS-Chesapeake Testing reviewed the backpack with the Armor Protection Ballistic Resistance Test and concluded that the panel is strong enough to shield a gunshot from a 9mm pistol.

Due to restrictions on gun advertising content, none of the shooting demonstrations can be provided. However, an accountable test report, which contains repeatable and reproducible results of the lab shooting the backpack, is provided in the description.

The following pictures shows result the after shooting.

 

When you hear a gunshot, you can lift the backpack to cover your head and heart to protect vital body parts. In the meantime, you can run and escape. If you are involved in direct gun violence, the T&O Star backpack can act as a shield to help you survive. You will never walk with a bulletproof vest in the street, but you will always have a backpack with you. Taking the T&O Star backpack with you is bringing safety with you. 

Our bulletproof board supplier is a U.S.-based leading manufacturer of bulletproof plates.

  • NIJ Level IIIA bulletproof level
  • Great weatherability
  • Widely used in personal protection
  • Fully sealed to protect against liquids, chemicals, and harsh elements
  • Maintenance free
  • Bulletproof soft panel is tested under NIJ-0101.06 IIIA body armor standards by H.P. White and Chesapeake.
  • It protects against:
    • 9 mm rounds at speed up to 1400 ft/s
    • .44 magnum rounds at speed up to 1400 ft/s
    • Multi-shot rated on selected threats

 

The T&O Star backpack is also your ideal bag for traveling.  The bag can be attached to a rolling suitcase. Just put away the bag’s shoulder straps and slide the bag over the suitcase handle. Your trip will be easier without any weight on your shoulders.​

The backpack is made from recycled fabric. The zippers and fabric are durable and waterproof. No matter the condition of the weather, T&O Star backpack always keep your belonging safe.

​

The main compartment opens like a suitcase and has enough space to travel for up to one week. Certain pockets are removable for individual design and preference. The outermost compartment provides plenty of room for your tiny belongings, such as a cellphone charger, toothbrush, and pens. This is the easiest and most efficient way to organize your belongings.  

​

In the back of the backpack, a hidden pocket is designed to keep your personal belongings close and secure. On the straps, there are two small pockets designed for easy access, for you alone, to credit cards, personal identification, or emergency cash. 

Furthermore, the T&O Star backpack comes in three colors. It is the perfect travel buddy. We finished the design, so now we need your support to make the T&O Star backpack a reality! ​

story:
Unlike ordinary towels, Lagu repels sand, allowing you to lay with ease while also keeping the sand where it belongs - on the beach! It has quick-dry properties, keeping it fresh for repeated use.

Friendly to both you and the beach, Lagu is the only beach blanket you’ll need for your life on the sands.

The Lagu Story

By using Lagu, beach-goers can help keep sand on the beach instead of clinging to towels where they have washed away in laundry machines, never to be returned to the beach. 

Since 2012, Lagu has helped thousands of beachgoers keep sand where it belongs, on the beach!

Now, Lagu is launching it’s first printed collection. Using our sand repellant fabric, we have 3 collections with designs that showcase some of nature’s beautiful marine creatures, tropical birds and plants. With your support, we'll be able to start mass production of this new collection and benefit marine conservation groups that do important work for the environment and endangered marine animals.

Pintados

Use Cases

Sand repellant and beach-friendly

while being compact and flexible for your beach trips

plus, it's reversible with our classic colors to match your mood!

 

All of our blankets are sewn in a sewing community in Biñan, Laguna, Philippines.

 

Every purchase from our Pintados Collection helps our partner organizations. Lagu proudly supports:

BALYENA.ORG’s mission is to support the conservation of cetaceans – whales, dolphins, and porpoises – and their natural habitats in the Philippines. The organization will achieve its mission through participatory research, advocacy, education, and capacity development for the empowerment of local communities and relevant stakeholders. We are a group of friends and colleagues who are biologists, veterinarians, engineers, geographers, communicators, educators, artists and more, working together using our various knowledge, skills, and experiences.

Save Philippine Seas (SPS) aims to narrow the gap between scientists and the general public, the old and young, and the passionate and indifferent by mobilizing seatizen-led initiatives that are empowering Filipinos towards collective action and behavior change. SPS aims to protect the country's rich but threatened marine resources through IEC campaigns and community-based projects.

Earth Island Institute Philippines loves dolphins and whales and does what it can to protect marine mammals and the ecosystem they live in. They are an organization of environmental advocates and volunteers who work for a better planet, for marine mammals, for the environment, and for the people who live in it. Moving forward with the mantra of making #EverydayEarthDay

FAQs

How is Lagu different from ordinary towels or mats?

Unlike ordinary blankets or mats, Lagu repels sand, so you can keep sand where they belong. It also dries quickly, keeping it fresh for repeated use. And it also lightweight and compact, ready for you to keep in your beach bag!

What is Lagu made out of? How is it sand-repellant?

Lagu’s fabric is made of polyester and woven in a way that does not hold sand or other small particles.

How can you save the beach with your Lagu blankets?

A university study estimates that every tourist unintentionally displaces at least three handfuls of sand per day.

Along with climate change and over-development, the rate of natural sand replenishment in beaches simply cannot keep up.

By using Lagu, beach-goers can help keep sand on the beach instead of clinging to towels where they are washed away in drainages of laundry machines, never to be returned to the beach.

How big is the Pintados beach blanket?

How do I wash my Lagu blanket?

How do I fold my Lagu blanket?

How long will it take to receive my order?

It will take approximately 5–6 months once the campaign is over. Each Lagu blanket is hand-sewn and is handled with great care. We want to ensure that each Lagu blanket you receive is of the highest quality.

I want to order more than 10 blankets.

For wholesale inquiries, please send us an email shop@lifeonthesands.com.

For orders 50 and above, please send an email to shop@lifeonthesands.com

Stay updated with Lagu!

Using our sand repellant fabric, we have 3 collections with designs that showcase some of nature’s beautiful marine creatures, tropical birds and plants. while being compact and flexible for your beach trips

story:
Your backyard, a massive slip and slide and a real bungee rope, get ready to get horizontal!

 

Discover our complete, ready to use horizontal bungee kit in a bag

Bring a kit to your next party, bbq, family gathering, church group, wherever, all you need is space.
Zungee doesn't require hills or slopes to slide on, unlike traditional slip and slides it's all about you and a very stretchy bungee rope. 
Save your kids today from the tyranny of WiFi and LCD screens and get them onto a Zungee horizontal bungee. They will love it; we know, we've tested it.

People who have used Zungee and what they said

 

What's in a Zungee kit?

The base Zungee kit both adult and kids contain the following components

 

Easy to set up

Straight out of the bag Zungee can be set up in less than 10 minutes.

You don't require a slope or hill in your backyard, any open space will work.

Hammer in the stainless steel ground anchors and connect the safety line, or connect to a sturdy tree or post with the supplied lanyard.

The runway, made of super slippery PVC laminated tarpaulin unfolds out to a huge 33ft x 6ft. 

Simply secure the runway to the ground with the supplied dome topped pegs every 3ft.

You can also attach the safety lanyard to a post or tree rather than using the ground anchors provided.

Why Zungee

We love the concept of horizontal bungee, there are so few truly exciting things to do in your own backyard. While petanque, bocce & croquet are enjoyable, they are hardly exciting.
Zungee offers everyone - kids and adults a chance to play something a little exhilarating

We want to make Zungee the ultimate, most renowned game for outdoor backyard use by creating an easily obtainable, simple, home recreational activity for BBQs, parties, kids birthdays' or the family gathering.

Kids and Adults can play Zungee

Zungee can  be played by both adults and kids over the age of 8. A weight of 30Kg (66lbs) is approximately the minimum weight. Maximum weight for adults is 125Kg (275lb)
 

Quality & Safety

We use only the best quality materials for Zungee because we want it to last for many seasons of entertainment and we want you to be safe. You would definitely say we have way over engineered the product for both durability and our peace of mind.

Our Carabiners are the same locking clasps that mountain climbers use. They attach to both the user's waist belt and the ground anchor are rated at 12kN, that's more than 1200Kg's or 2600 lbs of weight loading capability. In comparison the load on the bungee rope when stretched is less than 100Kg or 220lbs. They are super tough and  will last for a very long time.

Zungee is also equipped with a safety Anchor system, meaning there are two joined ground anchors. If for some reason the primary anchor is pulled out of the ground when in use the secondary anchor is there to catch the load.
The two anchors are joined together with a heavy duty webbing strap and two more carabiners and the lanyard is rated at 23kN over 2300Kg's or 5000lbs far far in excess of any load that the equipment should experience in normal use. We use this system so you have options on how to anchor the bungee rope, placing the anchors in the most effective locations.

 

How you can help us to achieve our goals

We are very excited about the prospects for Zungee, (almost frothing at the mouth)... we would love it if you felt that way too.

Your support will validate our product offering and at the same time raise enough funds to scale production for international distribution.

We believe there are thousands of you who'd love to Zungee and so would your friends. You can help us by spreading the word to make Zungee the next "Wham-O Slip and slide". They sold in excess of 20 million units. We might need to run another campaign to get to that level!

If you like the campaign, like the product or just like the thought of good old fashioned fun... then please share this with as many people as you can - awareness and traffic is everything! That alone would be an awesome show of support for us and we'd be eternally grateful!

The best support is for you can provide is to commit to a Zungee kit perk here on our campaign.
We believe your ownership of a Zungee kit will make you our greatest advocate.

What we need?

  • We are looking to raise US$175,000 to:
    • Expand our handmade bungee rope manufacturing capabilities
    • Acquire machinery for production items such as stainless steel ground anchors, safety lines and runways
    • Compliance, obtaining CE for Europe, CPSC for the USA and other certifications
    • Minimise outsourced partner relationships
    • Present at trade shows to get further volume and distribution

Where's it going to go?
 

The majority (55%) of the funds we raise will allow us to get the volume discounts on inventory in the first instance.
There are no directors' salaries, management salaries or otherwise until this is a fully fledged business.

You've read this far, you are clearly interested in horizontal bungee, awesome, knew you would be!

What's in it for you?

  • We have oriented our perks to be ninety percent about getting your very own Zungee kit because that is what we all want, right? Be the one who introduces Zungee to your friends
  • We shaved margins and made an exceptional deal on the kits for this campaign, you won't see this good a deal once there are retail margins involved
  • We further discounted kits with multiple Zungees so you can have more family or group fun
  • I am offering up my own home in Phuket as a VIP perk, two lots only of seven nights each.
    The villa perk in Phuket Thailand - 'Baan Paragone' is a 10,000 sq ft villa with infinity edge pool overlooking the amazing Phang Nga Bay. But wait there's more... included in this offer is a unique tour around the bay in a traditional Thai long-tail boat for a day. Regrettably, it doesn't include the airfares to get there, we're afraid that will have to be on your dime. Trust me, its worth it.

What if Zungee doesn't reach its funding goal?

  • We understand that crowdfunding can be fickle and it is often difficult to generate enough interest/exposure for a project. 
  • We have considered not reaching our goal and have geared our perks so that we can achieve crucial parts of what we want to do, given as little as half our target budget.
  • We are most hoping for validation of our product and your investment in our future is just that.
  • If we don't reach our goal our expansion will simply be slower than we would have hoped. If product interest is strong, we can and will make Zungee happen.

Your Impact

By supporting Zungee, you will:

  • Get kids outdoors, into the backyard... where they belong.
  • Get adults doing fun and entertaining exercise without even knowing it.
  • Provide an excuse for hundreds of parties, for those that need an excuse.
  • Save thousands of people from hours of screen time.
  • Make my day, week and year.

Risks & Challenges

  • Risk of injury doing horizontal bungee.
    It is inherent in the nature of the game itself that people will fall over, sometimes not the way they would prefer. Sporting type injuries are highly probable -These are risks you take with most sports. 
    Our intention is to put a hefty disclaimer on every kit so that the user understands the potential for injury and is using it at their own risk.
  • No intellectual property to protect our creation from being copied.
    There are likely to be cheap ripoffs. We intend to be the gold standard of horizontal bungee and to retain that position.
    The bungee rope is one of the more difficult parts to replicate. If you want to know why see AJ Hackett building bungy cords or our own brief description video, Handmade Zungee ropes

​Other Ways You Can Help

I know you have friends who play football, rugby or are transfixed by extreme sports. Help us by getting involved - send a personal message to those friends with our links in it. You can find Indigogo links for most social media on this page. Share it today or as soon as possible to ensure your friends get the early bird bargains on our product. They are definitely limited!

If you like the product and the concept then your willingness to share our project with other people who might like it will be of immeasurable help, its all about reaching the right people to make the product happen. Please use the Indiegogo share tools to send this out to your friends.

FAQ

Could I make my own horizontal bungee kit?

Sure you can. Some of the individual components of horizontal bungee are obtainable.  
Bungee / bungy like this has been around for around 30 years or more.
The time and effort to obtain individual parts and the likely performance, quality, safety and costs when purchased individually would easily exceed the cost of a Zungee kit.
Zungee offers a simple and cost-effective solution while eliminating the hassles and dangers of DIY versions.

Why are there Adult and kid versions?

Its a case of simple math, a 30kg (66lb) child does not have the pulling strength of a 120Kg (260lb) Person. We had to make  heavier cord for adults.
No matter how hard we tried, there was no simple method to make a one size fits all product

What's the difference between training bungee and Zungee?

Training bungees are made of a single tubular bungee. These tube bungees offer low strength elasticity and safety in comparison to Zungee ropes. Zungee ropes are made of multi-strand silicone impregnated latex and are what is used by commercial vertical bungee jumping operations. The Zungee cord offers far greater elasticity and long-term strength.

What does a Zungee kit weigh?
Approximately 11 kg or 25 lbs 

What ages is Zungee suitable for?
We offer the guideline that the Zungee Kids kit is suitable for children from 8 years old onwards. Smaller lighter children under 30Kg (66lb) may struggle to pull the rope.

What's the difference between kids and adult Zungee?
Adult Zungee ropes are thicker and designed to give sufficient pull for an adult weighing 60Kg (132 lb) or more. Children struggle to pull the thicker heavier adult rope.

Invest in one of our Zungee kits today, there's a range to suit your needs, we guarantee you wont be disappointed!

story:
Face of Indawgyi is the first social enterprise in our part of Myanmar. We are a locally registered company and we promote the welfare of the Indawgyi Lake region and its residents. It is a community-focused organization that promotes four main pillars: educational opportunities, cultural preservation, environmental conservation, and sustainable development.

 

 

Reduce and remove plastic waste by creating a comfortable space for tourists to stay and use this money to create infrastructure and build awareness. After two years, we are getting closer to this goal, but need your help. 

 

From our website and social media to all the projects we do around the lake, everything we do is geared towards connecting you to the community.

 

 

 

 

  • With $70,000, we will have the money to start construction of the hotel/training-school. It's not everything we need, but it's a strong start.
  • From here, we can begin implementing larger scale community projects that we have been developing such as promoting the dying local language of Shan-ni, developing local sustainable industries, expanding our plastic awareness campaign, and develop the hotel training-school. 

 

Around Indawgyi Lake, there is a huge absence of opportunity for children to find secure employment. Formal education for most ends before the tenth grade and the majority of work is seasonal fishing and rice farming. Through partnerships with local families and experienced hospitality trainers, the hotel school will draw in additional foreign and local visitors to the region to effectively prepare the local economy for future growth.  

 

Freshwater shrimping, local cooking classes, riding bamboo bicycles and trekking through mountains—these experiences we already offer allow you to engage in a range of unique activities only found here. Even now, just by participating in these experiences you directly support our community projects. So be sure to check out the Indawgyi Lake Experiences perk package!    

 

Face of Indawgyi is a coming together of friends, but this is not just our project - this is everyone's project.

 

My name is Stephen, I'm a sociologist and I first came to Myanmar and Indawgyi in 2015. I kept going back to the lake over the course of 2 years and finally took it a step further and actually moved to Indawgyi full-time in July 2017.  During this time, I co-directed two documentary films, one for the US Embassy and the USAID about the archiving of oral history in the country, the other use and practices of the oldest Myanmar tradition: Thanaka.

The associate director has an M.A. in International Studies from Korea University and has extensive experience in global business trends, digital marketing, and education, he has also been a writer and editor since college. He has written for a variety of publications and websites and has been assisting in the Face of Myanmar Project since its inception.

The official translator and social media editor for Face of Indawgyi's Burmese content. She is currently finishing her graduate degree in Computer Science at the University of Computer Studies, Mandalay (UCSM), and has a strong interest to apply her technical skills to community-based projects following graduation. 

 

The South Indawgyi Community Coordinator. He is from the local village of Nam Mun and a recent graduate of Pinnya Tagar Academy, a partner of Face of Indawgyi. Sut Mai Aung majored in sustainable community development and has already been putting these ideas to practice. He teaches several courses as well as develops and facilitates development projects across the lake.  As a speaker of three languages, Kachin, Burmese and English, he is the perfect liaison between Face of Indawgyi, its partners and the people of the region. 

We are setting a foundation to bring together people from many different backgrounds, skill sets, and experiences to create something new. Everybody has something to offer to help make this project a success. 

 

Indawgyi is still something of an undiscovered gem, but as its visibility increases, there are many ways that it can be developed. We want to ensure that it is done sustainably and that it maintains the natural harmony and beauty that the lake's residents have enjoyed for countless generations. 

Indawgyi Lake was recently designated a UNESCO Biosphere Reserve. The lake is a stunning environment and tourism is growing here.  As such, our guesthouse would appeal to a broad audience from those wishing to take part in a social enterprise to individuals who simply want to enjoy the natural beauty of the area.

 

The guesthouse is to be a blend of modernity and tradition. Its look will be inspired by local architecture and use traditional materials, patterns and fabrics throughout the entire property. Sustainability is also at the center of our mission, and the head architect will be Mr. Traina-Dorge’s sister, a LEED Certified architect, Jennifer Traina-Dorge. LEED is an international green design standard and we aspire to be the first LEED certified building in Myanmar. Her design will be complemented by a Yangon-based firm (Blue Temple) which has done projects throughout the country including in Kachin State. They will supervise a local construction team from the lake.

The process of opening a guesthouse in northern Myanmar has been more grueling than any of us could have ever expected. 

Social enterprises are a fairly new concept in general, let alone in a place like here where we are trying to redefine what a business can mean to a community. In any place, this would be a challenge to do. But when it is a place where we are the first foreigners to ever live adds a whole new level of challenges. 

We have traveled up and down this country more times than we can count.  The paperwork can only be done either in Yangon which is more than 800 miles away or more often than not created for the first time ever here in the township.

Formal landownership documents, contracts, and permits are new to a place that saw only 17 foreign visitors just a few years ago.  But, by digging into the community and working together, we have been able to build the relationships and partnerships needed to turn this project into a success. 

 

Our primary strategy to develop a successful hotel school is giving specialized community education free of charge. We will provide specialized hospitality courses to Indawgyi residents as young as 16 years old and offer an official certificate upon completion. As part of a two-year contract for training and employment, we will provide students a monthly stipend with half given for their personal use and the other half put in a savings account along with a completion bonus.

These savings are key in allowing children to start a new life where they have the option to either continue work at home or find hospitality jobs in cities elsewhere in Myanmar and abroad.

 

Face of Indawgyi has already established an office at the lake. We are the first foreign company registered in the township and the third in Kachin State. During the past months, we have done numerous projects in our four target areas.

One example was a plastic awareness campaign utilizing locally-made sustainable trash cans that created the infrastructure to support the waste needs of four villages and two tourist sites. We have also trained a small staff and have hosted two interns to assist in our day-to-day operations.

Finally, we post all our social media content in both Burmese and English to reach domestic and international audiences and are continuing to work to add more languages to our platform! 

 

Our projects have already attracted the attention of local and international media including Frontier Myanmar, Sampan Travel Magazine,Myanmore, Coconuts Yangon, Le Petite Journal, Eleven News Media, Mizzima,  and others. We have a growing social media following both in Myanmar and abroad creating awareness of our brand and mission. 

 

We have also worked with local partners to create a travel platform,  Find Myanmar, making Kachin State more accessible to travelers. There's not much information about the state in English, and through this site, we have helped both local and foreign tourists get a new perspective on an undiscovered area. 

 

Not only will you be helping to support communities throughout Myanmar, but you will receive awesome gifts you can either keep, and put them on your coffee table, or you can gift them to your loved ones.

There are many cool things to choose from like:

  • Embarrassing photographs of the project coordinators 
  • Customized, unique experiences in Indawgyi Lake
  • Handmade gifts, like longyis, scarves and more from small villages in Myanmar.
  • And much more! Check out the perks on the right side of this page for the full list.

What Happens If We Don't Raise All The Funds?

If we don't collect all the funds we are asking for here, then we will go to investors. We've already prepared a pitch deck, but the more money we raise here, the quicker we can get to creating better, more impactful projects at the lake. 

 

E-mail it. Share it. Post it. Tweet it.  

We understand not everyone can give, but you can help us spread the word! We will be posting videos, updates, pictures, interviews, and blogs to keep you informed on our progress. Use the share tools on this campaign to help us meet our goal, and get ready to explore this dynamic country with us!

For further information on our mission and our progress, check out our website: www.faceofindawgyi.org

Please go to the top of the page and press "Back it" or and feel free to choose the amount of donation or choose your favorite perk.

VISIT US:  https://www.faceofindawgyi.org

FOLLOW US and SHARE:

https://www.facebook.com/faceofindawgyi

https://www.instagram.com/faceofindawgyi ​

CONNECT WITH US: stephen@faceofindawgyi.org

THANK YOU!

Face of Indawgyi Team

 

How do I tell you which photos/prints I want? If your perk requires you to choose something (e.g. choosing which photo you want), make your selection by leaving a private comment for us on our Indiegogo page. The "Comment" tab is just below the project title "Face of Myanmar". If you're on a smartphone, you'll first have to scroll all the way down the page and click "Full Website" in the bottom lefthand corner. Then you'll find the "Comment" tab as described above.  As long as you check the box "keep private" next to the "ADD A COMMENT" button, nobody will be able to see your comment but us.  Make sure to leave us your email address in the comment so we can link your comment to your contribution and address!

What's the story with shipping? We will ship your items as soon as possible. With custom goods, it may take additional time. Please note, that we are in a very isolated area and shipping can be a challenge so do be patient. We can send out electronic perks quickly, but other items will take some time ;) 

Why isn't my credit card working when it normally does? If you're able to input all of your billing information on the contribute page, but Indiegogo still isn't accepting your credit card, report the problem directly to support@indiegogo.com. 

For Adopt a Brick perk:  You have 35 characters of your choice. Dedicate it to your family, friends or even yourself. Pour your heart out. Just be sure you send us a personal message after you claim this package so we know what you want to say on your brick. 

Disclaimer: For all perks involving stays at the Lon Ton Social Impact Guesthouse or trips to Indawgyi, you are responsible for booking/paying for you own travel, food, etc unless otherwise specified. 

Why Crowdfunding:

We have personally invested around 75,000 USD plus two years of surveying local conditions, training a small team, and starting community projects. Still, significant additional funds are needed.

Originally, I saved enough money to cover the land lease and initial construction costs, but the capital required to legally register our company and start operations have used up most of these savings.

We have been approached by several interested investors and know that we will find financing and turn Lon Ton Social Impact Guesthouse into a reality. But investors focus on returns and we want to stay focused on what is important to us. We have a mission – to use revenue from sustainable tourism as a way to fund projects at the lake. The more money we raise from crowdfunding, the less we have to return to investors and the quicker we can get larger scale projects up and running. 

What have we done and invested into up to now?

  • 5-Year Company Registration ($26,000)
  • Concept Development
  • Land search and down payment ($10,000)
  • Property Document Acquisition ($1,500)
  • Open office ($2,000)
  • Branding and communication ($700)
  • Architectural design concept ($3,750)
  • Environmental, topographical and geological studies (4,260) 
  • Detailed design and engineering of all bungalows and facilities on the property (1,600)

What are we looking for?

  • Contributors that share our vision of creating this new hotel experience. 
  • Financial contributions
  • Other contribution such as knowledge sharing, contacts, and maybe even volunteering

What do we offer?

Participation in our social, environmental, and conscious business – an opportunity to improve lives and be part of the Face of Indawgyi Family. And, of course, we have many great perks that allow us to provide...:

  • Early bird discounts and co-founder benefits for our first hotel guests
  • Indawgyi programs for those ready to embark on their own personal adventures 
  • Opportunities to connect with the local Shan-ni community and their elders who are happy to share their wisdom and healing powers.

* What Terms & Conditions apply to our Perks?  

For all Perks:

  • After choosing your Perk you will receive a personalized certificate via email.  
  • With this certificate, please contact us to check availability and make your reservation.
  • All Perk offerings are subject to availability.

For Room Night Perks:

  • Your Room Night Perk certificate will be valid once the hotel has started operation and remains valid for the next three years after the opening date (planned for Q2/2019).  
  • When you call to make your reservation, we will ask for your Perk certificate number and the donor's name. All certificates can only be used once and cannot be replicated.   
  • Blackout dates may apply
  • These Perks are created specifically for this Crowdfunding campaign and cannot be combined with any other offer, current or future hotel promotions or discounts.
  • The Perk is valid for two adults with a max of two children under 12 years old. Additional guests may cause additional cost. 
  • Perks do not include any applicable government taxes at time of occupancy.
  • Service Charge not included in Perk amount.
story_txt:
Face of Indawgyi is the first social enterprise in our part of Myanmar. We are a locally registered company and we promote the welfare of the Indawgyi Lake region and its residents. It is a community-focused organization that promotes four main pillars: educational opportunities, cultural preservation, environmental conservation, and sustainable development. 
 Reduce and remove plastic waste by creating a comfortable space for tourists to stay and use this money to create infrastructure and build awareness. After two years, we are getting closer to this goal, but need your help.  From our website and social media to all the projects we do around the lake, everything we do is geared towards connecting you to the community.    
With $70,000, we will have the money to start construction of the hotel/training-school. It's not everything we need, but it's a strong start.
From here, we can begin implementing larger scale community projects that we have been developing such as promoting the dying local language of Shan-ni, developing local sustainable industries, expanding our plastic awareness campaign, and develop the hotel training-school. 
 Around Indawgyi Lake, there is a huge absence of opportunity for children to find secure employment. Formal education for most ends before the tenth grade and the majority of work is seasonal fishing and rice farming. Through partnerships with local families and experienced hospitality trainers, the hotel school will draw in additional foreign and local visitors to the region to effectively prepare the local economy for future growth.   Freshwater shrimping, local cooking classes, riding bamboo bicycles and trekking through mountains—these experiences we already offer allow you to engage in a range of unique activities only found here. Even now, just by participating in these experiences you directly support our community projects. So be sure to check out the Indawgyi Lake Experiences perk package!     Face of Indawgyi is a coming together of friends, but this is not just our project - this is everyone's project. My name is Stephen, I'm a sociologist and I first came to Myanmar and Indawgyi in 2015. I kept going back to the lake over the course of 2 years and finally took it a step further and actually moved to Indawgyi full-time in July 2017.  During this time, I co-directed two documentary films, one for the US Embassy and the USAID about the archiving of oral history in the country, the other use and practices of the oldest Myanmar tradition: Thanaka.The associate director has an M.A. in International Studies from Korea University and has extensive experience in global business trends, digital marketing, and education, he has also been a writer and editor since college. He has written for a variety of publications and websites and has been assisting in the Face of Myanmar Project since its inception.The official translator and social media editor for Face of Indawgyi's Burmese content. She is currently finishing her graduate degree in Computer Science at the University of Computer Studies, Mandalay (UCSM), and has a strong interest to apply her technical skills to community-based projects following graduation.  The South Indawgyi Community Coordinator. He is from the local village of Nam Mun and a recent graduate of Pinnya Tagar Academy, a partner of Face of Indawgyi. Sut Mai Aung majored in sustainable community development and has already been putting these ideas to practice. He teaches several courses as well as develops and facilitates development projects across the lake.  As a speaker of three languages, Kachin, Burmese and English, he is the perfect liaison between Face of Indawgyi, its partners and the people of the region. We are setting a foundation to bring together people from many different backgrounds, skill sets, and experiences to create something new. Everybody has something to offer to help make this project a success.  Indawgyi is still something of an undiscovered gem, but as its visibility increases, there are many ways that it can be developed. We want to ensure that it is done sustainably and that it maintains the natural harmony and beauty that the lake's residents have enjoyed for countless generations. Indawgyi Lake was recently designated a UNESCO Biosphere Reserve. The lake is a stunning environment and tourism is growing here.  As such, our guesthouse would appeal to a broad audience from those wishing to take part in a social enterprise to individuals who simply want to enjoy the natural beauty of the area. The guesthouse is to be a blend of modernity and tradition. Its look will be inspired by local architecture and use traditional materials, patterns and fabrics throughout the entire property. Sustainability is also at the center of our mission, and the head architect will be Mr. Traina-Dorge’s sister, a LEED Certified architect, Jennifer Traina-Dorge. LEED is an international green design standard and we aspire to be the first LEED certified building in Myanmar. Her design will be complemented by a Yangon-based firm (Blue Temple) which has done projects throughout the country including in Kachin State. They will supervise a local construction team from the lake.The process of opening a guesthouse in northern Myanmar has been more grueling than any of us could have ever expected. Social enterprises are a fairly new concept in general, let alone in a place like here where we are trying to redefine what a business can mean to a community. In any place, this would be a challenge to do. But when it is a place where we are the first foreigners to ever live adds a whole new level of challenges. We have traveled up and down this country more times than we can count.  The paperwork can only be done either in Yangon which is more than 800 miles away or more often than not created for the first time ever here in the township.Formal landownership documents, contracts, and permits are new to a place that saw only 17 foreign visitors just a few years ago.  But, by digging into the community and working together, we have been able to build the relationships and partnerships needed to turn this project into a success.  Our primary strategy to develop a successful hotel school is giving specialized community education free of charge. We will provide specialized hospitality courses to Indawgyi residents as young as 16 years old and offer an official certificate upon completion. As part of a two-year contract for training and employment, we will provide students a monthly stipend with half given for their personal use and the other half put in a savings account along with a completion bonus.These savings are key in allowing children to start a new life where they have the option to either continue work at home or find hospitality jobs in cities elsewhere in Myanmar and abroad. Face of Indawgyi has already established an office at the lake. We are the first foreign company registered in the township and the third in Kachin State. During the past months, we have done numerous projects in our four target areas.One example was a plastic awareness campaign utilizing locally-made sustainable trash cans that created the infrastructure to support the waste needs of four villages and two tourist sites. We have also trained a small staff and have hosted two interns to assist in our day-to-day operations.Finally, we post all our social media content in both Burmese and English to reach domestic and international audiences and are continuing to work to add more languages to our platform!  Our projects have already attracted the attention of local and international media including Frontier Myanmar, Sampan Travel Magazine,Myanmore, Coconuts Yangon, Le Petite Journal, Eleven News Media, Mizzima,  and others. We have a growing social media following both in Myanmar and abroad creating awareness of our brand and mission.  We have also worked with local partners to create a travel platform,  Find Myanmar, making Kachin State more accessible to travelers. There's not much information about the state in English, and through this site, we have helped both local and foreign tourists get a new perspective on an undiscovered area.  Not only will you be helping to support communities throughout Myanmar, but you will receive awesome gifts you can either keep, and put them on your coffee table, or you can gift them to your loved ones.There are many cool things to choose from like:
Embarrassing photographs of the project coordinators 
Customized, unique experiences in Indawgyi Lake
Handmade gifts, like longyis, scarves and more from small villages in Myanmar.
And much more! Check out the perks on the right side of this page for the full list.
What Happens If We Don't Raise All The Funds?If we don't collect all the funds we are asking for here, then we will go to investors. We've already prepared a pitch deck, but the more money we raise here, the quicker we can get to creating better, more impactful projects at the lake.  E-mail it. Share it. Post it. The "Comment" tab is just below the project title "Face of Myanmar". Then you'll find the "Comment" tab as described above.  As long as you check the box "keep private" next to the "ADD A COMMENT" button, nobody will be able to see your comment but us.  Make sure to leave us your email address in the comment so we can link your comment to your contribution and address!What's the story with shipping? We will ship your items as soon as possible. story:
The New Way To Stay Warm

The Cozee was originally invented out of a necessity for our daughter Brianna. Due to her being wheel-chair bound, she has poor circulation and gets cold very easily. We needed a portable heating blanket, but when we began this journey there was no such thing. So we made it a thing!

Our first prototype solved Brianna's issues with the cold. We knew this technology would enhance the lives of anyone and everyone who has ever been cold. So we got busy and perfected The Cozee for you. This is the new way to stay warm!

 

 

The Cozee Wraps Around Your Lifestyle

We understand the importance of being present. Life is full of beautiful moments, but can easily be missed with distractions at every turn. Don’t let getting cold pull you out of the moments that matter most. Here at The Cozee, we are enhancing lives by creating innovative solutions for staying warm.

 

Patented Technology

We've just been granted patent protection from the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO). We filed several years ago, and most of our friends said a patent would be next to impossible to be granted. Well, miracles do happen! We are now the only ones who have the rights to design, manufacture and distribute a blanket powered by a battery in the US and its Territories...AND...we have the rights to sell it anywhere in the world we choose. 

(If you'd like to take a look at the actual patent, go to the web address for the USPTO's Patent search - http://patft.uspto.gov/netahtml/PTO/srchnum.htm - and enter our Patent # 10,104,720).

The patent is in my name - Paul LaRue - so it can be passed on to our children and grandchildren! We are so incredibly grateful that for the next 20 years, we'll be the ones that bring this NEW FRONTIER of heating blankets to the world.

Where We Are Now

We have built out a specific plan for our manufacturing process and have confidence in shipping The Cozee on time. If there are any changes due to materials, suppliers, or unforeseen events, we’ll ensure that we keep each of our supporters fully updated. We have finalized the trial production and with your support will begin the mass production.

How You Can Help

Beyond financial contributions, there are other ways you can get involved!  

  • Help us to spread the word! Share our campaign with your friends and family on social media!
  • Follow us on Facebook and Instagram
  • Visit our website, thecozee.com 

And that's all there is to it.

story:
What is Van der Waal

It's a clear non-skid alternative to surf wax, easy to install and that requires almost no maintenance. It’s crystal-clear which means that your surfboard will always look like new, and it doesn’t melt, so your board will never stain other surfaces it comes in contact with, such as your surfboard bag, your car or your clothes.
And because it doesn’t get sticky or dirty it is always clean.

r.Evolution Series

High grip


Improved grip with new material and texture

Softer to skin & wetsuit friendly


r.Evolution Series is made from a more rubbed material, less harsh then Performance Series 2.0, which means that it will not cause any kind of damage to your wetsuit or your skin, while allowing you to surf in all conditions and water temperatures.

Ultra light
With a weight of only 3grms per hexagon, r.Evolution Series is lighter than wax

Crystal Clear

 
This new version of Van der Waal is so translucid that all your surfboard design will remain visible

Thinner
1mm thick so it will not hurt your skin while dragging your feet on those more radical step ups.

r.Evolution Series

Comparison table

Main advantages when compared with traditional surf wax

 

Our history

Van der Waal was born in 2015 and its parents are Martim Dornellas and Afonso Silva, two old-time friends who came up with the idea of creating a product to use on surfboards that would be as effective as wax but that wouldn’t stain the boards or mess with their design.

In 2016 we launched the first version of Van der Waal and called it Performance Series. 

In 2017,  after several surveys, research and tests, we improved Van der Waal grip. This new version of the Performance Series was launched as Performance Series 2.0

 

Featured in

Surf Europe 100 best products for surfing in 2018

A strong community

Since our first tests, we were always surrounded by good-hearted people that have truly helped us along the way. We are really proud of our community and it was from their sincere feedback and insights that this new version was made.
On 2017 we decided to ask our Waalers to send us their videos, this is their contributions.

 

Where your money will go? 

As a pre-sale campaign, almost all funds will go for production, packaging and all steps necessary to send all backers our new version of Van der Waal. Part of the funds raised will go for a promotional video shoot.

Other Ways You Can Help

All comments and feedback will be more than welcome! And feel free to share this campaign among your friends.

story:
Join Our Adventure

We're sailing the 65' classic 1929 race-winning yacht The Blue Peter (@thebluepeteryacht) from English Harbor in Antigua to Nantucket. An approximately 1500 nautical mile trip mostly around 400 miles off the US coast, through the Bermuda Triangle, with a quick stop in Bermuda to check comms and refuel.

Our motley crew of Gentlemen Rogues was created by a partnership of New York based bespoke Englishman, Duncan Quinn (@duncan_quinn), and Mat Barker, the owner and captain of The Blue Peter.

We'll be fueled by the wind, and plenty of the Official Rosé of Antigua Classic Yacht Regatta - our very own Provençal rosé, Quinn Rosé (@drinkquinn), which is made around 30 minutes north of St Tropez in the south of France.

What We Need & What You Get

We're looking to raise $33,001. But every dollar counts.

To fund this adventure we're:

1) shipping Quinn Rosé direct to you across the USA. Shipping is free for 6btls or more - you get to drink, we get to sail...win-win!;

2) taking bookings for charters of The Blue Peter in Nantucket this summer and beyond - get your own chance to sail aboard this beautiful classic yacht;

3) Selling swag - caps, tees and other good stuff;

4) maybe get a mention in Maxim Magazine (Duncan Quinn is the Editor-at-Large) - this is free

All perks are offered at a discount to the open market, are not charity asks for a freebie, and have real value. Hell we even think you'll enjoy them all and your mates will be jealous and want some (feel free to point them in the right direction.)

Without your support this flight of fancy won't make it to it's destination. So please join our motley crew from afar, and sip some rosé as we all raise a glass together on our trip from the Caribbean to Nantucket.

If we don't reach our goal we're still going to take a run at it - all funds will be used to support the cause, and the more we raise towards our goal the easier it becomes for us not to die of scurvy or float off course into the Bermuda Triangle to reappear in 1942.

The Impact

Adventure is the heart of human discovery. We can't all discover a new continent, climb a new mountain, or investigate the depths of the ocean. But we can support such endeavors. And know that we are a part of making dreams achievable. Both for those pursuing the adventure, and others who dream of pursuing them.

Duncan Quinn has been saying "yes" to adventures ever since he was a kid. From lonely travels through far flung destinations long before social media recorded these things in minute (and sometimes annoying) detail, to annual road trips across Africa to compete in a 4x4 rally to save elephants and help conservation in Zambia. He's a man who rises to challenges. And wants you to join in the fun as much as you can.

Mat Barker left a cushy job at a bank in 1999 and used his savings to buy The Blue Peter and restore her. He's been sailing the world ever since, funding his adventures by taking those with the need for speed yacht racing across the globe. And mostly winning. In Antigua, Palma, St Tropez and elsewhere.

We're asking you to help our adventure. And the dreams of those who think that such things are not possible.

Risks & Challenges

Nothing is ever easy. But offshore sailing on a 100 year old teak and bronze yacht with canvas sails is definitely a challenge. We're not all trained sailors, and in fact more than a few of the crew are better at inhaling rosé than they are at tying a knot.

Although it may sound like a sunbathing extravaganza there'll be blood, sweat and tears. As well as 24 hour watches taken in shifts to make sure we remain on course.

Although we have a plan, as the old joke goes, making a plan is usually the way to make God laugh. So we'll be using our survival and other skills to make it from Antigua to Nantucket in one piece.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you'd love to help, but your rosé budget doesn't extend to a bottle, a case or a lake, and you can't corral your buddies into springing for charter aboard Blue Peter this summer in Nantucket please help in any other way you can. From getting the word out on social media, to using the Indigogo share tools, or getting your company to send us something of use we can put in our social media and other stories along the line.
story_txt:
Join Our Adventure
We're sailing the 65' classic 1929 race-winning yacht The Blue Peter (@thebluepeteryacht) from English Harbor in Antigua to Nantucket. An approximately 1500 nautical mile trip mostly around 400 miles off the US coast, through the Bermuda Triangle, with a quick stop in Bermuda to check comms and refuel.
Our motley crew of Gentlemen Rogues was created by a partnership of New York based bespoke Englishman, Duncan Quinn (@duncan_quinn), and Mat Barker, the owner and captain of The Blue Peter.
We'll be fueled by the wind, and plenty of the Official Rosé of Antigua Classic Yacht Regatta - our very own Provençal rosé, Quinn Rosé (@drinkquinn), which is made around 30 minutes north of St Tropez in the south of France.

What We Need & What You Get
We're looking to raise $33,001. But every dollar counts.
To fund this adventure we're:
1) shipping Quinn Rosé direct to you across the USA. Shipping is free for 6btls or more - you get to drink, we get to sail...win-win!;
2) taking bookings for charters of The Blue Peter in Nantucket this summer and beyond - get your own chance to sail aboard this beautiful classic yacht;
3) Selling swag - caps, tees and other good stuff;
4) maybe get a mention in Maxim Magazine (Duncan Quinn is the Editor-at-Large) - this is free
All perks are offered at a discount to the open market, are not charity asks for a freebie, and have real value. Hell we even think you'll enjoy them all and your mates will be jealous and want some (feel free to point them in the right direction.)
Without your support this flight of fancy won't make it to it's destination. So please join our motley crew from afar, and sip some rosé as we all raise a glass together on our trip from the Caribbean to Nantucket.
If we don't reach our goal we're still going to take a run at it - all funds will be used to support the cause, and the more we raise towards our goal the easier it becomes for us not to die of scurvy or float off course into the Bermuda Triangle to reappear in 1942.

And know that we are a part of making dreams achievable. Both for those pursuing the adventure, and others who dream of pursuing them.
Duncan Quinn has been saying "yes" to adventures ever since he was a kid. From lonely travels through far flung destinations long before social media recorded these things in minute (and sometimes annoying) detail, to annual road trips across Africa to compete in a 4x4 rally to save elephants and help conservation in Zambia. He's a man who rises to challenges. And wants you to join in the fun as much as you can.
Mat Barker left a cushy job at a bank in 1999 and used his savings to buy The Blue Peter and restore her. He's been sailing the world ever since, funding his adventures by taking those with the need for speed yacht racing across the globe. And mostly winning. In Antigua, Palma, St Tropez and elsewhere.
We're asking you to help our adventure. And the dreams of those who think that such things are not possible.

Although it may sound like a sunbathing extravaganza there'll be blood, sweat and tears. As well as 24 hour watches taken in shifts to make sure we remain on course.
Although we have a plan, as the old joke goes, making a plan is usually the way to make God laugh. So we'll be using our survival and other skills to make it from Antigua to Nantucket in one piece.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you'd love to help, but your rosé budget doesn't extend to a bottle, a case or a lake, and you can't corral your buddies into springing for charter aboard Blue Peter this summer in Nantucket please help in any other way you can.
