Céline Verleure, française et parisienne de longue date, est la fondatrice et directrice artistique des parfums Olfactive Studio. Elle a commencé à créer des parfums il y a 25 ans (Kenzo Jungle, l'Eau by Kenzo, etc...)
Nous avons besoin de vous aujourd'hui pour créer et financer un nouveau flacon exclusif pour l'ensemble de la gamme Olfactive Studio. Le flacon actuel est plutôt réussi mais c'est un moule de verre standard, utilisé aujourd'hui par de nombreuses marques et donc peu identifiable, ni reconnaissable et qui ne peut être protégé en cas de copie. 
Un moule de fabrication de verre en France coûte 22.000€ / US$25,000
En contrepartie de votre participation à ce beau projet de design, vous pourrez choisir un ou plusieurs parfums de notre gamme actuelle en commençant par nos kits découverte de 7 parfums jusqu'à la collection complète de l'ensemble de nos parfums actuels. Au fil des semaines, nous vous guiderons sur le choix d'un des parfums de notre gamme selon vos goûts. Le choix du parfum se fait par échange d'email dans les 24 heures suivant votre contribution.
Votre participation est précieuse pour nous permettre de lancer ces nouveaux flacons à temps pour Noël 2016, c'est à dire que les flacons soient fabriqués en juillet et remplis en septembre prochain. Sans vous il sera difficile d'être prêt pour Noël sans prendre de gros risques financiers pour notre jeune société ou en lançant avec retard. 
Un grand merci d'avance pour votre générosité !

story:
The Story

Rio de Janeiro is without doubt the most mesmerizing city of South America, The city is famous for its beaches Copacabana and Ipanema, for the giant Jesus status known as "Cristo Redentor" (Christ the Redeemer) on the Corcovado mountain and for the Sugar Load mountain. But those are just the most visited places.

Drone photography allows us to seek beauty in ways and angles that we couldn't imagine in the past! So after we began the project, we start searching for the most incredible places in Rio de Janeiro, that couldn't possibly be imagined or achieved with human eyes.

Waterfalls (Véu da Noiva - Itatiaia):

Buildings (Torre do Rio Sul - Rio de Janeiro):

Slums (Favelas do Vidigal e Rocinha):

Non-touristy Beaches (Praia do Forno - Búzios):


The Book

The first book of the "Up Above" project will concentrate on the state of Rio de Janeiro. Our idea is to list the 50 best places in our state and deliver the 'drone point of view' of them. Parks, mountains, slums, beaches, waterfalls, museums, radical sports and many others places and activities will on the book.

Our goal is to have enough money to print 100 books ($70 a book). Since photography books are a bit expensive to produce and to purchase, we've established reward categories for people that believes on the project, but perhaps don't feel like spending $70 on it.

The rewards categories are:

Project Contributor ($10): 
Thank you for supporting this project! Every little bit encourage us to begin that journey of showing world's most beautiful places over new angles.

Special Contributor ($25): 
Your name will be listed in our book as a special perk, so people can see you are a part of that project!

Poster Fan ($35): 
Supporting us at this level you'll receive an A2 size poster (42 cm x 59 cm) of any photograph of the project! You will be able to choose it from a gallery. Your name will also be listed in our book as a special perk.

Photo Book Print Partner ($70): 
We will send you a first edition hardcover of the "Up Above Project - Rio de Janeiro" bringing together 50 photos of Rio's most incredible places! We will also add your name in our book as a special perk.

Signed Supporter ($90): 
We will send you a first edition hardcover of the "Up Above Project - Rio de Janeiro" signed by the author, and also an A2 size poster (42 cm x 59 cm) of any photograph of the project! We will also add your name in our book as a special perk.

Incredible Supporter ($190): 
We will send you 3 signed copies of the "Up Above Project - Rio de Janeiro" book. We will also add your name in it as a special perk.


What We Need & What You Get

Our main goal is to raise enough money to create a hardcover, full-color photo book. If we are successful and raise more money than the original ask, we will be able to make this project bigger and start thinking worldwide.

Please help support the campaign so we can create this photo book and get to know world's most beautiful places from new angles.

For those who would like to see more photos of this kind, you can also find this project on Instagram and Facebook.

Risks & Challenges

We are using a printing service that comes highly recommended. Still, there is a chance of printing delays or printing errors with large photo books. If this happens, we will send a message with details of delays to contributors while working to correct the issue.

If we have a very large number of orders, delivery of the books could be delayed as a much larger printing run would be required. If this happens, we will contact contributors to let them know when they will receive their books. If the number is sufficiently large, we will split the printing order into multiple orders. Contributors entitled to a signed copy  will receive their books from the first shipment. Later shipments will be sent out as they are available. 

Regardless of what challenges we face, I am dedicated to this project and will ensure we create a quality book.

story:
For the last three years I have striven to make new, and original, content for the community. I've never really asked for anything in return, but now I do need your help.

I use Adobe CC in so many areas of my work for textures, audio assets, video editing etc. etc.
Sadly, however, the costs of using this software is a massive ~ £500 a year.
On top of this I travel a LOT to various events throughout the year. Most of these events I travel to to help with educational projects, or to see you all.
All this plus the cost of hosting servers for UHCs, developing maps etc. is a significant amount of money.

The goal of this project is to help to keep doing what I do...as awesome stuff IS coming. Specifically; allowing me to keep access to this software on a day to day basis. I'm aware that there are many open-source alternatives but losing these tools will significantly hinder that process as the software I use now has become a very significant part of my work flow.

Any extra funding will go into my travel/accommodation fund for future events, server costs and allowing me to produce more awesome work for you all.

Most of the perks in this campaign will be delivered shortly after the campaign ends.

story:
Short Summary

At the Eagle Harbour Service Association, we are dedicated (and we mean dedicated) to the development of our community. We perform community improvement projects, such as trash clean-ups, social events, and public murals. 

Our local Eagle Harbour beach is a family-friendly seaside abode. In this campaign, our goal is to bring a further attraction to the beach; one that is entertaining, durable, and applicable to people of all ages. Bingo! We want to install a concrete ping pong table at Eagle Harbour beach in West Vancouver.  

This project is our largest so far, and we are determined to see it succeed. Through the combined support of all of our donors, we will be creating a legacy that will bring entertainment to visitors for years to come.


What We Need & What You Get

The all-in cost of a single, outdoor concrete ping pong table is $3,600. With this money, we will be supplying to our local community:

  • A durable concrete ping pong table (as shown in the image above)
  • Two sets of ping pong balls and rackets
  • Year-round entertainment for youths, adults, and seniors
In the unfortunate case that we do not reach our goal, all funds raised will be spent on the construction of a giant chess court in the same area.  

The Impact

The main reason why we love this project is the lasting impact that it will have on our community. Eagle Harbour beach is a peaceful, but highly frequented destination for tourists from around the world. If you live in West Vancouver, or ever intend on visiting Eagle Harbour beach, our friendly community and ping pong table will be here to greet you!

We are currently working on a project to establish outdoor beverage container recycling bins in the same area. These bins will play a vital role in controlling waste levels in the Eagle Harbour neighbourhood.   


Other Ways You Can Help

This project is the first of many to come. You will be providing an invaluable service to the Eagle Harbour Service Association by following us on instagram @eagle_harbour and checking out our website!

story:
Carbon Folding Bike - chedech


Request from Commuting Bike Riders

  • Folds small in one quick moment, with ease.
  • Light enough to carry by hand.
  • Runs fast and pleasant to ride.
  • Absorbs riding impact for comfort.

= Carbon Folding Bike, chedech!!



Strong Points of chedech

1. Fast and easy to fold into a small, convenient, compact size.

One of the main features of chedech is its small-sized folding function, which is perfectly suited for commuting. You can ride many hours without worrying about your endurance, because you can take a taxi or bus when you are tired. And, when you arrive at work you don’t need to let your bike stand alone outside in bad weather, unwatched. You can keep it under your desk and then quickly unfold it for the ride home. chedech’s folding mechanism was built with time management in mind. We adopted quick release system and even invented new hinge system for the main folding part. When folded, chedech is secure and easy to carry.


2. Lightweight.

chedech uses a special carbon material that is used throughout the frame (main and rear) and handles.

All the major parts are made of carbon fiber, and that leads to a comparatively lightweight bike. For example, our five-speed model is only 9kg (without pedal) and the single speed model is a mere 8kg. (final selling bike's weight is subjects change)

 This lightweight design helps you to ride faster, and you can also ride uphill more easily. Just like a good carbon road bike, it feels like someone is pushing you from behind per each stroke.


3. Strong and Durable.

We completely understand where to use carbon and where to use metal. For the folding hinges, we used metal to keep it strong for folding movements. For the other frame parts we used carbon to keep the bike light and comfortable. In addition, we use a stronger carbon material for the parts connecting the metal hinge and carbon frames. This is done by adding extra chemicals, which make those linking parts stronger than the other carbon areas.


4. Flexibility.

It’s commonly known that a carbon frame gives a much more comfortable riding experience, especially for long journeys. Many bike riders think that it’s natural for a mini-velo to shake and vibrate a lot because of the smaller wheels that rotate more cycles per distance as compared to standard size wheel sets, as well as of shorter forks. We solve this shaking (or vibrating) problem by using a carbon material, because carbon absorbs impact and vibration. Unfortunately, the vibration caused by smaller wheels and forks also cause additional physical stress for the bike rider. So, many people even think a mini-velo is not apt for long rides, but this is not the case with chedech, which gives the rider a smooth carbon bike and flexible riding experience. You will feel and enjoy the carbon body in each pedal stroke. The bike will glide a long way even you stop pedaling. You cannot help agreeing with top cyclists, who always choose carbon bikes for competitions.



5. Sharp-Looking!

It was not easy creating a unique style for chedech. It’s a fast riding carbon bike that is also comfortable. We could either show our bike as easy-riding with a more comfortable look, or we could show our bike as a fast riding carbon bike with a sharp shape. So, we were initially torn between the two design concepts, but finally we found a balance that we hope you like. chedech looks comfy and fast.


Technical Features of chedech

This bike was designed with many technical improvement and new inventions.




1. Hexa Form of Main Frame.

This clearly indicates our development process. The main frame has a hexa form, which makes the frame resist against a twisting impact. In order to make it foldable into a compact, small size, we adopted a one line frame system, not a triangle system that often leads to an unstable riding condition due to the bike being affected by twisting impact between the handle and the saddle. Therefore, it had to become a hexa form and also thicker than usual pipes bikes are using for their frames.


2. Chemically Reinforced Carbon Fiber.

Our study group tested many different carbon fibers in order to diminish the twisting movement on the frame. We did everything possible to come up with a more stable frame, such as testing different fibers, adding extra chemicals, or adopting various ways of adding carbon sheet per each part. As a result, the final product has a much stronger frame than our first sample bike of two years ago.


3. Hidden Wall Inside the Frame.

To reinforce and strengthen the frame to resist the twisting impact, we came up with a new design concept. A wall is inserted into the frame that gives more support that resists against pulling in one direction. This added a little weight, but it helped us to complete a dream bike that featured a one line carbon frame bike that does not shake while riding. We inserted this internal wall in main frame, handle post and seat post, and our chedech became more stable than initial models.


4. New Folding Mechanism.

In order to make a more competitive folding bike, we paid careful attention to the folding mechanism. We studied the way other bikes folded and tried to make our own way to attain a more stable and faster movement while folding. The hinge between the main frame and rear frame is a new invention that allows speedy folding and unfolding. Special hinges were developed for this new quick release system. However, we are not completely satisfied with the current hinges and will continue to upgrade them into smoother moving ones.


5. Optimum geometry for a one size frame bike

Most folding mini-velos are limited in frame size due to its folding mechanism, and they offer only one size, regardless of the bike-rider’s height. Nevertheless, it’s very important to design a one frame size bike that is capable of accommodating different sized cyclists. We were well aware of the shortcomings of chedech, which has short distance between two wheels due to the small folding size. If the bike’s geometry allows a large difference on the bike-rider’s saddle location per height then the bike will be insecure for uphill riding. This is because the front side will not be pressed enough with the bike-rider’s upper body weight. So, we tried to keep the weight balance, regardless of cyclists’ body size, and that made the one size chedech very stable for most bike-riders, regardless of uphill or downhill cycling. This well-balanced geometry allows a wider variety for the bike-rider and more stability.

6. Speed

The main concern for a bike is speed. But this factor is forgotten for many folding bikes. Most manufacturers ignore speed in order to make the bike foldable. Impact absorption is often sacrificed in favor of small wheels. So, this foldable mini-velo is not fast or does not allow fast riding with added vibration. But you don’t need to worry about losing speed with foldable mini-velo now. With chedech’s anti-twist main frame design, you can run fast as much as you do with carbon road bike. Most testers started their review with one sentence, that they could feel the riding emotion when they usually have with a carbon road bike, and we think that is good explanation for the final chedech. It gives fast and smooth riding condition.


7. Weight

All bike designers are stressed-out about weight, especially with folding bike designs. A lighter bike is often the reason someone buys. For a folding bike, weight is a topic of much discussion and research because most cyclists want to carry their bike inside public transportation, into buildings, and even store under their desks. A stable carbon folding bike could not be made for several decades, so the task has been impossible to solve until now. With chedech, you can have the first hand-carryable, light, folding bike. chedech-5 (five speed bike) is 9kg, and chedech-1 is single speed bike, with weight of 8kg only. (this weight information is subject to change in the final selling bikes).


F&Q

What kind of bike is chedech? 

chedech is a small-wheeled city folding bike. We usually call it folding bike or folding mini-velo. chedech is a city bike, not a mountain bike. Several fatigue tests have been conducted, and we are confident that our bike frame is strong enough for the rigors of urban riding!

Is chedech an experimental bike?

No! chedech is not an experiment bike. Rather, it is a very practical bike. This is not much different from a standard, everyday high quality bike. However, this is the last bike that could have been possibly made of carbon, and we made it. In that way, it’s a huge advancement!

Wheel size

chedech will have a wheel size of 18 inches, which makes it interchangeable with other standard 18 inch wheels. Some bikes use odd sizes that are not standard, forcing the user to buy all replacement parts directly from that manufacturer at a higher cost. Again, we are using an android model for maximum compatibility. 16 inch is too small for the riding comfort level, and 20 inch would interfere with the folding mechanism. Clearly, 18 inch is not as common, but they are available and should be more readily available in the near future. Tannus currently makes an 18 inch puncture-free polymer tire that is perfectly suited for city bikes.

What manufacturing safety standards are followed?

First, our bikes are sent to the Korean testing organization, which is considered as strict as EN. Once passed, our agency in each country can surely satisfy all other manufacturing safety standards. We also visit our factory and suppliers often and do in-person quality assurance at each step of the way. All of our suppliers adhere to rigorous, documented international testing protocols. Our frames are stress-tested with 100,000 compressions.


Click here to lean more about the chedech F&Q


SELECT A PERK

We are releasing two different types from the beginning.

  • chedech 5 - BLUE will be stylish, but gently concealing the carbon material.
  • chedech 5 - BLACK will be less decorative, but boldly revealing a carbon-look.

Specifications of the product are subject to change without notice for performance improvement.

E-MAIL: tommy@tommyzai.com

(this weight information is subject to change in the final selling bikes).
F&Q
What kind of bike is chedech? chedech is a small-wheeled city folding bike. We usually call it folding bike or folding mini-velo. chedech is a city bike, not a mountain bike. Several fatigue tests have been conducted, and we are confident that our bike frame is strong enough for the rigors of urban riding!Is chedech an experimental bike?No! chedech is not an experiment bike. Rather, it is a very practical bike. This is not much different from a standard, everyday high quality bike. However, this is the last bike that could have been possibly made of carbon, and we made it. In that way, it’s a huge advancement!
Wheel size
chedech will have a wheel size of 18 inches, which makes it interchangeable with other standard 18 inch wheels. Some bikes use odd sizes that are not standard, forcing the user to buy all replacement parts directly from that manufacturer at a higher cost. Again, we are using an android model for maximum compatibility. 16 inch is too small for the riding comfort level, and 20 inch would interfere with the folding mechanism. Clearly, 18 inch is not as common, but they are available and should be more readily available in the near future. Tannus currently makes an 18 inch puncture-free polymer tire that is perfectly suited for city bikes.What manufacturing safety standards are followed?First, our bikes are sent to the Korean testing organization, which is considered as strict as EN. Once passed, our agency in each country can surely satisfy all other manufacturing safety standards. We also visit our factory and suppliers often and do in-person quality assurance at each step of the way. All of our suppliers adhere to rigorous, documented international testing protocols. Our frames are stress-tested with 100,000 compressions.
Click here to lean more about the chedech F&QSELECT A PERK



We are releasing two different types from the beginning.


chedech 5 - BLUE will be stylish, but gently concealing the carbon material.


chedech 5 - BLACK will be less decorative, but boldly revealing a carbon-look.


Specifications of the product are subject to change without notice for performance improvement.E-MAIL: tommy@tommyzai.com

story:
Short Summary:

The SunSmart Solar Generator is a R&D project of Access Institute of Research.

  • Access was founded in 2003 with a mission to find practical solutions to Renewable Energy and Global Climate Change. 
  • For the past 6 years our science team has researched and built a photo-voltaic electric energy generator that is more cost effective and solves many of the problems current solar energy systems suffer from.
  •  Our design goal was 1/3 the cost of current systems, with  1/10th the space, and functions at night.  
  • We want more people to afford solar energy and overcome the traditional barriers that the current systems have. 
  • We believe that individuals given the chance will buy into solar energy to help the environment and boost renewable energy production.  SunSmart gets you there. It's Solar 2.0!
  • More Technical Details at Our Web Site

What We Need:

Break it down:

  • We at Access have spent $40,000 developing a prototype of our Solar Engine, we now have a working proof of concept and know how to make this product.
  • We need to take this project to next stage which is production of beta test units.
  • We hope that we will reach our funding goal which will allow us to open our flagship factory.  
  • We believe that our technology is at an early stage and that the output of the generator can be boosted by 4X. We need funds to reach that goal.
  • Crowd funding will free us from the influence of professional investors and allow us to do the right thing. 

The Impact:

  • People have become aware of the problems associated with fossil fuels. We believe that solar energy has been too expensive and has several problems in deployment that leave many people out who would otherwise want to be included. So by changing the technology to make it less expensive and more accessible to many more people we can boost the adoption of a very good source of renewable electric production.
  • Our Team is a seasoned group of people that have been involved in 4 startup companies and know what is needed to get a company off the ground.
  • We will utilize a distributed manufacturing strategy that will allow more people to be involved and will provide more good paying jobs in Technology.
  • We are a 501(C3) non-profit educational corporation so your donation may be tax deductible. We want the funds to go for clean energy so you can make a choice.
  • SunSmart can be used to develop Microgrids in developing countries

Risks & Challenges:

  • We know our technology works. It is new and not many people are aware of the technical details that make it work. So we have had and continue to have a challenge in explaining how it works. We hope that our videos and other documents to come will explain more of this to others.

  • It will take a number of years to penetrate our market segment because real renewable energy innovations move slower than internet software.  We will continue to provide test data and keep people informed about our progress.

 Other Ways You can help:

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please help  get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  •  Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

PERKS CHART

600 Bricks will send a SunSmart to your favorite NGO or disaster relief organization.

story:
Bienvenue à bord !

 

Qui sommes-nous ?

Des amis, des frères des soeurs, des cousins, des curieux... En réalité nous sommes déjà près d’une vingtaine de passionnés derrière cette levée de fond, tous unis et motivés par ce défi de taille : Sauver Aster!

Aster ?

Aster, c’est un voilier robuste et fidèle, dans la famille depuis bientôt quinze ans. Habituellement, il croise en Bretagne, en Vendée ou parfois part faire des balades plus loin toujours à la recherche de petits ports charmants pour des escales inattendues. 

Récemment, l’impensable s’est produit. Lors d’une tempête, Aster rompt ses amarres et dérive pour finir sa course le long des côtes. Il trouve refuge le long d’une avancée en bois, provoquant d'importants dégâts sur la coque, sur le pont et à l’intérieur du bateau.

Pour reprendre la mer en Mai 2019, des travaux s’imposent: réfection de la coque, révision du réseau électrique qui a pris l’eau, remplacements de pièces de gréement endommagées, etc.

Ces dernières années, ce voilier a embarqué tant d'équipiers: dès qu’on sort en mer, on embarque bien sûr nos amis mais aussi le passant, le cuistot, l’équilibriste, l’ingénieur, le photographe, le poète ou le rêveur : Tout le monde a toujours été le bienvenu ! C’est donc toute une petite famille qui cherche aujourd’hui à sauver l'ambiance d’entraide, de partage et de douce folie qui règne autour d'Aster. Pour ce faire, quoi de mieux que d’agrandir la communauté ?

Concrètement...

Rejoignez notre programme "Navigation 2019" et cette petite communauté qui se bat aujourd’hui pour redonner santé à ce bateau et ainsi, prolonger, dans les années à venir, ce programme de navigation unique, avec ce voiler dont la coque a déjà parcourus tant de milles nautiques pour mener à bon port des équipages enthousiastes.

Après l’urgence du sauvetage, Aster est rentré en chantier où il sera pris en charge par des professionnels. 

Budget :

  • Coque - réfection: 4 900€
  • Hauban avant (étai): 1 900€
  • Révision système électrique + remplacements pièces: 4 900€
  • Pièces de pont: 850 €
  • Amarres et divers cordages: 270 €
  • Grutages + transports et cale-sèche: 3 000€

Total : un peu plus de 15.000€.

C’est grâce à votre participation qu’Aster pourra retrouver la mer au printemps 2019, fin prêt pour offrir un nouveau programme de navigation et d’aventures, à la hauteur de vos attentes.

Pour un soirée formation à Bruxelles ou Paris, un coucher du soleil à bord, une journée sous le vent, un week-end ou une semaine de découverte, on se donne rendez-vous à partir de Mai 2019!

 

Les contreparties :

  • 10€ - Le Mousse : votre nom ou logo sur la coque
  • 15€ - Bienvenue à Bord : votre nom ou logo sur la coque + mouchoir 100% coton "Aster Crew Member"
  • 20€ - L'Equipier : votre nom ou logo sur la coque + un T-shirt "Aster Crew Member"
  • 35€ - A la Table du Commandant : Entrée, plat, dessert et vin compris à bord.
  • 40€ - Soirée formation théorie voile à terre + dîner (Bruxelles ou Paris)
  • 65€ - Une journée de navigation + déjeuner (8p)
  • 90€ - Une nuit à bord + dîner (4p)
  • 150€ - Un week-end à bord avec skipper (6p) 
  • 300€ - Une semaine à bord avec skipper (6p)
  • 750€ - Larguez Les Amarres (6p): Réservez tout le bateau pour un week-end avec skipper.
  • 1400€ - La croisière (6p): Réservez tout le bateau pour une semaine avec skipper.
  • 2500€ - Cap transatlantique (4p): Partez pendant 3 semaines à l'aventure avec skipper

(Plus d'infos sur le coté droite de la page) 

 

Pour les indécis, pourquoi la voile ?

La navigation à voile est un moyen de transport non-polluant parce que le vent l’est aussi. Cela demande bien sûr des compétences particulières comme utiliser la radio ou lire une carte mais c’est comme le sens du vent : ça s’apprend ! La voile, c’est aussi l’expérience de faire partie d’un équipage, d’y trouver sa place et de pouvoir donner le meilleur de soi-même avec les autres. Plus que cela, c’est aussi l’apprentissage d’un mode de vie nomade et autarcique : pêche local et responsable. Le tout dans ce que la nature a laissé de mieux préservé : l’immensité bleue de ses mers et de ses océans sera toujours l’occasion d’un sentiment unique de liberté.

 

A vous de former votre équipage et d'embarquer dans l'aventure !
